Title: Civil Actions - Child Sexual Abuse - Definition, Damages, and Statute of Limitations (The Child Victims Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "sexual abuse" for purposes relating to civil actions for child sexual abuse to include any act that involves an adult allowing or encouraging a child to engage in certain activities; establishing certain limitations on damages that may be awarded under the Act; repealing the statute of limitations in certain civil actions relating to child sexual abuse; repealing a statute of repose for certain civil actions relating to child sexual abuse; providing for the retroactive application of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill, known as The Child Victims Act of 2023, significantly extends the legal time limits for filing civil actions related to child sexual abuse, removes the statute of limitations and repose for such cases, and increases damages caps. It also updates liability limits for government entities and educational institutions, and clarifies retroactive application of these changes.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education and Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Victims of child sexual abuse, educational institutions, government agencies, legal system
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive legal reform approach, removing statutes of limitations and repose, and increasing damages caps, which is a significant change in legal policy but does not involve new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily focusing on legal reforms related to child sexual abuse cases.

Title: Income Tax - Subtraction Modification - Union Dues
Synopsis: Allowing a subtraction modification under the Maryland income tax for certain union dues paid during the taxable year; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022.
bill_summary: The bill allows Maryland residents to subtract the amount of union dues paid during the taxable year from their Maryland income tax, provided those dues could have been deducted on federal taxes before 2018, with a maximum deduction of $250.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Union members and Maryland taxpayers who pay union dues
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a tax subtraction for union dues, which is a straightforward tax rule change rather than an innovative program employing new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it primarily affects individual tax deductions for union dues.

Title: Maryland State Police Gun Center – Firearms Surrendered Under Final Protective Orders
Synopsis: Altering the purpose of the Maryland State Police Gun Center to include the tracking, screening, and vetting of all firearms surrendered under final protective orders in the State; and requiring each law enforcement agency to report to the Center the number and type of firearms surrendered, the jurisdictions where the firearms were surrendered, and certain information regarding the individual who surrendered each firearm under final protective orders.
bill_summary: The bill expands the purpose of the Maryland State Police Gun Center to include tracking, screening, and vetting firearms surrendered under final protective orders, and requires law enforcement agencies to report specific information about these firearms and related crimes.
responsible_party: Maryland State Police Department
stakeholders: Individuals involved in firearm crimes and those subject to protective orders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a centralized database and reporting system to monitor firearms surrendered under protective orders and related crimes, enhancing firearm tracking and law enforcement coordination.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but may contribute to community safety and well-being.

Title: Criminal Law - Sexual Crimes - Repeal of Spousal Defense
Synopsis: Repealing a certain prohibition on prosecuting a person for rape or a certain sexual offense against a victim who was the person's legal spouse at the time of the alleged rape or sexual offense.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the legal prohibition on prosecuting a person for rape or sexual offenses against their spouse, removing the spousal defense in such cases.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or the Maryland State's Attorney's Office (implied)
stakeholders: Victims of sexual offenses, legal and law enforcement communities, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill removes a longstanding legal defense for sexual offenses against spouses, aligning Maryland law with modern understandings of consent and victim rights.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Department of General Services - Energy-Conserving Standards (Maryland Sustainable Buildings Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of General Services to establish and periodically update standards for State buildings to conserve energy and minimize adverse impacts on birds; requiring the Maryland Green Building Council to include the standards in certain requirements established for the Maryland High Performance Green Building Program; defining "State building" as one acquired, constructed, or renovated by the State or one for which 50% of the money for acquisition, construction, or renovation came from State funds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of General Services to establish and update standards for state buildings to conserve energy and minimize bird collisions, including appropriate lighting practices. It also mandates the inclusion of these standards in the Maryland High Performance Green Building Program.
responsible_party: Department of General Services
stakeholders: State government, building occupants, environmental groups, taxpayers
innovative_summary: The bill employs environmentally conscious building standards focused on bird safety and energy conservation, integrating bird-friendly design into state building practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but promotes sustainable and cost-effective building practices that could benefit public resources.

Title: Equity in Transportation Sector - Guidelines and Analyses
Synopsis: Requiring that equity be considered when State transportation plans, reports, and goals are developed; altering the membership of the advisory committee on State transportation goals; requiring the Maryland Department of Transportation to conduct transit equity analyses, cost-benefit analyses, and consult with certain communities before announcing or proposing any major service change or any reduction or cancellation of a certain capital expansion project in the construction program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Transportation and the Maryland Transit Administration to incorporate equity considerations into transportation planning, analysis, and decision-making processes, including public participation, impact assessments, and community outreach, especially when proposing service changes or project cancellations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation and Maryland Transit Administration
stakeholders: Racial and ethnic minorities, low-income populations, persons with disabilities, seniors, transit riders, community members, and local governments in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to integrating equity analysis, community engagement, and impact assessments into transportation planning and decision-making, utilizing federal guidelines and new performance indicators.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by improving transportation equity and access for underserved communities, which can facilitate better access to education, employment, and services.

Title: Correctional Officers’ Retirement System – Talbot County
Synopsis: Requiring membership in the Correctional Officers' Retirement System for certain local detention center officers of Talbot County in the event Talbot County becomes a participating governmental unit in the Correctional Officers' Retirement System; and providing that certain local detention center officers who join the Correctional Officers' Retirement System and receive certain service credit shall no longer be members of the Employees' Pension System and shall have no further rights to any benefit in the Employees' Pension System.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that Talbot County detention center officers become members of the Correctional Officers' Retirement System if the county joins it, and clarifies the transfer of service credits and benefits when this change occurs.
responsible_party: Talbot County government and Maryland State Retirement Agency
stakeholders: Local detention center officers of Talbot County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a mandatory retirement system participation for local detention officers and clarifies the transfer of service credits, which is a standard administrative process, not particularly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns retirement system membership and benefits for detention officers.

Title: Private Well Safety Act of 2023
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment to adopt regulations by December 31, 2026, to identify additional standards for water quality testing; requiring the Department, subject to certain funding and in consultation with the Department of Information Technology, to utilize an online portal to receive and upload certain information and to provide public access to the information; requiring the Department of the Environment to consistently share the information collected with the Maryland Department of Health and local health departments; etc.
bill_summary: The Private Well Safety Act of 2023 establishes a program and fund to address private well water contamination in Maryland. It includes water quality testing, remediation grants, an online portal for data sharing, and regulations for private well owners and real estate transactions.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Private well owners, households served by private wells, local health departments, real estate buyers and sellers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach including an online portal for data sharing, grants for testing and remediation, and regulations for real estate transactions, integrating technology and policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to safe water and reducing health risks associated with contaminated private wells.

Title: Equitable and Inclusive Transit-Oriented Development Enhancement Act
Synopsis: Repealing the authority of the Secretary of Transportation to designate transit-oriented development; establishing the Transit-Oriented Development Capital Grant and Revolving Loan Fund to promote the equitable and inclusive development of transit-oriented developments; authorizing the Department of Transportation to use the Fund to provide financial assistance to local jurisdictions; requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an amount sufficient to ensure a Fund balance of at least $5,000,000; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Transit–Oriented Development Capital Grant and Revolving Loan Fund to support equitable and inclusive development around transit stations in Maryland. It provides funding mechanisms, eligibility criteria, and reporting requirements to promote transit-oriented projects that enhance access and development.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Residents, local governments, private developers, and transit users in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a dedicated revolving loan and grant fund specifically for transit-oriented development, integrating equity goals and technical support, which is a relatively innovative approach to targeted transit development funding.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by improving access to transit, affordable housing, and economic opportunities in underserved communities.

Title: Hate Crimes – Civil Remedy
Synopsis: Providing that a person who is the victim of an act that would constitute a violation of certain hate crime laws may bring a civil action against the person or persons who committed the act in a court of competent jurisdiction; and authorizing the court to impose an injunction and award certain economic and noneconomic damages.
bill_summary: The bill provides victims of acts that violate hate crime laws in Maryland the right to file civil lawsuits against perpetrators, allowing for injunctions and damages including economic, noneconomic, and punitive damages, with specific limitations on emotional distress and mental anguish damages.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and legal system
stakeholders: Victims of hate crimes in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a civil remedy for hate crime victims, allowing them to seek damages and injunctions through civil lawsuits, which is a new legal avenue for addressing hate crimes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include specific programs targeting children or poverty alleviation.

Title: Family Law - Grounds for Divorce
Synopsis: Repealing the authority of the court to decree a limited divorce; and altering certain grounds for an absolute divorce.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the authority for courts to grant limited divorces and modifies the grounds and procedures for obtaining an absolute divorce in Maryland, including reducing the separation period from 12 months to 6 months.
responsible_party: Maryland Family Law Courts
stakeholders: Married individuals seeking divorce in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies divorce procedures by reducing separation requirements and eliminating limited divorce options, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily changes divorce legal processes.

Title: Primary and Secondary Education – Title IX – Notice (Hear Our Voices Act)
Synopsis: Requiring each public school to provide information to students, faculty, staff, and parents regarding who serves as the Title IX coordinator for the school, the process in place for filing a sexual misconduct complaint, and the support measures that are in place for filing a sexual misconduct complaint and how to access the support measures.
bill_summary: The bill requires all public schools in Maryland to provide information to students, staff, and parents about the Title IX coordinator, the process for filing sexual misconduct complaints, and available support measures, starting July 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Public schools in Maryland
stakeholders: Students, faculty, staff, and parents in Maryland public schools
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward informational approach to improve awareness and access to resources related to sexual misconduct and Title IX.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it focuses on information dissemination about sexual misconduct procedures.

Title: Maryland General and Limited Power of Attorney Act - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering a certain statutory form for a general power of attorney by including certain provisions informing the principal and agent of certain matters, granting general authority with respect to tangible personal property and trusts and estates, authorizing the principal to grant the agent certain specific powers relating to successor agents, compensation, gifts, or transfers and opening joint accounts and beneficiary designations, and clarifying the force and effect of the form; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's statutory forms for general and limited powers of attorney to include provisions related to governmental benefits, programs, and digital assets, and clarifies the scope and effect of these powers.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Individuals creating powers of attorney, including seniors and persons with disabilities
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal forms and clarifies legal provisions; it does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns legal forms and authority clarifications.

Title: State Board of Examiners of Psychologists - License and Registration Issuance and Renewals - Electronic Means
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Examiners of Psychologists to issue electronic licenses and registrations, except under certain circumstances; requiring the Board, on an applicant's request, to print a paper copy of the verification of licensure or registration and send it by first-class mail to the address on the application; repealing the requirement that the Board include certain information on each license and registration; and requiring the Board to send renewal notices by first-class mail under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Examiners of Psychologists to issue electronic licenses and registrations, modifies renewal notice procedures to favor electronic communication, and updates related administrative rules.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Examiners of Psychologists
stakeholders: Psychologists licensed in Maryland and the general public who receive psychological services
innovative_summary: The bill promotes the use of electronic licensing and renewal notices, streamlining administrative processes and reducing reliance on paper communications.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly updates licensing and renewal procedures for psychologists.

Title: Property Tax - Tax Sales - Notices and Payoff Amount for Redemption
Synopsis: Requiring that the holder of a certificate of sale include the e-mail address of certain persons in certain notices required to be sent to certain persons with an interest in a property that is sold at a tax sale; authorizing certain persons with an interest in owner-occupied property sold at a tax sale to request the current payoff amount to redeem the property; providing that the payoff amount to redeem the property provided by the holder of the certificate to the owner of the property is valid for 30 days; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires that notices sent in tax sale proceedings include an email address, and allows owner-occupied property owners to request the current payoff amount to redeem their property before a foreclosure complaint is filed, with specific procedures and timeframes, especially in Baltimore City.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation or relevant local tax authorities
stakeholders: Owners of owner-occupied properties sold at tax sale, local tax authorities, mortgagees, and lienholders
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new process for property owners to request the current payoff amount to redeem their property before foreclosure, including specific communication procedures and timeframes, which is a new approach to tax sale redemption.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by providing property owners with clearer and quicker options to redeem their homes, preventing displacement.

Title: Mobile and Manufactured Homes - Relocation Plans and Sales of Communities (Manufactured Housing Modernization Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Altering requirements relating to relocation plans for mobile home parks to require a plan for park residents who will be dislocated as a result of the change in land use; requiring the owner, 60 days prior to entering into a contract to sell the community, to provide notice of the terms of the offer to homeowners in the community and provide them the opportunity to purchase the housing community; requiring the Department of Housing and Community Development to list certain agencies to assist homeowners with the purchase of a community; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modernizes regulations around the sale and relocation of mobile and manufactured homes in Maryland. It requires community owners to provide relocation plans, offer homeowners the opportunity to purchase communities, and imposes notice and record-keeping requirements during sales.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Homeowners in manufactured housing communities, mobile home park residents, community owners, local governments
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive framework for community sales, including homeowner purchase rights, mandatory notices, and record-keeping, which employs new legal and procedural approaches to protect residents.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce child poverty by stabilizing housing for mobile home residents and enabling community ownership, which can lead to more affordable and stable housing options.

Title: Health Occupations - Psychologists - Licensure Qualification
Synopsis: Requiring an individual, in order to be licensed as a psychologist by the State Board of Examiners of Psychologists, to have a doctoral degree in psychology from a certain school or university, to have received a postdoctoral respecialization certificate from a certain department of psychology that included a minimum of 1,750 hours in supervised internship, and to have completed at least 1,500 hours postcertification advanced training hours or precertification hours of service as a registered psychology associate; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends the qualifications required to become a licensed psychologist in Maryland, including updates to the definitions of doctoral degrees in psychology and the requirements for licensure, such as educational credentials and supervised experience.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Examiners of Psychologists
stakeholders: Prospective and current psychologists seeking licensure in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates licensure requirements and definitions, with no new technology or innovative approach introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may improve access to qualified psychological services.

Title: Environment - On-Site Wastewater Services - Board, Fees, and Penalties
Synopsis: Altering the composition of the State Board of On-Site Wastewater Professionals; clarifying and altering the distribution of certain fees and penalties; and clarifying the application of certain license requirements and penalties.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a licensing and regulatory framework for on-site wastewater professionals in Maryland, including the creation of a State Board, licensing requirements, fee structures, and penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: On-site wastewater professionals, local governments, and residents relying on on-site wastewater systems
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured licensing system and creates a dedicated fund for regulation, which is a standard approach but with a focus on local licensing and regional representation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily through environmental health improvements.

Title: Maryland Food System Resiliency Council
Synopsis: Establishing that the Maryland Food System Resiliency Council is in the Office of Resilience in the Maryland Department of Emergency Management; and altering the process for electing a cochair of the Council.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Food System Resiliency Council within the Office of Resilience in the Maryland Department of Emergency Management, defines its membership, and sets procedures for its operation, including election of co-chairs and appointment of members.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: Food security organizations, farmers, seafood industry, food businesses, public schools, advocacy groups, and experts in food policy, climate, health, and racial equity in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill creates a comprehensive food system resiliency council with diverse stakeholders and experts, employing a collaborative and multidisciplinary approach to improve food system resilience.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve food security and access, which can reduce child poverty.

Title: Real Property – Actions to Repossess – Proof of Rental Licensure
Synopsis: Requiring, in certain actions to repossess residential rental property, a landlord to submit to the clerk of the court evidence of compliance with local rental property licensure requirements and demonstrate that the landlord is compliant with the licensure requirements.
bill_summary: The bill requires landlords in Maryland to provide proof of compliance with local rental property licensure requirements when filing for repossession of residential rental properties, and establishes procedures for demonstrating licensure status in court.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and local licensing authorities
stakeholders: Landlords, tenants, local licensing agencies, and courts in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal requirement for landlords to demonstrate compliance with local rental licensing laws during eviction proceedings, integrating licensing verification into the legal process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on legal procedures for property repossession.

Title: Commercial Law - Consumer Protection - Telephone Solicitation (Stop the Spam Calls Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from making certain telephone solicitations to a certain called party in a certain manner by restricting the methods, times, and identifying information that the person making the call may utilize; providing that the Act does not apply to certain entities and circumstances; and making a violation of the Act an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice that is subject to enforcement and penalties under the Maryland Consumer Protection Act.
bill_summary: The bill, known as the Stop the Spam Calls Act of 2023, prohibits certain telephone solicitations in Maryland by restricting methods, times, and caller identification practices, and establishes new rules and penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Consumer Protection Agency or equivalent state agency
stakeholders: Maryland residents and consumers receiving telephone solicitations
innovative_summary: The bill employs technological restrictions such as caller identification and automated call limitations to combat spam calls, representing a modern approach to consumer protection.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on regulating telemarketing practices.

Title: Courts - Judgments - Exemptions From Execution
Synopsis: Exempting up to $500 in a deposit account or other accounts of a judgment debtor held by a depository institution from execution on the judgment without an election by the debtor to exempt the money; establishing procedures a depository institution is required to follow on receipt of a writ of garnishment or other levy or attachment under certain circumstances; establishing a $6,000 limit on the cumulative value of property and cash that may be exempted; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland law to increase exemptions from judgment executions, including raising the exemption limit for deposit accounts to $500, clarifying procedures for garnishment, and establishing rules for handling exempted property.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and judicial system
stakeholders: Judgment debtors and creditors in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific procedures for garnishment of deposit accounts and clarifies exemption limits, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's provisions on exemptions could indirectly benefit low-income individuals by protecting certain assets from seizure, but it does not specifically target child poverty.

Title: Property Tax - Tax Sales - Payment of Balance After Foreclosure
Synopsis: Requiring each county to establish a process for a person entitled to  any balance over the amount required for the payment of taxes, interest, penalties, and costs of sale to claim the balance after a tax sale foreclosure; and requiring the collector of taxes for a county to notify the prior property owner, within 90 days after delivering a deed to a purchaser, of the amount of a certain balance and the process for claiming the balance.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland counties to establish a process for prior property owners to claim any remaining balance after a tax sale foreclosure, and mandates that counties notify owners of such balances and the claiming process.
responsible_party: Maryland counties' tax collection departments
stakeholders: Prior property owners who have lost property through tax foreclosure
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a standardized process for property owners to claim remaining balances after tax sales, including notification requirements, which is a new procedural approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily addresses property owner rights and procedural rules.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program – Collaborative Care Model Services – Implementation and Reimbursement Expansion
Synopsis: Repealing the Collaborative Care Pilot Program; and requiring the Maryland Department of Health to expand access to and provide reimbursement for services provided in accordance with the Collaborative Care Model under the Maryland Medical Assistance Program.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the existing Collaborative Care Pilot Program and mandates the Maryland Department of Health to implement and reimburse services based on the Collaborative Care Model across primary care settings for Medicaid recipients, expanding access and integration of somatic and behavioral health services.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Medicaid recipients, primary care providers, behavioral health providers, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs an evidence-based, integrated approach to behavioral and somatic health in primary care, with a focus on statewide implementation and reimbursement, representing a significant expansion of integrated care services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to integrated health services, which can lead to better health and social outcomes for children and families.

Title: Human Services - Maryland Statewide Independent Living Council
Synopsis: Codifying the Maryland Statewide Independent Living Council as an instrumentality of the State to submit, monitor, implement, and evaluate the State Plan under the federal Rehabilitation Act in conjunction with Centers for Independent Living in the State; and requiring the Attorney General to be the legal advisor to the Council.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Statewide Independent Living Council as an official state entity, defining its structure, responsibilities, and governance, including its relationship with Centers for Independent Living and the designated state entity responsible for supporting it.
responsible_party: Maryland Statewide Independent Living Council, with oversight and support from the Maryland State government and the Attorney General as legal advisor.
stakeholders: People with disabilities in Maryland, Centers for Independent Living, and the broader community benefiting from independent living services.
innovative_summary: The bill formalizes and clarifies the structure and governance of the independent living council, aligning state support with federal requirements, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve independence and access to services for people with disabilities, which can indirectly impact child poverty, but its direct impact is limited.

Title: Property Tax – Tax Sales – Requirement to Sell
Synopsis: Repealing certain limitations on the authority of certain local governments to set the time by which a property with taxes in arrears must be sold by the tax collector.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain limitations on the authority of local governments in Maryland to set the timing for selling properties with overdue taxes, removing the previous 2-year maximum period for such sales.
responsible_party: Local governments in Maryland (county and municipal authorities)
stakeholders: Property owners with overdue taxes, local government tax authorities, communities affected by tax sales
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes legal rules regarding tax sale timing; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns property tax sale procedures.

Title: Open Meetings Act - State Ethics Commission (Maryland State Agency Transparency Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Establishing enhanced requirements under the Open Meetings Act for the State Ethics Commission; and requiring the Department of Information Technology to provide technical staff, support, and equipment necessary to livestream the open meetings of the State Ethics Commission.
bill_summary: The bill enhances transparency requirements for certain public bodies in Maryland, including livestreaming open meetings, posting agendas and minutes online, and providing technical support for livestreaming, specifically extending these requirements to the State Ethics Commission.
responsible_party: Department of Information Technology
stakeholders: Public bodies in Maryland, including the State Ethics Commission, Maryland Transportation Authority, and Maryland Board of Elections, and the general public.
innovative_summary: The bill employs new transparency technologies such as live video streaming of meetings and requires technical support for livestreaming, which is a modern approach to government transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but promotes government transparency, which can indirectly benefit all citizens including children.

Title: Land Use - Public Service Companies - Pollinator-Friendly Vegetation Management and Utility-Designated Pollinator Areas
Synopsis: Prohibiting local jurisdictions from imposing any unreasonable limitations, including land use restrictions, on utility-designated pollinator areas maintained by a public service company under certain conditions; requiring certain public service companies to mow utility designated pollinator areas in a manner which minimizes disturbances to habitats; stating the intent of the General Assembly related to State and local laws regarding weed control and vegetation management by public service companies outside of pollinator areas; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits local jurisdictions from imposing land use restrictions on public service companies maintaining pollinator-friendly vegetation in designated areas, and sets rules for how these areas should be managed to support pollinators.
responsible_party: Public Service Companies and Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Public service companies, pollinators, environmental groups, local governments
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted approach to promote pollinator habitats by limiting land use restrictions on utility-maintained pollinator areas and establishing specific vegetation management practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on environmental and land use regulations.

Title: Certified Local Farm and Fish Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Altering the Certified Local Farm Enterprise Program to be the Certified Local Farm and Fish Program; expanding the purpose of the Program to include food from certified Chesapeake invasive species providers in the overall percentage goal of 20% of the unit's total dollar value for certain procurement contracts; and altering the Certified Local Farm Enterprise Food Aggregation Grant Fund to be the Certified Local Farm and Fish Food Aggregation Grant Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Certified Local Farm and Chesapeake Invasive Species Provider Fish Program, which promotes the procurement of food from certified local farms and Chesapeake invasive species providers, including funding and regulatory support, to increase local and invasive species-based food sourcing in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture and Maryland Agricultural and Resource–Based Industry Development Corporation
stakeholders: Local farms, Chesapeake invasive species providers, state procurement units, and Maryland residents benefiting from local food sourcing
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by integrating invasive species into local food procurement efforts and establishing a dedicated fund for food aggregation, storage, and distribution.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by increasing access to local and affordable food through government procurement and support for local producers.

Title: Circuit Courts and District Court - Dishonored Checks - Service Charges
Synopsis: Increasing the amount of the service charge from $10 to $30 that may be imposed by a circuit court or the District Court for a dishonored check.
bill_summary: The bill increases the service charge for dishonored checks in Maryland courts from $10 to $30.
responsible_party: Maryland courts (Circuit Courts and District Court)
stakeholders: Individuals who issue checks that are dishonored in Maryland courts
innovative_summary: The bill does not employ new technologies or approaches; it mainly updates the amount of a fee.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Safe Access for All (SAFE) Roads Act of 2023
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Transportation to implement all possible incremental near-term safety improvements as soon as practicable if a new approved pedestrian or bicycle safety construction or improvement project is projected to take more than 12 months to complete.
bill_summary: The Safe Access for All (SAFE) Roads Act of 2023 requires the Maryland Department of Transportation to incorporate safety features for pedestrians and bicycles in their projects, implement safety improvements promptly for long-term projects, and submit reports on staffing, project delays, and pedestrian crossing plans, especially in high-density and transit-dependent areas.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Pedestrians, bicyclists, residents of high-density and transit-dependent areas, transportation agencies
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes context-driven design elements and immediate safety improvements for pedestrian and bicycle safety, and mandates detailed reporting and planning, employing data-driven and strategic approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve safety and accessibility in underserved areas, which can contribute to reducing child poverty by improving safe access to schools and community resources.

Title: Business Regulation - Charitable Organizations
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "charitable contribution" to exclude an authorization for or a discount on the use of certain services or materials, equipment, or facilities for purposes of provisions of law regulating charitable organizations and charitable representatives; authorizing the Maryland Secretary of State to accept certain documentation in place of an audit or review in connection with a charitable organization's registration statement; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland laws regulating charitable organizations by redefining 'charitable contribution' to exclude certain property donations and service discounts, streamlining registration requirements, and allowing the Secretary of State to accept alternative documentation instead of audits or reviews.
responsible_party: Maryland Secretary of State
stakeholders: Charitable organizations and donors in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a more flexible registration process for certain charitable organizations, including accepting alternative documentation instead of audits, which is a new approach to regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to improve the operation of charitable organizations that serve vulnerable populations, indirectly impacting child poverty.

Title: Public Schools - Anaphylactic Food Allergies - Guidelines
Synopsis: Requiring each county board of education, before the start of the 2024-2025 school year, to adopt, implement, and publish guidelines in accordance with the State school health service guidelines to reduce the risk of exposure to anaphylactic major food allergens in classrooms and common areas; requiring each public school to develop a system to disclose the major food allergens contained in the foods served in the school; requiring each county board to make a good faith effort to adopt certain guidelines; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland public schools to adopt guidelines to reduce the risk of anaphylactic food allergies, including disclosure of major food allergens in school foods and establishing safety procedures for students with allergies.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Students with food allergies, parents, school staff, and school administrators
innovative_summary: The program employs comprehensive allergy management guidelines, allergen disclosure systems, and safety procedures, integrating health and safety practices into school operations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving safety and inclusion for students with allergies, which can support their well-being and participation in school.

Title: Property Tax - Tax Sales - Redemption
Synopsis: Requiring a tax collector to make certain attempts to contact a certain plaintiff or holder of a certificate of sale regarding certain expenses; and authorizing a collector to redeem certain property without a certain satisfaction letter if a plaintiff or holder of a certificate of sale fails to respond within 5 days after certain attempts by the collector to make contact.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland property tax law related to tax sales and redemption procedures. It requires tax collectors to attempt contact with holders of certificates of sale via phone and email before redeeming property without a satisfaction letter, and clarifies reimbursement rules for expenses incurred during tax sale and redemption processes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Property owners, tax sale holders, local government agencies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new contact protocol for tax collectors to improve communication with certificate holders before redemption, but does not employ new technologies or approaches beyond existing procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty, as they mainly address procedural aspects of property tax sales.

Title: Disclosure of Tax Information – Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board – Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing, subject to certain limitations, the disclosure of a business entity's federal employer identification number, name, physical address, mailing address, contact name, e-mail address, and phone number to the Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board and its authorized contractors for the purposes of administering the Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Program and Trust.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board and its contractors to access certain tax information from the Maryland Comptroller for the purpose of administering the Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Program and Trust.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller and Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board
stakeholders: Small business owners and entities participating in the Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Program
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted approach to sharing tax information specifically for a new retirement savings program, with strict limitations and safeguards, representing a specialized use of government data sharing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to support small business employees' retirement security, which can indirectly impact child poverty by improving family financial stability.

Title: Local Government - Regulatory Powers - Regulation of Invasive Bamboo
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing bodies of counties and municipalities to adopt ordinances to regulate invasive bamboo, including by prohibiting a person from selling, planting, and allowing invasive bamboo to grow on the property of the person without proper upkeep and appropriate containment measures.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Maryland counties and municipalities to adopt ordinances regulating invasive bamboo, including prohibiting its sale, planting, and growth without proper containment measures, and establishing fines for violations.
responsible_party: County and municipal governing bodies in Maryland
stakeholders: Property owners, local governments, environmental agencies, and communities affected by invasive bamboo
innovative_summary: The bill introduces local regulatory powers specifically targeting invasive bamboo, including enforcement mechanisms and fines, which is a targeted environmental regulation approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly addresses environmental regulation.

Title: Ground Leases - Collection of Rent, Interest, Fees, and Other Expenses - Registration Requirements
Synopsis: Establishing that ground leases or amendments that are not posted on the State Department of Assessments and Taxation's website are not considered registered or amended; prohibiting a ground lease holder from collecting or attempting to collect rent, late fees, interest, collection costs, and other expenses related to a ground lease unless the ground lease is registered with the Department; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a registration requirement for ground leases in Maryland, prohibits collection efforts on unregistered leases, and creates a process for disputes over collection efforts, including a Department review and court proceedings.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Ground lease holders and leasehold tenants in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs an online registry, formal dispute resolution processes, and legal enforcement mechanisms, integrating technology and legal procedures to regulate ground lease collections.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on ground lease regulation and dispute resolution may indirectly impact affordable housing and economic stability, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Residential Ground Leases - Redemption and Extinguishment - Requirements
Synopsis: Repealing the prohibition against a tenant who is seeking to redeem or extinguish ground rent providing certain documentation and payments to the State Department of Assessments and Taxation earlier than 90 days after an application for redemption or extinguishment has been posted on the Department's website.
bill_summary: The bill revises procedures for leasehold tenants to redeem or extinguish ground rents, including posting notices online for at least 90 days before payment and certification, and clarifies the process for properties acquired by Baltimore City.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Leasehold tenants, ground lease holders, property owners, Baltimore City residents
innovative_summary: The program employs an online notice posting system and formal certification process for ground rent redemption and extinguishment, integrating technology into property law procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to impact child poverty by clarifying property rights and possibly facilitating redevelopment, but direct effects are limited.

Title: Condominiums - Mandatory Insurance Coverage - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the types of elements and units for which a council of unit owners is required to maintain certain property insurance and altering certain requirements for the property insurance policy; and requiring owners of detached units to carry homeowners insurance on the entirety of the unit.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland laws to specify insurance requirements for condominiums, including mandatory property and liability insurance maintained by the council of unit owners, and requires owners of detached units to carry homeowners insurance on their entire units.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Condominium and detached homeowners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies and updates existing insurance requirements for condominiums and detached units, without introducing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns property insurance regulations for condominiums and detached units.

Title: Real Property - Actions for Possession - Pet Protections
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Agriculture to publish a fact sheet on the protection of pets in the event of an eviction or any other loss of possession of real property; requiring a landlord to provide a link to the fact sheet on the Department's website at the execution of a lease on or after November 1, 2023; requiring the Maryland Judiciary to provide a link to the fact sheet at certain times; requiring a sheriff or any other official to return a pet to a tenant or certain other person or to contact an animal shelter or rescue organization; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Agriculture to develop and regularly update a fact sheet on pet care and protection during evictions or loss of property. It mandates landlords to provide a link to this fact sheet when a lease is signed if tenants have pets, and requires the Maryland Judiciary to include the link with relevant warrants. The bill also requires officials to inspect for pets during property possession transfers and to ensure pets are not left on public property.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture and Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Tenants with pets, landlords, animal rescue organizations, animal shelters, property officials
innovative_summary: The program employs a proactive approach by providing accessible pet care information and integrating pet protections into legal and property processes, utilizing online resources and official procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by protecting pets, which can contribute to family stability and well-being.

Title: Municipalities - Charter Amendments - Notice
Synopsis: Modifying the manner in which the chief executive officer of a municipality may fulfill certain notice requirements concerning proposed municipal charter amendments; and requiring the municipality to maintain certain records or receipts and make the records or receipts available to the public.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the procedures for municipalities in Maryland to provide notice of charter amendments, including requirements for posting notices, publishing summaries in newspapers, and delivering summaries to residents, while also mandating record-keeping and public access to delivery receipts.
responsible_party: Municipalities of Maryland (local government)
stakeholders: Municipal governments and residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes and enhances transparency in municipal notice procedures by requiring record-keeping and public access to delivery receipts, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on procedural transparency.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program, Maryland Children's Health Program, and Workgroup on Low-Income Utility Assistance
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to establish an Express Lane Eligibility Program by January 1, 2025, to enroll individuals, based on certain eligibility, in the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and the Maryland Children's Health Program; and requiring the Workgroup on Low-Income Utility Assistance to submit a final report to certain committees of the General Assembly by January 1, 2024, of its findings and recommendations, including recommended legislative and regulatory changes.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to establish an Express Lane Eligibility Program to automatically enroll individuals into the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and the Maryland Children’s Health Program based on their eligibility for the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, starting by January 1, 2025. It also mandates the Workgroup on Low–Income Utility Assistance to submit final reports by January 1, 2024, with recommendations on utility assistance programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Low-income individuals and families eligible for Medicaid, CHIP, SNAP, and utility assistance programs in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill employs an innovative approach by establishing an Express Lane Eligibility Program that leverages existing eligibility data from SNAP to streamline enrollment in health programs, potentially increasing efficiency and coverage.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing access to health coverage for children in low-income families through streamlined enrollment.

Title: Worcester County - Alcoholic Beverages - Ocean City Promoter's License
Synopsis: Establishing an Ocean City promoter's license in Worcester County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Worcester County to issue the license to a for-profit organization to sell and serve beer, wine, and liquor at an entertainment event that is held on premises located within the corporate limits of the Town of Ocean City, owned by the Town of Ocean City, and approved in writing by the Ocean City Police Department; and authorizing a license fee of $5,000 per entertainment event.
bill_summary: The bill establishes an Ocean City promoter's license in Worcester County, allowing for-profit organizations to sell and serve alcohol at designated entertainment events within Ocean City, subject to regulations and approval.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Worcester County
stakeholders: Event organizers, alcohol consumers, local businesses, residents of Ocean City
innovative_summary: The program introduces a specialized alcohol license for entertainment events in Ocean City, with regulations on issuance and conduct, representing a targeted approach to alcohol licensing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include specific measures to impact it.

Title: Ground Leases – Notices and Billing – Forms and Requirements
Synopsis: Prohibiting a leasehold tenant of an unregistered ground lease from being required to hold more than 3 years of ground rent in escrow; requiring a ground lease holder to mail certain notices or bills to a leasehold tenant in a certain manner under certain circumstances; requiring the State Department of Assessments and Taxation to make available on its website the form a ground lease holder must use to provide a leasehold tenant bills or notices; etc.
bill_summary: This bill regulates ground leases in Maryland, including requirements for notices, billing, escrow limits, and transfer notifications, and promotes the redemption of ground rents.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Ground lease tenants and leaseholders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs standardized forms and online resources to improve transparency and communication between ground lease parties.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on property and leasehold regulations.

Title: Mental Health - Treatment Plans for Individuals in Facilities and Resident Grievance System
Synopsis: Requiring a treatment plan for an individual with a mental disorder admitted to a certain health care facility to include a discharge goal and an estimate of the probable length of the inpatient stay before the individual can be transferred to a certain setting; requiring certain facility staff to review and reassess a plan of treatment within certain time periods; requiring the Department of Health to report annually to the General Assembly on the Resident Grievance System and the grievances received related to State facilities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that treatment plans for individuals with mental disorders in facilities include discharge goals and estimated stay length, and establishes procedures for review, reassessment, and participation of family members. It also creates an appeals process for treatment plan reviews and requires annual reporting on the Resident Grievance System.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with mental disorders in state facilities and their families
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive, structured approach to treatment planning, review, and grievance processes, including formal participation and appeals, which is a significant enhancement of existing mental health care procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily focuses on treatment planning and grievance procedures for mental health facilities.

Title: Vehicle Laws – HOV Lanes – Plug–In Electric Drive Vehicles
Synopsis: Authorizing certain plug-in electric drive vehicles for which a permit has been issued by the Motor Vehicle Administration to use high occupancy vehicle (HOV) lanes regardless of the number of passengers in the vehicles; requiring the Administration to charge a fee, not to exceed $20, for issuing the permit; and requiring, on or before January 1 each year, a report to be submitted to the Governor and the General Assembly on the effect of the use of the plug-in electric drive vehicle permits on the operation of HOV lanes.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain plug-in electric drive vehicles with permits to use high occupancy vehicle (HOV) lanes regardless of the number of passengers, and establishes a permit system and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation and State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Owners of plug-in electric drive vehicles, commuters using HOV lanes, transportation agencies
innovative_summary: The program introduces a permit system allowing electric vehicles to access HOV lanes regardless of occupancy, which is a new approach to incentivize electric vehicle use and manage lane access.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on transportation policy.

Title: Mandated Reports - Revisions
Synopsis: Modifying certain reporting requirements for practicability and efficiency; and repealing certain reporting requirements that are unnecessary, obsolete, duplicative, or inefficient.
bill_summary: This bill primarily revises and repeals various reporting requirements across multiple Maryland state agencies and programs to improve efficiency, reduce unnecessary reports, and update reporting procedures and deadlines.
responsible_party: Various Maryland state agencies and departments as specified in the bill
stakeholders: Maryland state government agencies, program participants, and the general public affected by the programs and reporting requirements
innovative_summary: The bill does not introduce new technologies or approaches; it mainly streamlines and updates existing reporting processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns administrative reporting requirements.

Title: District Court - Small Claims - Enforcement of Money Judgments
Synopsis: Prohibiting the District Court, in aid of enforcement or execution of a money judgment resulting from a certain small claim action, from ordering the appearance of an individual for an examination or ordering an individual to answer interrogatories.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits the District Court in Maryland from ordering individuals to appear for examinations or answer interrogatories in aid of enforcing or executing small claims money judgments.
responsible_party: Maryland District Court system
stakeholders: Individuals involved in small claims court cases, particularly defendants and judgment creditors
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal restriction on the enforcement process in small claims cases, simplifying procedures but not employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly changes enforcement procedures in small claims cases.

Title: Private Passenger Motor Vehicle Liability Insurance - Enhanced Underinsured Motorist Coverage - Opt-Out Option
Synopsis: Converting enhanced underinsured motorist coverage from an opt-in offering of coverage into an opt-out coverage option under provisions of law establishing requirements for private passenger motor vehicle liability insurance; requiring the Maryland Insurance Administration to conduct a study on the impact of converting enhanced underinsured motorist coverage to an opt-out coverage option and report its findings to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly by December 31, 2026, and December 31, 2028; etc.
bill_summary: The bill converts enhanced underinsured motorist coverage from an opt-in to an opt-out option in Maryland's private passenger vehicle insurance policies, and requires a study on its impact.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Private vehicle owners and insured drivers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a default opt-out approach for insurance coverage, which is a behavioral economics strategy to increase coverage uptake.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving insurance coverage and reducing financial hardship after accidents.

Title: Criminal Law – Unnatural or Perverted Sexual Practice – Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the crime of unnatural or perverted sexual practice.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the criminal offense of unnatural or perverted sexual practices in Maryland law, removing it from the list of crimes and related legal provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Legislature and Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Individuals accused or convicted of the now-repealed sexual conduct crimes, legal professionals, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill primarily removes an outdated criminal offense from the law, with no new technologies or approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Heating, Ventilation, Air-Conditioning, and Refrigeration Services - Journeyman License - Qualifications
Synopsis: Altering certain qualifications for a journeyman license to provide heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration services to require having held an apprentice license for 4 rather than 3 years and having completed at least 6,000 rather than 1,875 hours of training under the direction and control of a licensed contractor.
bill_summary: The bill changes the qualifications for obtaining a journeyman license in heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration services in Maryland, increasing the required training hours from 1,875 to 6,000 hours and the apprenticeship duration from 3 to 4 years.
responsible_party: Maryland Board for Heating, Ventilation, Air-Conditioning, and Refrigeration Services
stakeholders: Individuals seeking to become licensed HVACR journeymen in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates licensing requirements and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly affects licensing requirements for professionals.

Title: Unemployment Insurance - Recovery of Benefits - Limitation and Methods
Synopsis: Limiting the percentage of the weekly benefits amount that the Secretary of Labor may deduct from weekly benefits payable to a claimant to recover certain overpayments of unemployment insurance benefits to 50% of the weekly benefit or 25% if the benefit is less than $100; and clarifying the circumstances under which the Secretary may use certain methods to recover overpayments of unemployment insurance benefits.
bill_summary: The bill limits the percentage of weekly unemployment benefits that can be deducted to recover overpayments, clarifies the methods the Secretary of Labor can use to recover overpaid benefits, and adjusts the effective date of these provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Unemployment benefit claimants in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies and limits existing recovery methods for unemployment overpayments, without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may indirectly affect low-income families receiving unemployment benefits.

Title: State Government – Commission on LGBTQIA+ Affairs – Alterations
Synopsis: Renaming the Commission on LGBTQ Affairs to be the Commission on LGBTQIA+ Affairs; increasing the number of members of the Commission from 15 to 21; altering certain qualifications for members appointed to the Commission; staggering the terms of Commission members; and altering the duties of the Commission.
bill_summary: The bill renames the Commission on LGBTQ Affairs to the Commission on LGBTQIA+ Affairs, modifies its membership, terms, and duties, and establishes its structure within the Governor's Office of Community Initiatives.
responsible_party: Governor's Office of Community Initiatives
stakeholders: LGBTQIA+ community and related stakeholders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill enhances the structure and scope of the existing commission, including data collection, best practices, and reporting, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but aims to improve inclusion and support for LGBTQIA+ individuals, which may indirectly benefit affected populations.

Title: Real Estate Brokers - Inactive Licenses - Requirements After Expiration
Synopsis: Requiring a person who fails to reactivate a real estate broker license on inactive status within 3 years to comply with specified requirements to obtain a license.
bill_summary: The bill updates the requirements for reactivating inactive real estate broker licenses in Maryland, including conditions for reactivation, fees, and continuing education requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Real estate brokers, associate brokers, and salespersons in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies licensing procedures and requirements, with no new technologies or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns licensing procedures for real estate professionals.

Title: Howard County - Alcoholic Beverages - Public Hearing Ho. Co. 13-23
Synopsis: Exempting applications for changing certain resident agents from the requirement that the Board of License Commissioners for Howard County hold a public hearing on the applications; and authorizing the Board to hold a public hearing on certain applications if the Board determines there is good cause for the hearing.
bill_summary: The bill modifies alcohol licensing procedures in Howard County by exempting certain applications for changing resident agents from the requirement of a public hearing, unless the Board determines there is good cause.
responsible_party: Howard County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license applicants and residents of Howard County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a streamlined process for certain license changes, reducing the need for public hearings in specific cases.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly changes administrative procedures for alcohol licensing.

Title: Maryland Electricians Act - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the entity that must administer or approve an apprenticeship program for electricians; substituting the term "uninsured" for the term "inactive" in certain provisions of law relating to liability insurance requirements for certain electricians; prohibiting a certain electrician from contracting to provide electrical services unless the electrical work is covered by certain liability insurance; specifying who is authorized and required to purchase certain insurance; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises regulations for electricians in Maryland, including changes to apprenticeship program administration, insurance requirements, and licensing procedures, and introduces provisions for 'uninsured' status for licensees.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Electricians
stakeholders: Electricians, electrical contractors, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal and regulatory frameworks for electricians, with some new provisions for insurance and licensing status, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on licensing and insurance regulations for electricians.

Title: Housing and Community Development - Adaptive Reuse
Synopsis: Establishing that adaptive reuse, retrofitting, and repurposing of existing buildings to develop new affordable multifamily housing is an eligible use of certain financial assistance provided by the Department of Housing and Community Development; requiring the Department to notify applicants for certain financial assistance that adaptive reuse is an eligible use of funds; and providing that the notice requirement does not apply to individuals applying for loans from the Department that are not focused on housing.
bill_summary: The bill establishes that adaptive reuse of existing buildings to create affordable multifamily housing is an eligible use of certain financial assistance provided by the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development. It requires the department to notify applicants that adaptive reuse is an eligible use of funds.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Individuals seeking affordable multifamily housing, developers, and communities involved in housing development
innovative_summary: The bill promotes the innovative approach of adaptive reuse of existing buildings for affordable housing, encouraging sustainable development and efficient use of existing structures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By facilitating the development of affordable multifamily housing through adaptive reuse, the bill has the potential to directly reduce child poverty by increasing access to affordable housing.

Title: Real Property - Residential Leases - Notification of Rent Increases
Synopsis: Prohibiting a landlord from including a certain term in a lease pertaining to electronic delivery of the notice of a rent increase; requiring a landlord to notify a tenant in writing before increasing the tenant's rent through first-class mail or, if elected by the tenant, electronic delivery; requiring a county or municipality that adopts a certain local law related to limitations on rent increases to report annually certain information on building permits issued for multifamily dwellings intended as rental housing; etc.
bill_summary: The bill regulates rent increase notices and limits, requiring landlords to notify tenants in advance of rent hikes and prohibiting certain lease provisions related to electronic notices. It also mandates reporting on building permits for rental housing in jurisdictions with rent control laws.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Tenants and landlords in Maryland, especially in jurisdictions with rent control laws
innovative_summary: The bill introduces standardized notification procedures for rent increases and requires reporting on rental housing development, integrating legal and administrative measures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on rent increase procedures and reporting.

Title: Department of Agriculture - Urban Agriculture Grant Programs - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the purpose and contents of and the requirements and qualifications under the Urban Agriculture Grant Fund; requiring the Governor, in each of fiscal years 2025 through 2029, to include at least $100,000 for the Fund in the annual budget bill; establishing the Urban Agriculture Advisory Committee to recommend guidelines, policies, and practices for the implementation of the Grant Program; and requiring the Advisory Committee to report to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 30, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland's urban agriculture grant programs by expanding their purpose, establishing advisory committees, and clarifying eligibility and distribution requirements for grants to support urban farming and improve access to urban-grown foods.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Urban agricultural producers, nonprofit organizations, institutions of higher education, and communities in urban areas of Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces advisory committees and specific distribution and eligibility criteria to enhance urban agriculture initiatives, employing structured oversight and targeted community benefits.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by increasing access to local foods and supporting urban farming communities.

Title: Baltimore City Board of School Commissioners - Student Members and Task Force to Study Compensation and Student Members
Synopsis: Altering the voting rights of and the process for selecting a student member of the Baltimore City Board of School Commissioners; prohibiting the student member from voting on matters before the board relating to personnel and collective bargaining decisions; establishing the Task Force to Study Compensation and Student Members of the Baltimore City Board of School Commissioners; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by April 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the voting rights and selection process for student members of the Baltimore City Board of School Commissioners, establishes a task force to study the compensation and potential addition of a second student member, and sets reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Office of the Mayor of Baltimore City and Baltimore City Board of School Commissioners
stakeholders: Students in Baltimore City Public Schools, Baltimore City residents, school administrators, and policymakers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal study and potential implementation of paid student representatives on a school board, including exploring new compensation and representation models.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by increasing student engagement and representation, which can influence policies affecting students' well-being.

Title: Howard County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Residency Requirements Ho. Co. 11-23
Synopsis: Providing that a resident of the State meets certain residency requirements for an applicant for an alcoholic beverages license in Howard County.
bill_summary: The bill amends residency requirements for applying for alcoholic beverage licenses in Howard County, Maryland, including clarifying that residents of the state meet certain residency criteria and modifying support petition requirements.
responsible_party: Howard County Alcoholic Beverages Licensing Board
stakeholders: Applicants for alcoholic beverage licenses, residents of Howard County and Maryland, businesses involved in alcohol sales
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal requirements and procedures for licensing, with no new technology or innovative approach introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns licensing rules.

Title: Northeast Maryland Waste Disposal Authority - Evaluation, Termination of Bond Authority, and Assumption of Functions, Employees, and Contracts (Northeast Maryland Waste Disposal Authority Sunset Act)
Synopsis: Prohibiting the Northeast Maryland Waste Disposal Authority from issuing bonds beginning June 1, 2023; requiring the Department of Legislative Services to evaluate the Authority providing enough detail for the General Assembly to determine whether the Authority should continue in its current form; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the Northeast Maryland Waste Disposal Authority from issuing bonds starting June 1, 2023, and mandates a comprehensive evaluation of its functions, effectiveness, and necessity. It also requires the Maryland Environmental Service to review and analyze whether it can assume the Authority's functions, employees, and contracts, with the goal of potentially merging the Authority into the Maryland Environmental Service.
responsible_party: Department of Legislative Services and Maryland Environmental Service
stakeholders: Maryland residents, local governments, and environmental agencies involved in waste disposal and recycling
