innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive review and potential merger approach, utilizing evaluations and analyses to streamline waste management agencies, which is a strategic and integrated approach to government restructuring.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but could indirectly benefit public health and environmental quality.

Title: Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System - Crisfield Police Department
Synopsis: Requiring membership in the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System for certain local law enforcement officers of the Crisfield Police Department under certain circumstances; providing that a certain individual is entitled to eligibility service and creditable service that was earned before the effective date of the Crisfield Police Department's participation in the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System; providing for the transfer of creditable service for a certain individual; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that certain law enforcement officers of the Crisfield Police Department become members of the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System when the department joins the system, and it allows for the transfer of pension credits from previous employment to the new system.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency or relevant pension system administrator
stakeholders: Crisfield Police Department officers and local government
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a process for transferring pension credits and mandates participation in a pension system, which is a standard approach but involves specific transfer procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns pension system participation for law enforcement officers.

Title: Sexual Offenses - Crime of Violence and Lifetime Supervision
Synopsis: Altering the list of crimes included within a certain definition of "crime of violence" to include sexual abuse of a minor if the offender is at least 21 years old and the victim is under the age of 16 years; and requiring a sentence for certain persons convicted of certain sexual abuse crimes to include a term of lifetime sexual offender supervision.
bill_summary: The bill enhances the definition of 'crime of violence' to include certain sexual offenses involving minors and mandates lifetime supervision for certain convicted sex offenders, including conditions and procedures for supervision.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Sex offenders, minors, law enforcement, judicial system, general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs comprehensive lifetime supervision conditions, including technology monitoring and restrictions, representing a thorough approach to managing sex offenders.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but aims to protect minors from sexual abuse.

Title: Public Utilities - Energy Efficiency and Conservation Programs - Energy Performance Targets and Low-Income Housing
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Housing and Community Development to procure or provide for electricity customers energy efficiency and conservation programs and services designed to achieve certain target annual incremental gross energy savings for the 2024-2026 program cycle; establishing the Green and Healthy Task Force to develop policy and statutory recommendations to eliminate barriers to low-income households achieving, energy-efficient, affordable, and low-emissions housing; requiring an annual report beginning July 1, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the Maryland Public Service Commission to include information on low-income energy efficiency programs in its annual report, and requires the Department of Housing and Community Development to procure or provide energy efficiency and conservation programs aimed at achieving specific annual energy savings targets for low-income households. It establishes a Green and Healthy Task Force to coordinate resources and develop plans to provide energy efficiency retrofits to all low-income households by 2031, and includes provisions for funding, contractor job requirements, and program oversight.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development and Maryland Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Low-income households and communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive, coordinated approach to energy efficiency, leveraging multiple funding sources and establishing a dedicated task force to develop long-term retrofit plans for all low-income households, which is a relatively innovative approach in government programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to directly impact child poverty by reducing energy costs and improving housing conditions for low-income families.

Title: Health Occupations - Licensed Athletic Trainers - Dry Needling Approval
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Physicians to approve licensed athletic trainers to perform dry needling, a certain type of intramuscular manual therapy involving the insertion of one or more solid needles into the muscle and related tissues to effect change in the muscle and related tissues, as a specialized task; requiring 80 hours of instruction in a certain continuing education course, including 40 hours of practical, hands-on instruction under the guidance of a certain licensed health care practitioner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Physicians to approve licensed athletic trainers to perform dry needling, a specific manual therapy involving needle insertion into muscles, under certain training and supervision requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Physicians
stakeholders: Licensed athletic trainers and their patients, particularly athletes and individuals with musculoskeletal impairments
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new specialized task for athletic trainers, including specific training and approval processes, which is a new approach to expanding scope of practice.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily pertains to professional scope and training of athletic trainers.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Victims of Sexually Assaultive Behavior
Synopsis: Requiring a certain assistant State's Attorney with knowledge of the case to meet with a victim of sexually assaultive behavior or the victim's representative within 20 days after receiving a request from the victim regarding a decision by the Office of the State's Attorney  not to file a charging document or to dismiss charges against an alleged suspect; requiring the assistant State's Attorney, at the meeting, to explain the justification for a certain decision; and establishing certain requirements for the meeting.
bill_summary: The bill requires an assistant State's Attorney to meet with victims of sexually assaultive behavior within 20 days if charges are dismissed or not filed, to explain the reasons.
responsible_party: Office of the State’s Attorney in Maryland
stakeholders: Victims of sexually assaultive behavior in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a mandated meeting between victims and prosecutors to improve communication and transparency, which is a procedural enhancement rather than a technological innovation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Baltimore County Board of Education - Student Member - Voting and Training
Synopsis: Authorizing the student member of the Baltimore County Board of Education to vote on capital and operating budget matters; requiring certain members of the county board and the executive leadership of the Baltimore County public school system to develop a certain draft curriculum for budget training for student members of the county board and submit the draft curriculum to the county board for review; and requiring each student member of the board to complete the budget training within 2 months of the student's election to the board.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the student member of the Baltimore County Board of Education to vote on budget matters, requires the development of a budget training curriculum, and mandates that student members complete this training within two months of election to be eligible to vote on budget issues.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Board of Education and Baltimore County Public School System
stakeholders: Student members of the Baltimore County Board of Education, Baltimore County public school students, and the Baltimore County community
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured training program for student board members on budget processes, enhancing their capacity to participate in financial decision-making.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on student governance and education.

Title: State Designations – State Spirit – Maryland Rye
Synopsis: Designating Maryland Rye or Maryland Rye Whiskey as the State spirit.
bill_summary: The bill designates Maryland Rye or Maryland Rye Whiskey as the official state spirit of Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland General Assembly / State of Maryland
stakeholders: Maryland residents, local distilleries, and the state's cultural heritage
innovative_summary: The bill is a straightforward legislative designation without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland Estate Tax - Portability - Time Period for Election
Synopsis: Altering the period of time within which a person is required to file a Maryland estate tax return for the purpose of allowing a surviving spouse to take into account the deceased spousal unused exclusion amount to be consistent with the time for making a federal election; and applying the Act retroactively to any decedents dying on or after January 1, 2019.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland estate tax law to change the deadline for filing estate tax returns for the purpose of allowing a surviving spouse to use the deceased spouse's unused estate tax exclusion amount. It also makes the change retroactive to deaths on or after January 1, 2019, and sets the new law to take effect on July 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Surviving spouses and estate planners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal procedures and deadlines related to estate tax filings; it does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Income Tax - Subtraction Modification for Adoption Expenses - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering eligibility for and the amount of a subtraction modification under the Maryland income tax for a taxpayer who adopts a child during the taxable year.
bill_summary: The bill increases the Maryland income tax subtraction modification for adoption expenses, raising the limits for adopting children with special needs and those without, and clarifies eligibility based on residency status.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Individuals adopting children in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily adjusts tax deduction limits for adoption expenses, which is a policy change rather than an innovative program employing new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could indirectly impact child poverty by reducing financial barriers to adoption, potentially increasing the number of children adopted.

Title: Real Property - Unlawfully Restrictive Covenants - Modification by Counties or Municipalities
Synopsis: Authorizing a county or municipality to execute and record a restrictive covenant modification to an unlawfully restrictive covenant for a property within the boundaries of the county or municipality after providing persons with an ownership interest in the property with 30 days' written notice; and providing that persons with an ownership interest in property that is subject to an unlawfully restrictive covenant may decline action by a county or municipality to execute and record a restrictive covenant modification.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Maryland counties and municipalities to modify unlawfully restrictive covenants related to race, religion, or national origin on properties within their boundaries, provided certain notice and consent procedures are followed.
responsible_party: Maryland county and municipal governments, through their county attorneys and circuit court clerks
stakeholders: Property owners, residents, and communities affected by restrictive covenants, especially those impacted by racial, religious, or national origin restrictions
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal process for counties and municipalities to modify unlawfully restrictive covenants, including notification, review, and recording procedures, leveraging legal and administrative processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on property rights and anti-discrimination measures.

Title: State Personnel - Education and Transportation - Grievance Procedures
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain employee or certain exclusive representative to initiate a grievance procedure under certain provisions of law; requiring certain decision makers in a grievance procedure in certain higher education systems to award certain damages under certain circumstances; requiring certain employee grievance procedures to include certain redress for certain violations; requiring the Secretary of Transportation to be consistent with certain provisions of law and include redress for certain violations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates and clarifies grievance procedures for employees in Maryland's state personnel, education, and transportation sectors, including provisions for damages, redress, and disciplinary actions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Transportation, Maryland Higher Education Commission, and other relevant state agencies
stakeholders: State employees in education, transportation, and other state agencies, including faculty, staff, and contractual employees
innovative_summary: The bill introduces comprehensive grievance procedures, including damages and redress for violations, and standardizes disciplinary and appeal processes across multiple state sectors, employing a more structured approach to employee rights and redress.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily focuses on employee grievance procedures and workplace rights.

Title: Nonpublic Schools and Child Care Providers - Corporal Punishment - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting the State Board of Education from issuing a certificate of approval to noncollegiate educational institutions that do not have a policy prohibiting the administration of corporal punishment; requiring regulations adopted by the State Board for the registration of family child care homes and large family child care homes and the licensing and operation of child care centers to prohibit corporal punishment; and requiring the State Board to identify certain methods in a certain overall plan.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the use of corporal punishment in nonpublic schools and child care providers in Maryland. It requires the State Board of Education to identify methods for eliminating corporal punishment and mandates regulations to prohibit its administration in child care settings and nonpublic schools, including certification and approval processes.
responsible_party: State Board of Education
stakeholders: Students, children in child care, nonpublic schools, child care providers
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive regulatory approach to eliminate corporal punishment across various educational and child care settings, including certification, approval, and licensing regulations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by promoting safer and more supportive environments for children, which can contribute to better educational and developmental outcomes.

Title: Victim Services Programs – Supplementing Federal Funding and Support (Victim Services Stabilization Act)
Synopsis: Providing for the stable funding and support of trauma-informed, high-quality programs and services for victims of crime; requiring the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services to help support certain programs providing services for victims of crime; requiring the Office to consult with certain individuals and organizations regarding the allocation of certain funding; and requiring the Governor to include certain funding in the State budget.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a program to support and fund victim services across Maryland by supplementing federal funding, ensuring stability and continuity of services for crime victims, and creating a process for awarding grants to organizations providing these services.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Victims of crime and organizations providing victim services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a coordinated approach to supplement federal funding, prioritize equitable distribution, and ensure ongoing support for victim services, integrating federal and state resources.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to directly impact child poverty by supporting victims of crime, including children, through stable and accessible services.

Title: Natural Resources - Wildlife Advisory Commission - Membership
Synopsis: Increasing the membership of the Wildlife Advisory Commission; requiring the Governor to appoint a member to the Wildlife Advisory Commission who is an academic researcher with expertise in wildlife biology, wildlife conservation, wildlife management, or ecology; and requiring the membership of the Commission to include representation from the farming, hunting, wildlife preservation, and passive wildlife recreation communities.
bill_summary: The bill increases the membership of the Maryland Wildlife Advisory Commission from 9 to 10 members, requires the appointment of an academic researcher with expertise in wildlife-related fields, and mandates representation from various stakeholder communities including farming, hunting, wildlife preservation, and passive wildlife recreation.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Wildlife conservation communities, hunters, farmers, passive wildlife recreation enthusiasts, and the general public interested in wildlife management
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new requirement for the appointment of an academic researcher with expertise in wildlife fields and emphasizes diverse stakeholder representation, reflecting a more inclusive and expertise-driven approach to wildlife management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include specific programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Automatic Expungement - Clarification
Synopsis: Clarifying the language of provisions of law requiring the expungement of certain records maintained by the State or a political subdivision of the State relating to the charging of certain offenses under certain circumstances and notification of a certain right to expungement.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the laws regarding automatic expungement of certain police and court records related to specific charges, specifying the timeline and notification process for expungement and rights to expungement.
responsible_party: Maryland State Court System and Law Enforcement Agencies
stakeholders: Individuals with charges that are eligible for expungement, law enforcement agencies, courts, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies existing laws on expungement and notification processes; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it focuses on legal record expungement procedures.

Title: Currency - Campaign Finance Prohibitions - Disclosures by Financial Institutions
Synopsis: Prohibiting certain persons subject to campaign finance regulation from making or accepting monetary contributions or monetary donations using any currency other than United States currency; prohibiting a campaign finance entity or a person acting on behalf of a campaign finance entity from making a monetary expenditure using any currency other than United States currency; authorizing the State Administrator of Elections or the Administrator's designee to investigate certain potential violations of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits campaign finance entities and individuals from depositing, making, or accepting contributions or expenditures using cryptocurrencies other than U.S. dollars. It also authorizes investigations and penalties for violations, and updates definitions related to financial institutions to include virtual currency transmitters.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections and Maryland Comptroller
stakeholders: Campaign finance entities, political candidates, and individuals involved in campaign contributions and expenditures in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs new regulations to restrict the use of cryptocurrencies in campaign finance, including investigation and enforcement mechanisms, representing a modern approach to campaign finance regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on campaign finance rules.

Title: Probation Before Judgment - Probation Agreements
Synopsis: Authorizing a court to stay the entering of a conviction, defer further proceedings, and place a certain defendant on probation subject to reasonable conditions if the court finds facts justifying a finding of guilt; authorizing the State and a certain defendant to enter into a probation agreement under certain circumstances; providing that the entry of a probation agreement under the Act shall be considered a probation before judgment for all other purposes under State law; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes courts in Maryland to stay the entry of judgment, defer proceedings, and place defendants on probation before judgment under certain conditions, including entering into probation agreements that do not admit guilt but allow for deferred sentencing and potential later conviction if terms are violated. It also establishes procedures for alcohol and drug treatment programs and monitoring.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Administrative Office of the Courts
stakeholders: Defendants in Maryland courts, particularly those involved in criminal cases and substance abuse treatment programs
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach to criminal justice by allowing probation before judgment through formal agreements that do not admit guilt, potentially reducing the impact of convictions and promoting rehabilitation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has moderate potential to impact child poverty by promoting rehabilitation and reducing criminal convictions, which can improve economic stability for affected families.

Title: Budget Bill (Fiscal Year 2024)
Synopsis: Making the proposed appropriations contained in the State Budget for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2024, in accordance with Article III, Section 52 of the Maryland Constitution; etc.
bill_summary: The bill is a comprehensive appropriations act for the fiscal year 2024, detailing allocations for various state agencies, programs, and projects, including education, transportation, health, public safety, and infrastructure, with provisions for supplemental budgets and amendments.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: State agencies, local governments, educational institutions, healthcare providers, and Maryland residents
innovative_summary: The bill employs standard government budgeting practices with some technological and programmatic updates, but does not establish new innovative programs employing emerging technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill allocates significant funds toward education, health, and social services, which can have a direct impact on child poverty, but the impact depends on implementation and effectiveness.

Title: Creation of a State Debt – Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2023, and the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loans of 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, and 2022
Synopsis: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt in the amount of $1,218,639,000, the proceeds to be used for certain necessary building, construction, demolition, planning, renovation, conversion, replacement, and capital equipment purchases of the State, for acquiring certain real estate in connection therewith, and for grants to certain subdivisions and other organizations for certain development and improvement purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the issuance of multiple series of bonds to fund various public infrastructure, education, health, and community projects across Maryland, including schools, hospitals, parks, transportation, and public safety facilities, with specific allocations and project descriptions.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Public Works and various state agencies
stakeholders: Maryland residents, local governments, schools, hospitals, community organizations, and infrastructure users
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive bond issuance approach to fund a wide array of public projects, integrating modern infrastructure development with community and cultural initiatives, but does not employ new technologies or approaches beyond typical government bond financing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to significantly impact child poverty by funding educational, health, and community development projects that support children and families.

Title: Budget Reconciliation and Financing Act of 2023
Synopsis: Authorizing or altering the distribution of certain revenue; repealing a certain required appropriation to the Revenue Stabilization Account; altering the areas in which certain faculty must specialize to be assigned to provide clinical care at the University of Maryland Capital Region Medical Center; reducing the budgeted Medicaid Deficit Assessment for fiscal year 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill allocates funds for the University of Maryland School of Medicine to provide clinical care at the University of Maryland Capital Region Medical Center, establishes funding and policies related to Medicaid assessments, property tax credits, and transfers land from the Bainbridge Naval Training Center to the Department of Natural Resources, among other budget and funding adjustments.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, Department of Natural Resources, Maryland Energy Administration, Department of Human Services, Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, particularly those receiving medical care, property owners, and local governments
innovative_summary: The bill employs a mix of funding allocations, land transfers, and policy adjustments to improve healthcare, property tax credits, and natural resource management, using existing government structures and funds.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may indirectly benefit children through improved healthcare and community resources.

Title: Early Childhood Education - Prekindergarten Programs - Montessori Schools and Programs
Synopsis: Altering the eligibility requirements for the Prekindergarten Expansion Grant Program and publicly funded prekindergarten programs to include certain operational requirements, staff credentials, and student-to-staff ratios; requiring Montessori schools and programs to maintain a student-to-classroom personnel ratio of no more than 10 to 1, with a maximum of 20 students if all the students are under the age of 5 years; requiring a classroom teacher to hold a bachelor's degree and be certified by certain organizations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands eligibility requirements for prekindergarten programs in Maryland to include Montessori schools, specifying staff credentials, student–to–staff ratios, and operational standards for these programs.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Prekindergarten children, Montessori schools, early childhood education providers, families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized certification and operational framework for Montessori prekindergarten programs, integrating Montessori credentials and tailored ratios into state-funded early childhood education.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by increasing access to quality early childhood education through expanded program options.

Title: Corporations and Associations - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions governing the issuance of stock, convertible securities, and scrip; clarifying the authority of corporations to hold annual meetings by remote communication; clarifying the application of certain provisions of law to the conversion of a corporation; requiring a real estate investment trust that voluntarily dissolves to file a notice of termination with the State Department of Assessments and Taxation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes various revisions to Maryland laws governing corporations and associations, including rules about issuing stock, holding meetings remotely, dissolving real estate investment trusts, and the application of laws to statutory trusts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Corporations, associations, real estate investment trusts, and statutory trusts in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces provisions allowing remote participation in meetings and updates rules for dissolving real estate investment trusts, but overall it mainly updates legal and procedural rules.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may indirectly impact business operations and trust management in Maryland.

Title: Baltimore County - Board of Education - Member Elections and Appointments
Synopsis: Requiring the seven elected members of the Baltimore County Board of Education to be elected in gubernatorial election years; requiring the four appointed members of the Board to be appointed in presidential election years; providing for the termination of the terms of certain appointed members of the Board in 2024; and providing for the  appointment of certain members of the Board in 2028.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the election and appointment process for the Baltimore County Board of Education, including the timing of appointments and terms, and extends the terms of certain appointed members to 2028.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Board of Education and Maryland Governor's Office
stakeholders: Students, parents, and residents of Baltimore County
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes election and appointment procedures for the school board, with no new technologies or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include specific programs targeting it.

Title: Commission on Public Health - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission on Public Health to make recommendations to improve the delivery of foundational public health services in the State; requiring the Commission to conduct an assessment of the foundational public health capabilities of the Maryland Department of Health and local health departments; requiring the Commission to submit to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly an interim report by December 1, 2023, and a final report by December 1, 2024, of the Commission's findings and recommendations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Commission on Public Health to assess and make recommendations for improving the delivery of foundational public health services in Maryland, including areas like disease control, health equity, and emergency preparedness.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and academic institutions providing staff support
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, public health departments, healthcare providers, and community organizations
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive assessment and recommendation process, including public engagement and data analysis, to reform public health services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by improving public health services that support vulnerable populations.

Title: Real Property - Limitations on Summoning Law Enforcement or Emergency Services - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting a landlord from using a lease or form of lease that contains a provision that limits a tenant's ability to summon, or penalizes a tenant or another individual solely for summoning, the assistance of law enforcement or emergency services; prohibiting a landlord from taking certain retaliatory actions because a tenant or another individual summons the assistance of law enforcement or emergency services for certain purposes; prohibiting a local jurisdiction from enacting certain laws; etc.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits landlords from including lease provisions that limit tenants' ability to summon law enforcement or emergency services, and from retaliating against tenants for doing so. It also restricts local governments from enacting laws that penalize or restrict the act of summoning emergency services to residential properties.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Tenants, landlords, and local governments in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs legal protections to ensure tenants can summon emergency services without fear of retaliation, and restricts local laws that penalize such actions, promoting tenant safety and rights.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by protecting tenants and ensuring safety, which can contribute to stable housing for families.

Title: Howard County - Alcoholic Beverages - Repeal of Petition of Support Requirement Ho. Co. 12-23
Synopsis: Repealing the requirement that an application for an alcoholic beverages license in Howard County include certain petitions of support signed by at least three residents who are owners of real property and registered voters in the district where the business is to be conducted.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the requirement for an application for an alcoholic beverages license in Howard County to include a petition of support signed by residents, simplifying the licensing process.
responsible_party: Howard County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Applicants for alcohol licenses, residents of Howard County, local businesses
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies the licensing process by removing the petition of support requirement, which is a procedural change rather than an innovative technological or approach-based program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly changes licensing procedures for alcohol licenses.

Title: St. Mary's County - Golf Carts on Public Highways - Report
Synopsis: Requiring the St. Mary's County Board of County Commissioners to produce a report recommending and describing the areas of St. Mary's County that the County Board considers appropriate for the operation of unregistered golf carts on public highways, subject to certain standards; and requiring the County Board to submit the report to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes St. Mary's County to create a report recommending areas suitable for operating unregistered golf carts on public highways, primarily on islands or peninsulas near Chesapeake Bay, and sets standards for such operation, including speed limits and lighting requirements.
responsible_party: St. Mary’s County Board of County Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents, visitors, and boaters in St. Mary's County, especially in designated island or peninsula areas near Chesapeake Bay
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a localized approach to golf cart operation, allowing unregistered golf carts on certain public highways in specific areas, with standards for safety and operation, employing a tailored regulatory approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly pertains to transportation regulations in specific areas.

Title: Criminal Law - Person in a Position of Authority - Sexual Offenses With a Minor
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "person in a position of authority" applicable to sexual offense in the fourth degree; altering a certain prohibition against a certain person in a position of authority engaging in certain conduct to prohibit a person in a position of authority from engaging in a sexual act, sexual contact, or vaginal intercourse with a minor who is enrolled at a school or participating in a certain program for which the person in authority works; authorizing the imposition of a certain sentence;  etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to expand the definition of 'person in a position of authority' and prohibits such persons from engaging in sexual acts, contact, or vaginal intercourse with minors enrolled or participating in the relevant institutions or programs. It establishes stricter rules and penalties for sexual offenses involving minors in these contexts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Minors participating in educational, recreational, or religious programs and institutions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal definitions and penalties; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on legal definitions and penalties for sexual offenses, with no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Employment for Minors - Opportunities for Work
Synopsis: Requiring the Commissioner of Labor and Industry to release certain personal information of a minor who has a work permit to employers and apprenticeship sponsors, educational programs and institutions, and local workforce development boards that have requested and have registered with the Maryland Department of Labor for the purpose of receiving the information, if a parent or legal guardian of the minor or the minor elects to allow the sharing of the information.
bill_summary: The bill updates regulations regarding employment for minors in Maryland, including provisions for online work permit applications and the release of certain personal information to registered organizations with parental or minor consent.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Minors seeking employment, employers, educational institutions, and workforce development organizations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an online application process for work permits and a regulated system for sharing minors' personal information with registered organizations, enhancing efficiency and privacy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to facilitate employment opportunities for minors, which could help reduce child poverty by increasing youth employment options.

Title: Department of the Environment - Zero-Emission Medium- and Heavy-Duty Vehicles - Regulations (Clean Trucks Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment to adopt regulations on or before December 1, 2023, establishing requirements for the sale of new zero-emission medium- and heavy-duty vehicles in the State; defining a "heavy-duty vehicle" as one with a gross vehicle weight rating equal to or greater than 14,001 pounds; requiring the Department, in consultation with certain units of State government, to prepare and submit to the General Assembly a certain needs assessment and deployment plan by December 1, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of the Environment to adopt regulations for the sale of new zero-emission medium- and heavy-duty vehicles, establish a needs assessment and deployment plan, and modifies the existing grant program to promote the adoption of such vehicles and equipment, with specified funding and preferences.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment and Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Commercial and industrial vehicle operators, environmental groups, communities impacted by vehicle emissions, government agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining regulation, planning, and financial incentives to accelerate the adoption of zero-emission vehicles, integrating infrastructure planning and targeted funding.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty indirectly by improving environmental health and creating green jobs, but its direct impact is moderate.

Title: Child in Need of Assistance – Neglect – Cannabis Use
Synopsis: Providing that the use of cannabis by a parent or certain other individuals who care for a child does not qualify as neglect except in certain circumstances for purposes of provisions of law relating to children in need of assistance.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that the use of cannabis by a parent or caregiver does not constitute neglect under child welfare laws unless the cannabis use results in harm or risk of harm to the child's health or mental well-being.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services or relevant child welfare agencies
stakeholders: Children, parents, and caregivers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal clarification regarding cannabis use and child neglect, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on legal definitions and child welfare.

Title: State Board of Chiropractic Examiners - Disciplinary Actions
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Chiropractic Examiners to take disciplinary action against an applicant or a licensee for failing to comply with a Board order; authorizing the Board to grant a stay of enforcement of a Board order in accordance with the Administrative Procedure Act; prohibiting a Board order from being stayed pending judicial review; authorizing the Board to reinstate a suspended or revoked license only in accordance with the terms and conditions of the order or an order of reinstatement issued by the Board; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates the disciplinary procedures for the Maryland State Board of Chiropractic Examiners, including clarifying their authority to take disciplinary actions, the process for appealing decisions, and conditions for reinstating licenses.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Chiropractic Examiners
stakeholders: Chiropractors and applicants in Maryland, and the public they serve
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies existing disciplinary procedures and appeals processes; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Tax Sales - Owner-Occupied Property - Foreclosure, Notice, and Reimbursement of Expenses
Synopsis: Prohibiting in all counties, rather than Baltimore City only, a holder of a certificate of sale from filing a complaint to foreclose the right of redemption for owner-occupied residential property until 9 months from the date of sale; prohibiting in all counties, rather than Baltimore City only, a certain notice from being sent to certain persons with an interest in owner-occupied residential property sold at tax sale until 7 months after the date of sale; etc.
bill_summary: The bill extends the time before a holder of a tax sale certificate can file for foreclosure and send notices for owner-occupied residential properties across all counties in Maryland, not just Baltimore City. It also increases the period before reimbursement of certain expenses after a property redemption from 4 to 6 months, with specific provisions for Baltimore City.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Homeowners involved in tax sales, local governments, and taxpayers
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes procedural rules and timelines for tax sale foreclosures and reimbursements, without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on procedural aspects of tax sales.

Title: Tax Sales - Homeowner Protection Program - Outreach
Synopsis: Expressing the intent of the General Assembly that at least 2% of the balance in the Homeowner Protection Fund be spent each year to conduct outreach in a certain manner to homeowners in tax sale to encourage the homeowners to enroll in the Homeowner Protection Program; authorizing the State Tax Sale Ombudsman to conduct outreach using State employees and resources or to contract with a private vendor; requiring that certain State and local government agencies provide certain information to facilitate outreach efforts; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Homeowner Protection Program in Maryland that includes an outreach campaign to inform homeowners about assistance available when their property is sold at a tax sale. It requires contracting with a vendor to make live telephone calls to homeowners, providing information about programs and benefits, and encourages enrollment in the program. The program is funded through the Homeowner Protection Fund with specified annual appropriations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation and the State Tax Sale Ombudsman
stakeholders: Homeowners at risk of losing their homes due to tax sales in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs direct live telephone outreach to homeowners, using both state resources and private vendors, to proactively inform and assist homeowners in avoiding tax sale consequences.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by preventing home loss and stabilizing families.

Title: Sales and Use Tax Exemption - Redevelopment Areas in Baltimore County - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Extending, until July 1, 2036, the termination date applicable to an exemption from the sales and use tax for certain construction material or warehousing equipment purchased for use in a certain target redevelopment area in Baltimore County.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for a sales and use tax exemption on construction materials and warehousing equipment used in a specific redevelopment area in Baltimore County from 2026 to 2036.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Businesses involved in redevelopment projects in Baltimore County, including construction and warehousing companies
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing tax exemption without introducing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly involves tax policy for redevelopment projects.

Title: Massage Therapy - Discipline
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners to grant a stay of enforcement of a Board order in accordance with the Administrative Procedure Act; prohibiting an order of the Board from being stayed pending judicial review; authorizing the Board to appeal a decision that reverses or modifies its order; altering the grounds for disciplining massage therapists and procedures related to the discipline of massage therapists, including appeals procedures and reinstatement procedures; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates the regulations and disciplinary procedures for massage therapy in Maryland, including defining practice, licensing, and penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners
stakeholders: Massage therapists, massage therapy students, and the public seeking massage services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing regulations and disciplinary procedures; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on professional regulation.

Title: Accessory Dwelling Unit Policy Task Force
Synopsis: Establishing the Accessory Dwelling Unit Policy Task Force to survey and document a representative sampling of the variety of ordinances, laws, codes, and policies regarding the development and operation of accessory dwelling units in areas zoned for single-family residential use; and requiring the Task Force to report to the Governor and General Assembly on its activities on or before November 1, 2023, and its findings and recommendations on or before June 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Accessory Dwelling Unit Policy Task Force to study efforts to promote the creation of accessory dwelling units on land zoned for single-family residential use, review existing laws and policies, and make recommendations.
responsible_party: Department of Planning
stakeholders: Homeowners, local governments, housing advocates, and residents in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a collaborative task force to study and recommend best practices and policies for accessory dwelling units, including streamlining permits and reducing barriers.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by increasing affordable housing options and promoting housing diversity.

Title: Correctional Officers' Retirement System - Special Death Benefits - Applicability
Synopsis: Authorizing an application for special death benefits to be made for the death of certain members of the Correctional Officers' Retirement System.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes a process for surviving spouses of correctional officers who died by homicide in the line of duty on or after June 1, 2001, to apply for and receive special death benefits from the Maryland Correctional Officers' Retirement System. It specifies the conditions, timing, and calculation of these benefits, including retroactive payments with interest, and sets a deadline for applications.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Surviving spouses and families of correctional officers who died by homicide in the line of duty after June 1, 2001
innovative_summary: The program introduces a specific, time-limited process for applying for special death benefits for a particular group of correctional officers' families, including retroactive payments with interest, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily provides death benefits to families of deceased correctional officers.

Title: Massage Therapy - Definition, Registration, and Reimbursement
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "massage therapy"; altering the date after which the option to be registered by the State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners to practice massage therapy in a setting that is not a health care setting will no longer be available; and repealing a provision of law that provides that certain provisions of law do not require a nonprofit health insurance plan, an insurer, a health maintenance organization, or a person acting as a third party administrator to reimburse certain individuals for services rendered.
bill_summary: The bill updates the definition of 'massage therapy', sets new deadlines for registration and licensing of massage therapists, and clarifies reimbursement rules, including repealing a provision that previously did not require insurance reimbursement for massage services.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners
stakeholders: Massage therapists, massage practitioners, and consumers of massage services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates regulations and deadlines for massage therapy licensing and registration, with no new technology or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns licensing and reimbursement rules for massage therapy.

Title: Baltimore City Young Readers Program and Young Readers Matching Grant Program - Alterations (Young Readers Program Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Transferring the Baltimore City Young Readers Program and the Young Readers Matching Grant Program to the Maryland State Library Agency;  requiring program grant applicants to include the distribution of books to children in low-income zip codes within the applicants' areas of service; requiring the Governor to include $350,000 in the annual budget bill for the Program; requiring the State Library Board, beginning December 1, 2024, to report every other year to the General Assembly on the effectiveness of the Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Statewide Young Readers Program and the Young Readers Matching Grant Program, which support the distribution of free, high-quality books to children, especially in low-income areas, through public libraries and nonprofit organizations.
responsible_party: Maryland State Library Agency
stakeholders: Children in Maryland, public libraries, nonprofit organizations, and communities in low-income areas
innovative_summary: The program employs a partnership model between the state, public libraries, and nonprofit organizations to distribute books, with a focus on targeted outreach to low-income children, leveraging grants and collaborations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing access to educational resources in underserved communities.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Registers of Wills - Electronic Filing and Signatures
Synopsis: Requiring a register of wills to accept certain documents filed electronically through a system established by the register of wills; and prohibiting a register of wills from refusing to accept a document based on the manner in which it was signed.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland's register of wills to accept electronic filings of documents, prohibits refusal based on signing method, and allows both electronic and paper filings.
responsible_party: Maryland Register of Wills
stakeholders: Individuals and entities filing documents with the Register of Wills in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of electronic filing systems for legal documents, modernizing the process and making it more accessible.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Minority Business Enterprise Program - Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor's Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs to include an attestation that all units required to report are represented in its annual report beginning December 31, 2023; requiring the Office to conduct a certain periodic audit to ensure the accuracy of the attestation; requiring a certain annual report to be submitted to the Joint Committee on Fair Practices and State Personnel Oversight; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Office of State Procurement in Maryland to maintain a list of units required to report on their minority business enterprise participation, and mandates annual reporting, audits, and attestations to ensure compliance with minority business participation goals in state procurement.
responsible_party: Office of State Procurement in the Department of General Services
stakeholders: Minority business enterprises, state government units, and the public interested in fair procurement practices
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured reporting, auditing, and attestation process to improve transparency and accountability in minority business enterprise participation in state procurement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve economic opportunities for minority businesses, which can contribute to reducing child poverty in affected communities.

Title: St. Mary's County - Transfer Tax - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Extending to October 1, 2028, the authority of the County Commissioners of St. Mary's County to impose a transfer tax on certain instruments of writing.
bill_summary: The bill extends the authority of St. Mary's County to impose a transfer tax on certain documents until 2028, instead of 2024.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Government
stakeholders: Property owners and real estate transactions in St. Mary's County
innovative_summary: This bill does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches; it mainly extends existing authority.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Baltimore County - Class B-ECF/DS (Education Conference Facility/Dining Service) License - Towson University
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore County to issue a Class B-ECF/DS (Education Conference Facility/Dining Service) license for use at certain Towson University events.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Baltimore County to issue a special license allowing Towson University to sell alcohol at university-related events on campus.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore County
stakeholders: Towson University students, staff, and event attendees; university administration; local community
innovative_summary: The bill creates a specialized alcohol license for university events, integrating alcohol sales into campus activities with designated outlets and regulations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Baltimore City - Property Tax - Retroactive Exemption
Synopsis: Authorizing a person who applies for certain property tax exemptions for real property in Baltimore City to request that the exemption be applied retroactively for up to 3 taxable years, subject to certain requirements; requiring Baltimore City and the State to pay a refund of excess real property taxes paid due to a retroactive exemption that is granted; and requiring the Baltimore City Department of Finance to submit a report on the number of requests made and the amounts refunded by December 1 each year from 2023 to 2027.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes property owners in Baltimore City to request retroactive property tax exemptions for up to three taxable years, with refunds provided for any excess taxes paid due to the exemption. It also establishes reporting requirements for the Baltimore City Department of Finance.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Department of Finance and the State of Maryland
stakeholders: Property owners in Baltimore City, Baltimore City government, Maryland State government
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a retroactive application process for property tax exemptions, which is a new approach to property tax relief and administrative procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce financial burdens on property owners, which could indirectly benefit low-income families and reduce child poverty.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Class A-7 Licenses
Synopsis: Repealing certain geographic and temporal restrictions on the issuance of Class A-7 beer, wine, and liquor licenses in Baltimore City.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain geographic and temporal restrictions on the issuance of Class A–7 alcohol licenses in Baltimore City, allowing more flexibility in licensing and sales hours.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, Baltimore City residents, businesses in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill removes restrictions on license issuance and sales hours, increasing flexibility for alcohol sales in Baltimore City.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Environment - On-Farm Composting Facilities - Permit Exemption
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment to adopt regulations to exempt an on-farm composting facility from the requirement to obtain a permit if the on-farm composting facility uses 10,000 square feet of area or less for active food scrap composting, composts only certain materials, records the amount and source of off-site type 2 organics composted and the date and time the off-site type 2 organics arrived on the farm, retains the records for 5 years, provides records on request, and meets any other condition for a permit exemption; etc.
bill_summary: The bill exempts certain on-farm composting facilities from permit requirements if they meet specific conditions, and mandates the Department of the Environment to adopt regulations for implementing these exemptions, including record-keeping and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Farmers and farm operators involved in composting activities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a regulatory exemption for small-scale on-farm composting facilities, streamlining processes and encouraging sustainable waste management practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on environmental regulation and waste management.

Title: Caroline and Queen Anne's Counties - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Residency Requirement
Synopsis: Requiring that a certain applicant for an alcoholic beverages license in Caroline County be a resident of the State rather than a resident of the county; and requiring that a certain applicant for an alcoholic beverages license in Queen Anne's County be a resident of the State rather than a resident of the county.
bill_summary: The bill removes the residency requirement for applicants for alcoholic beverages licenses in Caroline and Queen Anne's counties, allowing applicants to be residents of the state rather than the specific counties.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcoholic Beverages Administration or local licensing boards in Caroline and Queen Anne's counties
stakeholders: Applicants for alcoholic beverages licenses, local businesses, and residents of Caroline and Queen Anne's counties
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward legal change to remove county residency requirements, simplifying licensing rules and potentially increasing business opportunities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly changes licensing residency requirements.

Title: Maryland Sign Language Interpreters Act
Synopsis: Establishing a licensing and regulatory system for sign language interpreters under the State Board of Sign Language Interpreters in the Office of the Deaf and Hard of Hearing; establishing the Sign Language Interpreters Fund to be used exclusively to cover the documented direct and indirect costs of fulfilling the Board's duties, including development of programs to assist licensure of marginalized interpreters, development of certain mentorship programs, and financial assistance for certain applicants; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a licensing and regulatory system for sign language interpreters in Maryland, including creating a State Board of Sign Language Interpreters, setting licensing requirements, and funding the program.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Sign Language Interpreters and the Office of the Deaf and Hard of Hearing
stakeholders: Deaf and hard of hearing individuals, sign language interpreters, legal, medical, behavioral health, and educational settings in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces a formal licensing system for sign language interpreters, including a new regulatory board, online registration, and a public awareness campaign, employing modern regulatory approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access to communication services for deaf and hard of hearing children and their families.

Title: Eligible Projects - Procurement of Construction Materials (Buy Clean Maryland Act)
Synopsis: Requiring producers of any cement or concrete mixture used in the construction of an eligible project to submit environmental product declarations to the Department of General Services by December 31, 2024; requiring the Department to establish a maximum acceptable global warming potential for certain categories of eligible materials by January 1, 2026; establishing an Environmental Product Declaration Assistance Fund to support the development of certain environmental product declarations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill, known as the Buy Clean Maryland Act, requires producers of certain construction materials, specifically cement and concrete mixtures, to submit environmental declarations and limits the global warming potential of materials used in public construction projects. It establishes procedures for assessing and reducing greenhouse gas emissions associated with these materials.
responsible_party: Department of General Services and Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Producers of eligible construction materials, state government agencies, contractors, and the public benefiting from state-funded construction projects.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a data-driven approach to reduce the climate impact of construction materials by setting limits based on environmental product declarations and continuously reviewing and adjusting these limits.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by promoting sustainable construction practices that could lead to broader environmental and economic benefits.

Title: Abandoned Vehicles - Secured Parties - Electronic Notification
Synopsis: Authorizing a police department that takes an abandoned vehicle into custody to notify any secured party electronically if that form of notice is agreed to by the police department, the tower, and the secured party in a certain manner; and altering the application of a provision of law authorizing a police department to provide certain alternative public notice of custody of an abandoned vehicle to include circumstances where electronic notice is unacknowledged or undeliverable.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes police departments to notify secured parties electronically about abandoned vehicles, if all parties agree, and updates procedures for notice when electronic notification is unacknowledged or undeliverable.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or local police departments
stakeholders: Vehicle owners, secured parties, police departments, and the general public involved in vehicle impoundment and recovery processes
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of electronic notifications for secured parties in vehicle abandonment cases, replacing or supplementing traditional mail notices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on vehicle and legal procedures.

Title: St. Mary's County - Gaming - Senior Activity Centers
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain senior activity center to conduct gaming events, bunco games, and card games in St. Mary's County; prohibiting a senior activity center in St. Mary's County from awarding prize money in excess of $50 to a winner in each session or charging a participant more than $25 to play one session; requiring any money that remains after prizes are awarded to be used to support future programming at the senior activity center; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes senior activity centers in St. Mary's County to conduct gaming events, bunco games, and card games, with specific rules on prizes and charges, and requires remaining funds after prizes to support future programming.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County senior activity centers
stakeholders: Senior citizens and their spouses in St. Mary's County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new, regulated form of gaming at senior centers to support community activities, employing a structured approach to gaming and fund allocation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by supporting community services, though it primarily targets seniors.

Title: Family Law - Maryland Child Abduction Prevention Act
Synopsis: Authorizing a court to order child abduction prevention measures if the court finds there is a credible risk of abduction of the child; authorizing certain parties to petition the court for child abduction prevention measures; requiring a petition to be verified, include a copy of any existing child custody determination, and specify the risk factors for abduction; requiring the court to consider certain evidence of a credible risk of abduction; establishing requirements for an abduction prevention order; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Child Abduction Prevention Act, which authorizes courts to require notice of international travel with a child, and to issue child abduction prevention orders in custody proceedings. It provides procedures for petitioning courts, considering risks of abduction, and enforcing orders to prevent child abduction, including law enforcement actions and travel restrictions.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Parents, children, and families involved in custody and travel disputes in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive legal framework and law enforcement tools to prevent child abduction, including court orders, warrants, and international cooperation, representing a proactive and technologically integrated approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on child safety and legal procedures, with no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: 9–8–8 Trust Fund – Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill for fiscal year 2025 an appropriation of $12,000,000 to the 9-8-8 Trust Fund for the purpose of designating and maintaining 9-8-8 as the universal telephone number for a national suicide prevention and mental health crisis hotline and for developing and implementing a statewide initiative for the coordination and delivery of behavioral health crisis response services in the State.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the 9-8-8 Trust Fund in Maryland to support the national suicide prevention and mental health crisis hotline, including funding for crisis services and initiatives. It mandates a $12 million appropriation for fiscal year 2025.
responsible_party: Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals experiencing mental health crises, mental health service providers, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill creates a dedicated state trust fund specifically for supporting the 9-8-8 mental health crisis hotline and related behavioral health services, which is a targeted approach to mental health crisis response funding.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to mental health crisis services, which can support families and children in crisis.

Title: Health Occupations - Environmental Health Specialists - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the education requirements for an applicant for licensure as an environmental health specialist; altering the grounds for which the Board may take disciplinary action against an applicant or a licensee to include misfeasance and malfeasance while performing the duties of an environmental health specialist; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises the education requirements, examination procedures, disciplinary actions, and review processes for environmental health specialists in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Environmental Health Specialists
stakeholders: Environmental health specialists and the public they serve
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing regulations and procedures; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing on professional licensing and discipline.

Title: Education - Libraries - Funding
Synopsis: Providing certain funding for each county public library system for fiscal year 2028 and each fiscal year thereafter.
bill_summary: The bill allocates funding for Maryland's public library systems, increasing the per-resident funding amount annually from fiscal year 2011 through 2027 and beyond, with the state covering approximately 40% of the costs and counties covering at least 20%.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Public library users and residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a phased, incremental funding approach to support public libraries, ensuring sustained financial support over multiple years.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access to educational resources through better-funded libraries.

Title: Montgomery County – Alcoholic Beverages – Holders of Class B–BWL (Clubhouse/Lodge) License and Class 7 Micro–Brewery License MC 16–23
Synopsis: Providing that the restriction on holding or having a financial interest in other retail alcoholic beverages licenses for holders of a Class 7 micro-brewery license does not apply to a holder of a Class B-BWL (clubhouse/lodge) license in Montgomery County who is issued a Class 7 micro-brewery license.
bill_summary: The bill allows holders of a Class B–BWL (clubhouse/lodge) license in Montgomery County to also hold a Class 7 micro–brewery license without the usual restriction that limits micro–brewery license holders from having other retail alcoholic beverage licenses.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Revenue Authority
stakeholders: Owners and operators of clubhouses, lodges, micro-breweries, and related hospitality venues in Montgomery County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new licensing flexibility allowing existing clubhouse/lodge license holders to operate micro-breweries without restrictions, potentially fostering local craft brewing and hospitality.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may indirectly support local economic development and job creation.

Title: Health Occupations - Clinical Nurse Specialists - Prescribing
Synopsis: Defining "clinical nurse specialist" and "practice as a clinical nurse specialist" for the purpose of authorizing clinical nurse specialists to prescribe drugs and durable medical equipment under regulations adopted by the State Board of Nursing; designating a clinical nurse specialist as an "authorized prescriber" under the Maryland Pharmacy Act; and authorizing a licensed physician to personally prepare and dispense a prescription written by a clinical nurse specialist.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes clinical nurse specialists to prescribe drugs and medical equipment under regulations, and allows physicians to dispense prescriptions written by them, expanding their prescriptive authority.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Nursing and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Clinical nurse specialists, physicians, patients, healthcare providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill expands the scope of practice for clinical nurse specialists by granting them prescriptive authority and integrating their role more fully into healthcare delivery.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could improve healthcare access and quality, potentially reducing child health disparities and poverty-related health issues.

Title: Prescription Drug Affordability Board - Upper Payment Limits
Synopsis: Reestablishing the requirement that the Prescription Drug Affordability Board, under certain circumstances, draft a plan of action for implementing a process to set upper payment limits for certain prescription drug products; reestablishing the authority of the Board to set upper payments limits, under certain circumstances, for prescription drug products that are purchased or paid for by or through certain State or local government entities, plans, or programs; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reestablishes and expands the authority of the Maryland Prescription Drug Affordability Board to set upper payment limits for certain prescription drugs that cause affordability issues, including establishing a process for doing so, an appeals process, and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Prescription Drug Affordability Board
stakeholders: Consumers, state and local government health programs, and healthcare providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a regulatory approach to control drug prices through setting upper payment limits, with monitoring and appeals processes, which is a structured government intervention.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by making prescription drugs more affordable for families and government programs.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Gender-Affirming Treatment (Trans Health Equity Act)
Synopsis: Requiring, beginning on January 1, 2024, the Maryland Medical Assistance Program to provide gender-affirming treatment in a nondiscriminatory manner; requiring that the gender-affirming treatment be assessed according to nondiscriminatory criteria that are consistent with current clinical standards; prohibiting the issuance of an adverse benefit determination related to gender-affirming treatment unless a certain experienced health care provider has reviewed and confirmed the appropriateness of the determination; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Medical Assistance Program to provide medically necessary gender-affirming treatment starting January 1, 2024, ensuring nondiscriminatory access and assessment according to current clinical standards. It also mandates annual reporting on providers offering such treatments and aims to improve access and reduce barriers for transgender and gender-diverse individuals.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Transgender, nonbinary, intersex, two-spirit, and other gender-diverse individuals receiving Medicaid in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach to ensure nondiscriminatory access to gender-affirming treatments, including annual reporting and provider directory updates, which is a progressive step in healthcare equity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily focuses on healthcare access for gender-diverse individuals.
