Title: Grocery Stores and Restaurants - Automated External Defibrillator Program (Joe Sheya Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the owners and operators of grocery stores with annual gross incomes greater than $10,000,000 or restaurants with annual gross incomes of more than $1,000,000, beginning on January 1, 2024, to place an automated external defibrillator in a prominent, accessible area and maintain the functionality of the defibrillator; and requiring the Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems jointly to adopt certain regulations.
bill_summary: The bill requires owners and operators of certain grocery stores and restaurants in Maryland to develop and implement automated external defibrillator (AED) programs, place AEDs in accessible areas, and maintain their functionality. It also grants immunities from liability for those who comply and act in good faith during emergencies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems
stakeholders: Grocery stores, restaurants, employees, and customers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs existing AED technology and legal immunities to improve emergency response in commercial settings, with a focus on public health and safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but improves emergency health responses in community settings.

Title: Maryland Forestry Education Fund - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Forestry Education Fund to expand and enhance the Maryland Forestry Foundation's capacity to provide certain education and resources to forest landowners, the ability of district forestry boards and the knowledge of local governments to achieve healthy and sustainable forests, and the ability of businesses to test innovative best management practices in forestry; and requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill $250,000 for the Fund in fiscal years 2025 and 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Forestry Education Fund to support forestry education, outreach, and innovation in Maryland, including grants and programs for landowners, local governments, and businesses, with funding allocated annually.
responsible_party: Maryland Forestry Foundation
stakeholders: Forest landowners, district forestry boards, local governments, businesses, and communities involved in forestry in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program includes grants for testing innovative forestry management practices and promotes sustainable forest management through education and outreach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty indirectly by promoting sustainable forestry and community development, but it is not directly targeted at child poverty.

Title: Public Health - Dental Services - Access
Synopsis: Altering the Maryland Dent-Care Program; establishing a requirement regarding the reimbursement of dental-related services under the Maryland Medical Assistance Program; establishing requirements on the Maryland Department of Health regarding the creation and distribution of plain language materials related to dental services; requiring the State Board of Dental Examiners to publish a searchable list of licensed providers who provide mobile dental services or portable dental services in the State; etc.
bill_summary: The bill enhances access to dental services in Maryland by requiring dental screenings for children in schools and care facilities, establishing the Maryland Dent–Care Program to support dentists and dental hygienists serving underserved populations, and improving information and provider participation in dental programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners
stakeholders: Children, pregnant women, Medicaid recipients, underserved populations, dental providers
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach including program funding, provider outreach, and plain language materials to improve dental health access, with some use of new data sharing and provider listing technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to dental care for underserved children and pregnant women.

Title: Health Occupations - Clinical and Graduate Alcohol and Drug Counselors - Licensure
Synopsis: Altering the educational requirements that individuals must meet to be licensed as clinical or graduate alcohol and drug counselors.
bill_summary: The bill amends the educational and licensing requirements for clinical and graduate alcohol and drug counselors in Maryland, including provisions for licensure waivers and supervised practice.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Examiners of Alcohol and Drug Counselors
stakeholders: Prospective and current alcohol and drug counselors, healthcare providers, and individuals seeking treatment for substance use disorders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates licensing requirements and procedures, with some provisions for supervised practice, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns professional licensing requirements.

Title: Child Care Providers - Registration and Licensing - Exemptions
Synopsis: Exempting certain family child care homes, large family child care homes, and child care centers that serve only dependent children of military personnel and are located on a military base or federal property or are certified as a family child care provider by a branch of the U.S. Department of Defense or the Coast Guard from certain registration and licensing requirements; authorizing certain entities to assume responsibility for approving or determining which children may be served by exempted child care providers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill exempts certain family child care homes, large family child care homes, and child care centers serving only dependent children of military personnel on federal property or certified by the U.S. Department of Defense or Coast Guard from specific registration and licensing requirements in Maryland. It also authorizes these federal agencies and their agents to oversee and approve the children served by these exempted providers.
responsible_party: U.S. Department of Defense, U.S. Coast Guard, Maryland Department of Health, local health officers, county departments of education, Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Dependent children of military personnel, military families, child care providers on federal property, Maryland state agencies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized exemption and oversight process for child care providers serving military families on federal property, involving federal agencies in approval and regulation, which is a novel approach to child care regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly changes regulatory requirements for specific child care providers serving military families.

Title: Criminal Law - Victims of Child Sex Trafficking and Human Trafficking - Safe Harbor and Service Response
Synopsis: Altering procedures that a law enforcement officer and a court are required to follow when the law enforcement officer or court has reason to believe that a child who has been detained is a victim of sex trafficking or a victim of human trafficking; providing that a minor may not be criminally prosecuted or proceeded against under certain provisions of law for a certain offense if the minor committed the offense as a direct result of being a victim of sex trafficking or being a victim of human trafficking; etc.
bill_summary: The bill enhances protections and procedures for child victims of sex trafficking and human trafficking, including requiring law enforcement to notify regional navigators, and allows minors involved in certain offenses to avoid prosecution if their actions were a direct result of trafficking. It also establishes a process for courts to determine if a child is a trafficking victim and to dismiss charges accordingly.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services and the courts
stakeholders: Children who are victims of sex trafficking or human trafficking, law enforcement, courts, child welfare agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a coordinated approach involving law enforcement, courts, and regional navigators to identify and support trafficking victims, integrating victim-centered procedures into the juvenile justice process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by providing support and legal protections to trafficking victims, preventing further victimization and associated economic hardship.

Title: Public Health - Rare Disease Advisory Council
Synopsis: Establishing the Rare Disease Advisory Council to study and make recommendations on matters relating to individuals with rare diseases in the State; requiring the Council to convene public hearings, make inquiries, and solicit comments from the public on the needs of rare disease patients, caregivers, and health care providers; requiring the Council to report to the Governor and General Assembly by December 1 each year beginning in 2024 and to provide recommendations on ways to address the needs of persons with rare diseases in the State; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Rare Disease Advisory Council in Maryland to study and make recommendations on issues related to individuals with rare diseases, including improving access to care, coverage, and research.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with rare diseases, caregivers, healthcare providers, researchers, insurers, and related organizations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a collaborative advisory council with diverse stakeholders, public engagement, and annual reporting to improve rare disease policies and care.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve health outcomes for children with rare diseases, which may reduce child poverty related to health disparities.

Title: State Employee Rights and Protections - Personnel Actions and Harassment - Complaints
Synopsis: Authorizing an applicant for State employment or a State employee to file a complaint alleging harassment by an employer within 2 years after the alleged violation that is the basis of the complaint; and increasing, from 30 days to 1 year, the period of time for an applicant or employee to file a complaint alleging certain prohibited personnel actions.
bill_summary: The bill extends the time period for employees or applicants to file complaints about harassment or prohibited personnel actions, increasing the filing window for harassment complaints from 30 days to 2 years and for other violations from 30 days to 1 year.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government (specifically, the Department of Budget and Management or relevant state agencies)
stakeholders: State employees and applicants in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes legal timeframes for filing complaints, which is a procedural update rather than an innovative program or technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it pertains to employee rights and protections.

Title: Income Tax Checkoff - Maryland Veterans Trust Fund
Synopsis: Establishing a certain income tax checkoff for voluntary contributions to the Maryland Veterans Trust Fund; requiring the Comptroller to include certain information in each individual income tax return package; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a voluntary income tax checkoff for contributions to the Maryland Veterans Trust Fund, allowing taxpayers to donate part of their tax refund or owed amount to support veterans and their families.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Veterans and their families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward tax checkoff approach to fund support for veterans, which is a common but effective method of raising dedicated funds.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by supporting veterans and their families, which may include children.

Title: Pesticides - PFAS Testing - Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Agriculture, in consultation with certain State and federal agencies, to study the use of perfluoroalkyl and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS) in pesticides in the State; and requiring the Department to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor, the Senate Committee on Education, Energy, and the Environment, and the House Health and Government Operations Committee on or before November 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the registration of pesticides for use against mosquitoes in Maryland unless the distributor submits PFAS test results and an affidavit. It also requires a study on the use of PFAS in pesticides, including health and environmental impacts, testing methods, and regulatory efforts, with a report due by November 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture, in consultation with the Department of the Environment, the Maryland Department of Health, and the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency
stakeholders: Pesticide manufacturers, public health officials, environmental agencies, residents of Maryland, especially those concerned with mosquito control and chemical safety
innovative_summary: The bill employs a scientific testing and reporting approach to regulate the use of PFAS in pesticides, integrating environmental health considerations into pesticide registration processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on environmental health and chemical safety.

Title: Maryland Longitudinal Data System - Definition of Student Data - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "student data" for purposes of the Maryland Longitudinal Data System to include student disability data by specific disability category.
bill_summary: The bill amends the definition of 'student data' in the Maryland Longitudinal Data System to include student disability data categorized by specific disability types.
responsible_party: Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center
stakeholders: Students with disabilities and educational agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill enhances data collection by including detailed disability data, which can improve targeted educational policies and support services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The inclusion of disability data can help tailor interventions that may reduce barriers for students with disabilities, potentially impacting child poverty.

Title: Cigarette Restitution Fund - Payments for Sale and Marketing of Electronic Smoking Devices - Use
Synopsis: Requiring the Cigarette Restitution Fund to include a separate account consisting of payments received by the State from certain enforcement actions related to the sale and marketing of electronic smoking devices; and providing that distributions from the separate account may be used, consistent with any other State law, to supplement General Fund appropriations designated for certain programs with the purpose of reducing the use of tobacco products by individuals under 21 years of age.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a separate account within the Cigarette Restitution Fund to hold payments received from litigation related to the sale and marketing of electronic smoking devices. Funds from this account are to be used to support programs aimed at reducing tobacco use among individuals under 21, including prevention, education, and enforcement activities.
responsible_party: Maryland State government, specifically the Department responsible for the Cigarette Restitution Fund and related programs
stakeholders: Individuals under 21 years old, public health organizations, tobacco control programs, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a dedicated funding stream from litigation related to electronic smoking devices, which is a new approach to funding tobacco prevention and control programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by decreasing tobacco-related health issues and associated economic burdens among youth.

Title: Public Health - Home- and Community-Based Services for Children and Youth
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to expand access to and provide reimbursement for intensive in-home services, case management, and wraparound services; requiring, beginning in fiscal year 2024, the Behavioral Health Administration to fund 100 slots in the mental health case management program for children or youth at risk of out-of-home placement who are not eligible for program services; requiring the Governor to include funding in the annual budget bill for customized goods and services for certain youth; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to expand access to and reimburse for home- and community-based mental health services for children and youth, including wraparound, intensive in-home, and case management services. It also mandates funding, reporting, and stakeholder consultation to improve these services.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Children and youth with mental health needs and their families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a high-fidelity wraparound model, value-based purchasing, and expands eligibility for intensive behavioral health services, employing evidence-based practices and innovative funding approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by providing targeted mental health services to vulnerable children and youth, reducing the likelihood of out-of-home placement and associated hardships.

Title: Social Services Programs - Eligibility and Enrollment
Synopsis: Requiring the Office of Home Energy Programs to enroll households, based on certain eligibility, in any fuel and utility assistance program; and altering the eligibility requirements for the electric universal service program to provide assistance to customers with annual incomes at or below 200% of the federal poverty level.
bill_summary: The bill expands and clarifies eligibility and enrollment procedures for social services programs in Maryland, including the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), energy assistance programs, and the electric universal service program.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services and Public Utilities Commission
stakeholders: Low-income individuals and families, elderly, households with children, and vulnerable populations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates eligibility and enrollment rules for existing programs, with some enhancements to targeted assistance, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to nutrition and energy assistance programs for low-income families.

Title: Provision of Veterinary Services - Practice of Veterinary Medicine and Rabies Vaccines
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners to issue a license to an animal control facility to administer rabies vaccines; requiring the Board to establish an expedited process to authorize a veterinary practitioner who holds a current, valid license to practice veterinary medicine in another state or jurisdiction to become licensed to practice veterinary medicine in the State; requiring the Secretary of Health to allow certain veterinary technicians or other clinical staff to administer rabies vaccines; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners to issue licenses to animal control facilities to administer rabies vaccines and allows certain veterinary practitioners licensed in other states to provide routine medical care, including vaccinations, to animals in Maryland. It also establishes a statewide rabies control system and sets regulations for vaccine administration by trained staff.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners
stakeholders: Animal shelters, veterinary practitioners, animal control facilities, and the public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an expedited licensing process for out-of-state veterinary practitioners and expands the roles of animal control facilities and staff in rabies vaccination and routine veterinary care, employing new approaches to veterinary service delivery and public health.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving animal health services and public health infrastructure, which can indirectly benefit communities.

Title: State Finance and Procurement - Grants - Prompt Payment Requirement
Synopsis: Establishing invoicing and prompt payment requirements for certain State grants; requiring the State to make payment under certain grant agreements within 37 days of the payment becoming due under the agreement or after receiving a proper invoice; and authorizing interest accrual at the rate of 9% per year on any amount that is due and payable but remains unpaid after a certain time.
bill_summary: The bill establishes invoicing and prompt payment requirements for certain state grants, including deadlines for payments and interest on late payments.
responsible_party: State grant-making entities and the Office of the Comptroller
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations receiving state grants and state agencies administering grants
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured, technology-enabled process for invoice submission, review, and payment to ensure timely payments and reduce delays.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to improve timely access to funds for nonprofits, which could help reduce child poverty indirectly.

Title: Hospitals - Financial Assistance - Medical Bill Reimbursement Process
Synopsis: Establishing requirements related to the reimbursement of out-of-pocket costs paid by certain hospital patients who were eligible for free care, including requirements related to the consideration of data and the reporting and disclosure of certain information; authorizing the Commission to impose a fine of up to $50,000 per violation if a hospital fails to provide refunds to qualifying patients; making a violation of the Act an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice subject to penalties under the Maryland Consumer Protection Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a process for identifying and reimbursing hospital patients who paid out-of-pocket costs but were eligible for free care, and modifies related reporting, data sharing, and enforcement provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Hospital Association and relevant State agencies including the Department of Health, Department of Human Services, Office of the Comptroller, and Department of Education.
stakeholders: Hospital patients who paid out-of-pocket costs and were eligible for free care, hospitals, and State agencies involved in healthcare and tax data sharing.
innovative_summary: The program employs data sharing and verification through tax and social service data to identify eligible patients and facilitate reimbursements, representing a new approach to healthcare financial assistance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by ensuring eligible families receive reimbursements for hospital costs, thereby alleviating financial burdens.

Title: Maryland Lynching Truth and Reconciliation Commission - Reporting and Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Extending the time for the submission of the final report of the Maryland Lynching Truth and Reconciliation Commission to December 1, 2025; and extending the termination date for the Commission to June 30, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill extends the reporting deadline and the termination date for the Maryland Lynching Truth and Reconciliation Commission, allowing it to submit its final report by December 1, 2025, and remain active until June 30, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Lynching Truth and Reconciliation Commission
stakeholders: Community members affected by lynching history and public officials involved in the commission
innovative_summary: The bill mainly extends existing reporting deadlines and the commission's duration; it does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Montgomery County - Alcohol Beverage Services - Advisory Board MC 04-23
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Advisory Board of the Alcohol Beverage Services of Montgomery County to include a designee of the Director of the Services and a designee of the Director of the Montgomery County Department of Police.
bill_summary: The bill amends the membership composition of the Advisory Board of the Alcohol Beverage Services of Montgomery County to include a designee of the Director of the Services and a designee of the Director of the Montgomery County Department of Police.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Alcohol Beverage Services and Montgomery County Department of Police
stakeholders: Residents of Montgomery County, Alcohol Beverage Services, Montgomery County Department of Police
innovative_summary: The bill updates the advisory board membership to include specific designees from county departments, which is a standard governance update.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Tax Clinics for Low-Income Marylanders - Funding - Repeal of Sunset
Synopsis: Repealing the termination date of certain provisions of law requiring the Comptroller to distribute a certain amount of certain abandoned property funds to the Tax Clinics for Low-Income Marylanders Fund which provides grants to the University of Maryland School of Law, the University of Baltimore School of Law, and the Maryland Volunteer Lawyers Service to operate tax clinics for low-income Maryland residents.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the sunset clause on funding for tax clinics for low-income Marylanders, ensuring continued financial support for these clinics operated by law schools and legal services organizations.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the Comptroller and the agencies managing the Tax Clinics for Low–Income Marylanders Fund
stakeholders: Low-income Maryland residents who benefit from free tax assistance and legal services
innovative_summary: The bill maintains ongoing funding for established tax clinics, which use existing legal and educational frameworks to serve low-income populations; it does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by providing low-income families with free tax assistance, which can increase their financial stability.

Title: Baltimore County - School Board Nominating Commission - Vacancy Procedures
Synopsis: Requiring the Baltimore County School Board Nominating Commission to hold a public hearing on the selection of a nominee for a single vacancy on the Baltimore County Board of Education in a certain manner under certain circumstances; requiring the Commission to make publicly available on its website live video streaming of certain public hearings and certain archived video recordings; and authorizing the Commission to retain and reactivate the applications of certain candidates for certain vacancies on the county board.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Baltimore County School Board Nominating Commission to hold public hearings and make video recordings available online when selecting nominees for the Baltimore County Board of Education, especially for vacancies. It also details the composition, appointment process, and procedures for reactivating candidate applications.
responsible_party: Baltimore County School Board Nominating Commission
stakeholders: Students, parents, educators, and residents of Baltimore County
innovative_summary: The bill employs live video streaming and archiving of public hearings to increase transparency and public engagement in the nomination process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on transparent and inclusive school board nominations can indirectly impact child poverty by promoting better governance and educational outcomes.

Title: Maryland School for the Blind - Public School Construction Program - Eligibility
Synopsis: Repealing the termination date on the eligibility of the Maryland School for the Blind for funding under the Public School Construction Program.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the termination date for the eligibility of the Maryland School for the Blind to receive funding under the Public School Construction Program, allowing continued funding beyond the previous cutoff.
responsible_party: Interagency Commission on School Construction
stakeholders: Students and staff at the Maryland School for the Blind, and the school itself
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends existing funding eligibility without introducing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but supports educational infrastructure for students with visual impairments.

Title: 6888th Central Postal Directory Battalion Day
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor annually to proclaim March 9 as 6888th Central Postal Directory Battalion Day in recognition of the service of the women of the 6888th Central Postal Directory Battalion during World War II.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Governor of Maryland to annually proclaim March 9 as 6888th Central Postal Directory Battalion Day to recognize the service of women in the battalion during World War II.
responsible_party: Governor of Maryland
stakeholders: Members of the 6888th Central Postal Directory Battalion, Maryland residents, historians, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill establishes an annual commemorative day through a gubernatorial proclamation, which is a traditional approach to honoring historical groups.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Recordation Tax - Indemnity Mortgage Exemption - Threshold Amount
Synopsis: Altering the threshold amount for certain indemnity mortgage transactions that are exempt from the recordation tax from less than $3,000,000 to less than $12,500,000; and applying the Act to instruments of writing recorded on or after July 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill increases the threshold amount for indemnity mortgage transactions that are exempt from the recordation tax in Maryland, allowing counties and Baltimore City to grant exemptions for mortgages between $3,000,000 and $15,000,000, and requires reporting on these exemptions.
responsible_party: Maryland State and Local Governments (Counties and Baltimore City)
stakeholders: Mortgage lenders, property owners, local governments, and the public involved in real estate transactions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted approach to tax exemption based on mortgage amounts, with reporting requirements to monitor the impact, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches beyond policy adjustments.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily affects real estate transaction taxes and exemptions.

Title: Higher Education – Veterans of the Afghanistan and Iraq Conflicts Scholarship – Altering Name of Scholarship
Synopsis: Altering the name of the Veterans of the Afghanistan and Iraq Conflicts Scholarship to be the Douglas J. J. Peters Veterans of the Afghanistan and Iraq Conflicts Scholarship.
bill_summary: The bill renames the existing Veterans of the Afghanistan and Iraq Conflicts Scholarship to the Douglas J. J. Peters Veterans of the Afghanistan and Iraq Conflicts Scholarship and establishes a dedicated fund for it, including provisions for funding, administration, and reporting.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Veterans of the Afghanistan and Iraq conflicts and eligible students
innovative_summary: The bill mainly renames an existing scholarship and establishes a dedicated fund, which is a standard administrative process, not an innovative approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include specific programs targeting it.

Title: Health Insurance – Pharmacy Benefits Managers – Audits of Pharmacies and Pharmacists
Synopsis: Requiring the Secretary of Health to adopt regulations for pharmacy benefits managers that contract with managed care organizations that establish requirements for conducting audits of pharmacies or pharmacists; establishing requirements and prohibitions regarding audits by certain pharmacy benefits managers, including provisions related to audit limits, acceptance of certain documents as proof, recoupment of funds or charging of fees for prescriptions of unbreakable package sizes, and access to financial documentation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands regulations and requirements for pharmacy benefits managers (PBMs) in Maryland, including rules for conducting audits of pharmacies and pharmacists, establishing registration and regulation procedures, and setting standards for audit processes, documentation, and dispute resolution.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Pharmacies, pharmacists, and consumers in Maryland who use pharmacy benefits management services
innovative_summary: The bill introduces comprehensive regulation of PBM audits, including registration of auditing entities, standardized procedures, and secure communication mechanisms, employing new regulatory approaches to oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on regulatory oversight of pharmacy benefits managers.

Title: Health Insurance - Diagnostic and Supplemental Examinations and Biopsies for Breast Cancer - Cost-Sharing
Synopsis: Prohibiting, except under certain circumstances, insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations that provide coverage for diagnostic and supplemental breast examinations from imposing a copayment, coinsurance, or deductible requirement for the examination; and requiring the Maryland Health Care Commission to study and report to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly by October 1, 2023 on the financial impact of eliminating cost-sharing for diagnostic image-guided biopsies for breast cancer.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits health insurance plans in Maryland from requiring copayments, coinsurance, or deductibles for diagnostic and supplemental breast examinations, including biopsies, with certain exceptions. It also mandates a study on the financial impact of eliminating cost-sharing for breast cancer biopsies.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Individuals undergoing breast cancer diagnostic and supplemental examinations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a policy approach to eliminate cost-sharing for specific breast cancer diagnostic procedures, promoting equitable access to essential health services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could improve access to breast cancer diagnostics, potentially reducing health disparities and associated economic burdens, which may indirectly impact child poverty.

Title: Montgomery County - Village of Friendship Heights Special Taxing District - Procurement MC 15-23
Synopsis: Increasing the threshold amount above which the Friendship Heights Village Council is prohibited from entering into a certain contract without a competitive bidding process; and authorizing the village council, by majority vote, to enter into a certain contract that exceeds the $20,000 threshold amount without a competitive bidding process if the procurement is in response to an emergency.
bill_summary: The bill increases the contract threshold for the Friendship Heights Village Council in Montgomery County from $5,000 to $20,000 and allows the council to bypass competitive bidding in emergency situations.
responsible_party: Friendship Heights Village Council, Montgomery County
stakeholders: Residents and government entities within the Village of Friendship Heights
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes procurement rules and introduces a specific emergency exception, which is a common government practice.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Commissioner of Financial Regulation - Name and Organization of Office
Synopsis: Establishing the name of a certain office under the Commissioner of Financial Regulation in the Maryland Department of Labor as the Office of Financial Regulation; designating a certain appointee of the Commissioner of Financial Regulation as the Deputy Commissioner for Depository Activities; requiring the Commissioner of Financial Regulation to appoint a Deputy Commissioner for Non-Depository Activities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Office of Financial Regulation within the Maryland Department of Labor, clarifies the roles and appointment of Deputy Commissioners for Depository and Non-Depository Activities, and makes related organizational and naming changes to the financial regulation structure in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Office of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Financial institutions, financial service providers, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily reorganizes and clarifies the structure of financial regulation in Maryland, with no new technological or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include specific programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Maryland Department of Health and Prescription Drug Affordability Board - Managed Care Organizations and Prescription Drug Claims - Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health and the Prescription Drug Affordability Board jointly to study certain information regarding the payment of prescription drug claims under the Maryland Medical Assistance Program during calendar years 2021 and 2022 and how to address certain inconsistencies; and requiring the Department and the Board to report the findings of the study to the Maryland Medicaid Administration and certain committees of the General Assembly by October 31, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health and the Prescription Drug Affordability Board to study the payment amounts made by managed care organizations to pharmacies for prescription drugs in 2021 and 2022, compare these to the rates paid under the Maryland Medical Assistance Program, and recommend methods to address any inconsistencies. It also establishes reimbursement levels for certain drug products and defines the responsibilities of various health organizations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Prescription Drug Affordability Board
stakeholders: Managed care organizations, pharmacies, Maryland Medical Assistance Program beneficiaries, state government
innovative_summary: The bill employs a data-driven approach to analyze and address reimbursement inconsistencies, including a joint study and recommendations, which is a relatively innovative approach to healthcare cost management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on prescription drug reimbursement and cost analysis could indirectly impact child poverty by potentially reducing healthcare costs for families and the state.

Title: Institutions of Higher Education - Transcripts - Prohibition on Punitive Measures Related to Student Debt
Synopsis: Prohibiting an institution of higher education from refusing to provide a current or former student with a transcript or taking other punitive measures regarding a student's transcript request because the student owes a debt to the institution of higher education.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits Maryland higher education institutions from refusing, delaying, or charging extra fees for transcripts or taking punitive actions against students who owe debts to the institution.
responsible_party: Institutions of Higher Education in Maryland
stakeholders: Current and former students of Maryland higher education institutions
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a clear legal prohibition against using transcript issuance as a tool for debt collection, ensuring fair treatment of students regardless of debt status.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily addresses administrative procedures related to student debts and transcripts.

Title: Natural Resources - Blue and Flathead Catfish Finfish Trotline License - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing a licensing and regulatory scheme to allow the commercial fishing of blue and flathead catfish in the tidal waters of the State using a finfish trotline.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a licensing scheme for the commercial fishing of blue and flathead catfish in Maryland's tidal waters using a finfish trotline, including the creation of a specific license with a $15 annual fee.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Commercial fishers targeting blue and flathead catfish in Maryland's tidal waters
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized license for a specific type of fishery (finfish trotline for catfish), which is a targeted regulatory approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it mainly involves fishery licensing regulations.

Title: Bond Sales - Notification of the Public
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of Public Works and the State Treasurer to provide public notice of a public sale of State bonds by The Municipal Market Monitor (TM3) or a similar service or such other method deemed appropriate by the State Treasurer.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Board of Public Works and the State Treasurer to provide public notice of State bond sales through a service or method they deem appropriate, such as the Municipal Market Monitor (TM3). It specifies notice requirements and procedures for bond sales and postponements.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Public Works and the State Treasurer
stakeholders: Public and investors interested in Maryland State bonds
innovative_summary: The bill allows the use of a modern, digital service (TM3) for public notification of bond sales, replacing traditional methods, which introduces a more efficient and potentially broader communication approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns the procedures for public notification of bond sales.

Title: Department of Agriculture - State Specialist for Value-Added Agriculture
Synopsis: Establishing the State Specialist for Value-Added Agriculture as a position in the Department of Agriculture to serve as the primary point of contact for individuals engaging in, or interested in engaging in, value-added agriculture in the State; and requiring the Specialist to provide information regarding State and federal regulations related to value-added agriculture and to act as a liaison between State and federal partners involved in value-added agriculture.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new position called the State Specialist for Value–Added Agriculture within the Maryland Department of Agriculture. This position will serve as a primary contact and liaison for individuals involved in value-added agriculture, providing information and support to promote and develop this sector.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Farmers, producers, processors, and businesses involved in value-added agriculture in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces a dedicated specialist role to support and promote value-added agriculture, leveraging targeted government support and coordination.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to support economic growth in agricultural communities, which could help reduce child poverty indirectly.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Parking Enforcement - Citations
Synopsis: Requiring a parking citation issued by a political subdivision, a State agency, or a third-party contractor to include a box that the person issued the citation may check to indicate that the registration plates cited were not issued for the vehicle described in the citation; requiring a political subdivision, State agency, or third-party contractor that receives a parking citation from a person with the box checked to perform a certain verification process and dismiss the citation under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires parking citations issued by Maryland authorities to include a checkbox allowing the recipient to indicate that the registration plates cited do not belong to the vehicle described. If checked, authorities must verify this claim and may dismiss the citation if verified.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or relevant local agencies
stakeholders: Vehicle owners, parking enforcement agencies, Maryland residents
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a verification process for parking citations based on a checkbox indicating misissued plates, integrating a new step in parking enforcement procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing on parking enforcement procedures.

Title: Maryland Tort Claims Act - Denial of Claims - Notice
Synopsis: Altering the means by which the State Treasurer may send notice of a denial of a claim made under the Maryland Tort Claims Act to authorize notice by e-mail or, if it is the only available means, by regular mail.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland Tort Claims Act to allow the State Treasurer to send notice of claim denial via email, or by regular mail if email is not available, and clarifies procedures related to claims and settlements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Treasurer's Office
stakeholders: Claimants under the Maryland Tort Claims Act and the Maryland State government
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of email as a means of official communication for claim denials, modernizing the notification process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Government - State Facilities Changes and Closures - Procedures
Synopsis: Requiring a principal department of the Executive Branch to give certain notice to the public, the General Assembly, and any exclusive representative with certain bargaining unit employees, hold a public hearing, submit a certain report, make the report publicly available, and allow the submission of certain comments before changing the use, purpose, or function of a State facility or closing a State facility.
bill_summary: This bill establishes procedures and requirements for the Maryland state government when changing the use or closing state facilities, including public hearings, notices, and reports.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Budget and Management or relevant principal department
stakeholders: State employees, residents, and clients of state facilities, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces structured public engagement and transparency procedures for state facility changes, including public hearings and detailed reporting.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on procedural transparency for state facilities.

Title: State Investment Portfolio - Investment Thresholds - Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing the limitations on investment in certain commercial paper in which the Treasurer may invest or reinvest certain unexpended or surplus funds; requiring the Treasurer to adopt regulations to establish a State investment policy with certain thresholds; and requiring the Treasurer to notify certain officials and governing bodies of certain local governmental units about the provisions of the Act.
bill_summary: The bill revises investment rules for Maryland's state funds, including repealing certain restrictions on commercial paper investments, establishing new investment thresholds, and requiring the Treasurer to adopt regulations and notify local governments about these changes.
responsible_party: Maryland State Treasurer's Office
stakeholders: State government, local government units, and taxpayers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal regulatory framework for state investment policies and emphasizes the use of minority business enterprises in investment management, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on investment policies and financial regulations.

Title: Maryland Audiology, Hearing Aid Dispensing, Speech-Language Pathology, and Music Therapy Act - Definitions and Application
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "hearing aid dispensary" to include certain actions taken for the purpose of ordering certain hearing instruments and specifying that certain hearing instruments include prescription hearing aids; altering the definition of "practice audiology" for the purposes of certain provisions of law governing the licensure of audiologists; and providing that certain provisions of law do not apply to certain actions taken with respect to certain over-the-counter hearing aids.
bill_summary: The bill updates the definitions and scope of practice for audiology and hearing aid dispensing in Maryland, including clarifying that certain actions related to ordering and providing prescription hearing aids are included in hearing aid dispensing. It also specifies that over-the-counter hearing aids are not subject to certain licensing provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech-Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists
stakeholders: Audiologists, hearing aid dispensers, speech-language pathologists, individuals with hearing loss, and consumers of hearing aids in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies legal definitions and scope of practice, with no significant use of new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly involves professional licensing and practice definitions.

Title: Kent County - Board of Education - Student Member
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Kent County Board of Education to include a student member; providing for the initial term of the student member of the county board; requiring the student member to attend the Maryland Association of Boards of Education new student board orientation and all regular meetings of the county board; prohibiting the student member's attendance at an executive session of the county board; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends the membership of the Kent County Board of Education to include a student member, establishes the process for electing this student member, and sets the terms and responsibilities for the student and voting members.
responsible_party: Kent County Board of Education
stakeholders: Students in Kent County, Kent County Public High School students, and the Kent County community
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a student representative to the county's Board of Education, allowing student voices to be formally included in educational governance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by giving students a voice in educational decisions that can influence resources and policies affecting students' well-being.

Title: Property Tax - Local Homeowners' Credit Supplement - Limitation on Combined Gross Income
Synopsis: Authorizing counties and municipal corporations to alter a certain limitation on the combined gross income of a homeowner for purposes of a local supplement to the homeowners' property tax credit; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes local governments in Maryland to grant property tax credits to homeowners with incomes exceeding $60,000 who have suffered hardships, and establishes procedures for administering these credits and local supplements to the homeowners' property tax credit program.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation and local government authorities
stakeholders: Homeowners with incomes over $60,000 who have experienced hardships in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a flexible, locally administered property tax credit program that allows for targeted assistance based on hardship and income, with potential for customized eligibility criteria.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by providing targeted property tax relief to homeowners, which could indirectly benefit families.

Title: Hunting - Snares, Traps, and Other Similar Devices - Identification Requirement
Synopsis: Requiring a person who is not required to be licensed or permitted under certain provisions of law to obtain a free Department of Natural Resources identification number before using a snare, a trap, or another similar device to capture wildlife; and requiring a person who uses a snare, a trap, or another similar device to capture wildlife to ensure the person's Department identification number is stamped on the device or on a metal tag affixed to the device.
bill_summary: The bill requires individuals using snares, traps, or similar devices to capture wildlife in Maryland to obtain a free identification number from the Department of Natural Resources and to stamp this number on the device or on a metal tag attached to it. It also establishes rules about the placement of traps near residences and allows for reporting of unmarked devices.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Wildlife trap users, landowners, and the general public interested in wildlife management and safety
innovative_summary: The bill employs a digital identification system for wildlife trapping devices, which is a modern approach to tracking and regulating trap use.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Elections - Polling Place Plan, Prohibited Acts, and 2024 Primary Election Date
Synopsis: Prohibiting a local board of elections from voting to change the location of a polling place without first holding a meeting to discuss the proposed change and providing an opportunity for individuals and organizations to testify; requiring each local board to submit a polling place plan to the State Board of Elections at least 6 months prior to each statewide primary election; altering the date of the 2024 statewide primary election and the primary election for municipal offices in Baltimore City to the second Tuesday in May; etc.
bill_summary: The bill introduces new rules for polling place changes, including requiring local election boards to hold meetings and provide notices before changing polling locations, and to submit detailed polling place plans for approval. It also modifies election procedures, voting influence laws, and inspection of election records, and sets the primary election date for 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters in Maryland, especially those in historically disenfranchised communities
innovative_summary: The bill employs new approaches such as detailed polling place planning, community engagement requirements, and specific protections for historically disenfranchised communities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve voting access for marginalized communities.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Violation of Pretrial or Posttrial Condition by Incarcerated Person - Victim Contact
Synopsis: Prohibiting a certain incarcerated person from violating a condition of pretrial or posttrial release or other pretrial or posttrial condition prohibiting the person from contacting, harassing, or abusing an alleged victim or going in or near an alleged victim's residence or place of employment.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits incarcerated persons from violating conditions of pretrial or posttrial release that restrict contact with victims, especially in cases involving minors, violence, or certain crimes, and establishes penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Incarcerated persons, victims of crimes, the criminal justice system
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal rules and penalties; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing on legal restrictions and penalties.

Title: Mental Health - Workforce Development - Fund Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Behavioral Health Workforce Investment Fund to provide reimbursement for costs associated with educating, training, certifying, recruiting, placing, and retaining behavioral health professionals and paraprofessionals; and requiring the Maryland Health Care Commission, in coordination with certain entities, to conduct a comprehensive behavioral health workforce needs assessment on or before October 1, 2024, and submit the assessment to certain committees of the General Assembly by October 15, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Behavioral Health Workforce Investment Fund to support training, recruiting, and retaining behavioral health professionals in Maryland. It also requires a comprehensive workforce needs assessment to guide fund allocations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Behavioral health professionals, paraprofessionals, and residents in need of behavioral health services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a dedicated fund and a comprehensive needs assessment to strategically address behavioral health workforce shortages, integrating data-driven planning and targeted funding.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by increasing access to behavioral health services for children and families.

Title: Health Services Cost Review Commission - Hospital Rates - All-Payer Model Contract
Synopsis: Requiring that the Health Services Cost Review Commission exercise its authority to consider certain standards when determining the reasonableness of certain rates in a manner that is consistent with the all-payer model contract.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Health Services Cost Review Commission to consider standards consistent with the all-payer model contract when determining the reasonableness of hospital rates, and grants the Commission authority to establish hospital rate levels, promote alternative payment methods, and assist with federally approved programs.
responsible_party: Health Services Cost Review Commission
stakeholders: Hospitals, health care purchasers, and patients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a flexible approach to hospital rate setting, including the promotion of alternative methods and experimental payment models, aligned with the all-payer model.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve healthcare affordability and access indirectly.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Nonvested Accounts - Regular Interest
Synopsis: Requiring a certain rate of interest on certain member contributions in active members' nonvested accounts in the State Retirement and Pension System if the members have not withdrawn contributions from the nonvested accounts and are not eligible to receive a certain vested allowance; providing for the retroactive application of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System to pay interest on certain member contributions in nonvested accounts for specific former members who are still active members of the system, with interest rates varying by system, and applies retroactively.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, particularly former members who are still active members and have nonvested accounts
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new requirement for paying interest on member contributions for certain active members with nonvested accounts, which is a new approach to managing member contributions and benefits.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns retirement account interest payments for specific members.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Medical Emergency - Immunity
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions relating to immunity from criminal arrest, charge, or prosecution for a person experiencing a medical emergency after ingesting or using alcohol or drugs.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland criminal law to provide immunity from arrest, charge, or prosecution for individuals who seek, provide, assist with, or receive medical assistance during a medical emergency involving alcohol or drugs, as long as the evidence was obtained solely due to their actions. It also prevents sanctions related to pretrial release, probation, or parole violations for such individuals.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government (unspecified department)
stakeholders: Individuals experiencing or assisting with medical emergencies involving alcohol or drugs in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces legal protections to encourage people to seek help during medical emergencies without fear of criminal repercussions, which is a significant policy change but not employing new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but could indirectly benefit children by encouraging emergency help-seeking behavior.

Title: University System of Maryland - Board of Regents - Student Member Grant
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of Regents of the University System of Maryland to authorize a certain grant for the student member serving in the first year of the student's term on the Board of Regents.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the University System of Maryland's Board of Regents to provide a grant to the student member serving in the first year of their term, funded by private donors, and a tuition waiver in the second year of their term, with specific limits on amounts and conditions.
responsible_party: University System of Maryland
stakeholders: Student members of the Board of Regents, University System of Maryland students
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new financial support program for student members of the Board of Regents, funded through private donations, which is a novel approach to supporting student governance participation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily supports student governance members.

Title: Procurement Improvement Council - Membership and Duties
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Procurement Improvement Council to include the Comptroller and the Attorney General; authorizing certain members to send a designee to attend certain meetings under certain circumstances; and clarifying the duties of the Council to include discussion of strategies to increase the participation of small, minority-owned, and women-owned businesses in procurement contracts.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the membership and duties of the Maryland Procurement Improvement Council, including clarifying how certain members can send designees and adding strategies to increase participation of small, minority–owned, and women–owned businesses in procurement.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of General Services (or equivalent responsible agency for procurement)
stakeholders: State procurement agencies, small businesses, minority–owned businesses, women–owned businesses, social service providers, local governments, general public involved in procurement processes
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates the council's membership and duties, with a focus on improving procurement processes and increasing participation of underrepresented businesses, which is a standard government reform approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but could indirectly benefit social service providers and small businesses that serve vulnerable populations.

Title: Prince George's County - Office of the Sheriff - Deputy Sheriffs and Labor Organizations PG 308-23
Synopsis: Increasing from four to five the number of full-time assistant sheriffs provided to the Sheriff of Prince George's County; and providing that the Fraternal Order of Police will negotiate on behalf of deputy sheriffs in benefit matters not related to salary.
bill_summary: The bill increases the number of full-time assistant sheriffs in Prince George's County, clarifies the duties and investigation authority of the Sheriff and deputy sheriffs, and modifies the negotiation process for benefits and employment conditions.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Office of the Sheriff
stakeholders: Residents of Prince George's County, law enforcement personnel, and local government officials
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates staffing, authority, and negotiation procedures for law enforcement, with some clarification of investigative duties, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on law enforcement staffing and procedures.

Title: Prince George's County - Speed Monitoring Systems - Maryland Route 210 (Indian Head Highway) PG 304-23
Synopsis: Increasing the maximum number of speed monitoring systems that may be placed and used on Maryland Route 210 (Indian Head Highway) in Prince George's County from three to six; requiring the State Highway Administration in conjunction with a certain entity to report annually its recommendations for solutions to address accidents, injuries, and fatalities on the highway; extending the termination date for a provision of law granting the authority to place speed monitoring systems on Maryland Route 210 in Prince George's County; etc.
bill_summary: The bill increases the number of speed monitoring systems on Maryland Route 210 in Prince George's County, extends the authority to place these systems, and modifies reporting and examination requirements related to traffic safety on the highway.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Department of Public Works and Transportation and the State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Motorists, residents, and institutions along Maryland Route 210 in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill employs existing speed monitoring technology and enhances data collection and safety analysis efforts, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is not directly targeted at child poverty but aims to improve traffic safety, which can indirectly benefit communities including children.

Title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Licensing PG 305-23
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County, notwithstanding a certain prohibition on the transfer of a license with an off-sale privilege, to approve the transfer of a Class A beer, wine, and liquor license to a premises located in a certain alcoholic beverages district under certain circumstances; authorizing the Board to issue a Class B-DD beer, wine, and liquor license with an off-sale privilege to certain restaurants in certain areas; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the transfer and issuance of certain alcohol licenses in Prince George's County, including new licenses with off-sale privileges for restaurants in specific development districts, and modifies rules regarding license transfers and issuance.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Prince George’s County
stakeholders: Restaurants, alcohol license holders, residents of Prince George’s County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a large number of new licenses (up to 50) for restaurants on Central Avenue, employing a new approach to licensing in development districts to promote economic activity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to stimulate local economic development and job creation, which can indirectly reduce child poverty.

Title: Prince George's County Public Schools - Alterations to Title of Chief Executive Officer and Establishment of Office of Integrity and Compliance PG 501-23
Synopsis: Changing the title of the Chief Executive Officer of the Prince George's County public school system to the County Superintendent of the Prince George's County public school system; establishing the Office of Integrity and Compliance in the Prince George's County public school system to evaluate, examine, investigate, report on, and make recommendations on certain issues related to the Prince George's County public school system; requiring the County Council of Prince George's County to appoint an Integrity and Compliance officer; etc.
bill_summary: The bill changes the title of the Chief Executive Officer of Prince George's County Public Schools to the County Superintendent, establishes an Office of Integrity and Compliance to oversee accountability, investigate issues, and report on the school system's effectiveness, and sets procedures for appointing and managing this office.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Council and Prince George's County Public Schools
stakeholders: Students, staff, vendors, and residents of Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a dedicated Office of Integrity and Compliance with powers to investigate, report, and improve accountability using independent evaluation and reporting, including the use of audits, investigations, and public reporting.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving school system accountability and effectiveness, which can lead to better educational outcomes.

Title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class B-Stadium (Baseball Stadium) Beer, Wine, and Liquor License PG 306-23
Synopsis: Altering the alcoholic beverages that may be sold under a certain stadium license in Prince George's County; authorizing the holder of a Class B-Stadium (baseball stadium) beer, wine, and liquor license to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption; altering a provision of law providing that the profit from the sale of certain alcoholic beverages under the license may accrue to the use of the Maryland-National Capital Park and Planning Commission or the concessionaire; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the alcoholic beverage licensing laws in Prince George's County, allowing the holder of a Class B–Stadium license for baseball stadiums to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption, and clarifies the allocation of profits from these sales.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Alcoholic Beverages Board or relevant licensing authority
stakeholders: Baseball stadium concessionaires, stadium visitors, local residents, and businesses in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates licensing rules and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly concerns licensing regulations for alcohol sales at stadiums.

Title: Child Custody - Relocation of Child - Expedited Hearing (Assurance of Child's Safety Act)
Synopsis: Requiring a court to schedule a hearing on a certain petition regarding the proposed relocation of a child who is the subject of a custody or visitation order on an expedited basis under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill requires courts to hold expedited hearings on petitions related to the proposed relocation of a child in custody or visitation cases, especially when the relocation is more than 40 miles away or would interfere with parenting time. It also clarifies that a child's time spent with a party who relocates in violation of notice provisions cannot be used to favor that party in custody decisions.
responsible_party: Maryland courts (family law courts)
stakeholders: Children involved in custody and visitation cases, parents, guardians, and legal parties in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a streamlined process for handling relocation disputes in custody cases and explicitly prevents the child's time with a violating party from being used advantageously, employing procedural clarifications to improve fairness.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on legal procedures for custody and relocation.

Title: Prince George's County - Payment in Lieu of Taxes Agreements - Low-Income Housing PG 403-23
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of Prince George's County to enter into a payment in lieu of taxes agreement with an owner of real property that is used for low-income housing that is financed through the county's Right of First Refusal program or acquired, constructed, or rehabilitated for the purposes of operating the low-income housing.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Prince George's County to enter into agreements with owners of low-income housing to pay a negotiated amount in lieu of property taxes, specifically for properties financed through the county's Right of First Refusal program or used for operating low-income rental housing.
responsible_party: Prince George's County government
stakeholders: Low-income housing residents and property owners in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a flexible payment-in-lieu-of-taxes agreement for low-income housing, allowing tailored financial arrangements to support affordable housing development and maintenance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to directly impact child poverty by supporting affordable housing for low-income families.

Title: Nonpublic Education - Placements of Children With Disabilities - Teacher Salaries (Teacher Pay Parity Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education to adopt regulations to ensure that children with disabilities who need special education and related services that cannot be provided in a public county, regional, or State program be placed in an appropriate nonpublic educational program that offers these services; requiring the State and certain counties to pay for costs of salaries for teachers at certain nonpublic schools in a certain amount and proportion; etc.
bill_summary: The bill, known as the Teacher Pay Parity Act, renames nonpublic educational placements to 'special education placements' and mandates that the State and counties pay for teacher salaries at these placements, ensuring salary parity with public school teachers over a phased period.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Children with disabilities, teachers at nonpublic special education placements, families, and public school systems
innovative_summary: The bill employs a phased approach to salary parity, requiring nonpublic schools to match public school teacher salaries over three years, and mandates regulations for implementation, representing a structured and innovative approach to ensuring teacher salary parity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving educational quality and stability for children with disabilities.

Title: State Board of Physicians - Inactive and Emeritus Status
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board to place a licensee on emeritus status under certain circumstances; requiring the Board, under certain circumstances, to reinstate the license of an individual who is on inactive or emeritus status; exempting licensees who are on inactive status or emeritus status from continuing medical education requirements; repealing the requirement that the Board issue a license to an individual who is on inactive status under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Physicians to place physicians on emeritus status, establish rules for inactive status, and clarify restrictions on practicing medicine or representing oneself as a physician while on these statuses. It also repeals certain licensing requirements for inactive physicians and sets conditions for reinstatement.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Physicians
stakeholders: Physicians in Maryland, especially those nearing retirement or inactive status, and the public receiving medical services
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal emeritus status for physicians, allowing retired physicians to maintain a recognized status without practicing medicine, and clarifies legal and practice boundaries for inactive and emeritus physicians.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on physician licensing and status regulations.

Title: Health Occupations - Licenses, Certificates, and Registrations - Lawful Presence and Identification Numbers
Synopsis: Prohibiting a health occupations board from requiring that an applicant provide proof that the applicant is lawfully present in the United States or have a Social Security number or Individual Taxpayer Identification Number as a condition for licensure, certification, or registration; requiring each health occupations board to require each applicant for a license to disclose the Social Security number or Individual Taxpayer Identification Number of the applicant or, as permitted by federal law, provide alternative documentation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits health occupations boards in Maryland from denying licenses, certifications, or registrations to immigrants if they meet certain requirements, such as providing proof of lawful presence in the U.S. or having a Social Security or Taxpayer Identification Number. It also mandates disclosure of these numbers during application and updates record-keeping procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and other licensing authorities
stakeholders: Immigrants seeking health occupation licenses, licensing boards, and the general public
