innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach to licensing by removing barriers for immigrants and requiring disclosure of identification numbers, streamlining the licensing process for qualified immigrants.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by increasing employment opportunities for immigrants in health professions.

Title: Video Lottery Terminal Proceeds - Purse Dedication Account - Ocean Downs Race Course Operating Loss Assistance
Synopsis: Altering the authority of the Ocean Downs Race Course to use certain Purse Dedication Account funds generated from video lottery terminal proceeds for operating loss assistance to support a certain minimum number of live racing days at the racecourse.
bill_summary: The bill allows Ocean Downs Race Course to use funds from the Purse Dedication Account, generated from video lottery terminal proceeds, to help cover operating losses and support a minimum of 40 live racing days annually.
responsible_party: Maryland State Racing Commission
stakeholders: Horse racing industry, racecourse operators, local communities, and bettors in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted financial assistance program using video lottery terminal proceeds to support live racing operations, ensuring minimum racing days.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on the horse racing industry and associated economic activities.

Title: State Board of Pharmacy - Accessible Prescription Labels, Bag Tags, and Medical Guides for Blind, Visually Impaired, and Print Disabled Individuals - Regulations
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Pharmacy to adopt regulations necessary to ensure that individuals who are blind, visually impaired, or otherwise print disabled have appropriate access to prescription labels, bag tags, and medical guides; requiring the Board to give visually impaired individuals an opportunity to comment on the regulations; and requiring the Maryland Department of Health to report by December 1, 2023, to the General Assembly on the implementation process for providing accessible labels for visually impaired persons.
bill_summary: The bill requires pharmacies to inform customers about the availability of accessible prescription labels for blind, visually impaired, or print-disabled individuals, and to provide these labels upon request. It establishes standards for accessible labels and prescription readers, and mandates the Maryland State Board of Pharmacy to adopt regulations to ensure access to prescription labels, bag tags, and medical guides for disabled individuals.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Pharmacy
stakeholders: Blind, visually impaired, and print-disabled individuals who need accessible prescription information
innovative_summary: The program employs new regulations and standards to improve accessibility of prescription information for disabled individuals, including the use of accessible labels and prescription readers.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access to necessary medications for disabled individuals, including children.

Title: Public School Construction - Programs, Approvals, and Administration - Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing the School Safety Grant Program and the Aging Schools Program as of June 30, 2026; altering provisions relating to school construction approvals by the State Superintendent of Schools; altering provisions related to a public-private partnership agreement in Prince George's County; establishing that the Interagency Commission on School Construction is an independent unit of State government; repealing the requirement for the Board of Public Works to approve grants awarded under a certain capital grant program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the School Safety Grant Program and the Aging Schools Program, modifies school construction approval processes, establishes the Interagency Commission on School Construction as an independent entity, and creates a public-private partnership framework for school construction in Prince George's County, including funding mechanisms and evaluation standards.
responsible_party: Interagency Commission on School Construction and Maryland Stadium Authority
stakeholders: Public school students, school districts, Prince George's County residents, private partners involved in school construction
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new public-private partnership model for school construction, including a dedicated fund, evaluation standards for energy efficiency, and an independent commission to oversee the process, employing innovative financing and evaluation approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by improving school infrastructure and access to quality education through innovative funding and construction methods.

Title: State Board of Architects - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Architects in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2028, the termination provisions relating to certain statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Architects in Maryland, allowing it to continue operating until 2033, and updates the effective date to June 1, 2023.
responsible_party: State Board of Architects in the Department of Maryland
stakeholders: Architects and related professionals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches; it mainly extends the existing authority of the Board.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Natural Resources - Recreational Crabbing Gear - Individuals Under the Age of 16 Years
Synopsis: Authorizing an individual under the age of 16 years to use a collapsible trap, net ring, handline, or dip net when catching or attempting to catch crabs in the waters of the Chesapeake Bay and its tidal tributaries without a recreational crabbing license.
bill_summary: The bill exempts individuals under 16 years old from needing a recreational crabbing license to catch crabs in the Chesapeake Bay and its tidal tributaries. It also allows children under 16 to use specific gear such as collapsible traps, net rings, handlines, or dip nets for recreational crabbing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Children under 16, recreational crabbers, environmental regulators
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies regulations for young recreational crabbers by removing licensing requirements and explicitly permitting the use of certain gear, promoting youth engagement in recreational activities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may encourage youth participation in outdoor activities.

Title: Worcester County - Natural Resources - Hunting
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Natural Resources to allow a person in Worcester County to hunt game birds and game mammals on a Sunday, subject to certain time restrictions, during the open season for that game bird or game mammal; authorizing the Department to allow a person in Worcester County to hunt on public land designated for hunting on Sundays, subject to certain time restrictions; and altering the safety zone from 150 to 50 yards from certain buildings occupied by human beings within which archery hunting may not take place.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Department of Natural Resources to allow hunting on Sundays in Worcester County during specific seasons and on designated public lands, with certain restrictions and time limits, and makes related adjustments to safety zones and hunting regulations.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Hunters and residents of Worcester County and other counties with expanded Sunday hunting opportunities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach by allowing Sunday hunting in Worcester County and on certain public lands, expanding traditional hunting days and utilizing existing hunting seasons with specific restrictions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily expands hunting regulations and opportunities.

Title: Environment - Fire-Fighting Training - Oriented Strand Board - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting the setting on fire or burning of oriented strand board for certain fire-fighting training; and establishing an administrative penalty not exceeding $500 for a first violation of the Act and a civil penalty not exceeding $1,000 for a second or subsequent violation of the Act.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits setting fire to or burning oriented strand board (OSB) for fire-fighting training purposes, establishing penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Firefighters, environmental agencies, manufacturers of oriented strand board, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a regulatory approach to prevent environmental and safety issues related to the use of OSB in fire-fighting training.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Economic Development – Regional Institution Strategic Enterprise Zone Program – Alterations and Financing
Synopsis: Altering the period of time that an area may be designated as a Regional Institution Strategic Enterprise (RISE) zone from 5 to 10 years; increasing the number of RISE zones that the Secretary of Commerce may approve in Baltimore City to not more than four; extending the termination date of the RISE Program to January 1, 2030; and authorizing a political subdivision to pledge certain revenues to secure the payment of obligations to the Maryland Economic Development Corporation for infrastructure improvements located in a RISE zone.
bill_summary: The bill extends the designation period for RISE zones from 5 to 10 years, allows renewal for an additional 5 years, increases the number of RISE zones in Baltimore City, and extends the program's termination date to 2030. It also authorizes local governments to pledge revenues to secure infrastructure financing and mandates a study on the program's effectiveness.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Qualified institutions, counties, municipal corporations, economic development agencies, and communities within RISE zones
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted geographic economic development zones with renewal and financing mechanisms, which is a strategic approach but not highly technological or innovative in nature.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by fostering economic development and community improvements in designated zones.

Title: Public Senior Higher Education Institutions - Reproductive Health Services Plans - Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring, on or before August 1, 2024, certain public senior higher education institutions, in consultation with students, to develop and implement a reproductive health services plan to provide at the institution or to refer students to a comprehensive range of reproductive health services; requiring the University of Baltimore, in lieu of developing and implementing a reproductive health services plan, to provide students with access to over-the-counter contraception through certain on-campus means; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires certain public higher education institutions in Maryland to develop and implement reproductive health services plans, including access to contraception, STI prevention, and abortion services, in consultation with students. The University of Baltimore can provide students with over-the-counter contraception through on-campus retail or vending machines as an alternative.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and public higher education institutions
stakeholders: Students at public higher education institutions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive reproductive health services plan for public colleges, including innovative access points like vending machines for contraception and a referral network for off-campus services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve health and well-being of students, which can contribute to reducing child poverty indirectly.

Title: Department of Veterans Affairs - Burial in State Veterans' Cemeteries - Spouses and Dependents
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Veterans Affairs to bury the eligible spouse or dependent of a veteran in a State veterans' cemetery without charge.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Veterans Affairs to provide burial plots at no charge for spouses and dependents of veterans in state veterans' cemeteries, including covering the costs for opening and closing the plots.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans Affairs
stakeholders: Spouses and dependents of veterans in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes existing rules to ensure free burial services for veterans' spouses and dependents, with no new technology or innovative approach introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly addresses burial costs for veterans' families.

Title: Grossly Negligent or Drunk or Drugged Operation of Vehicle or Vessel - Prior Convictions
Synopsis: Establishing that certain previous convictions for drunk or drugged operation of a vehicle or vessel and grossly negligent manslaughter by vehicle or vessel under certain provisions of law constitute prior convictions for the purpose of determining certain enhanced subsequent offender penalties.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland law to consider previous convictions for drunk or drugged driving and grossly negligent manslaughter as prior convictions for enhanced penalties, and clarifies penalties for operating vessels and vehicles under influence.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources and Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Individuals convicted of operating vehicles or vessels under influence, law enforcement, legal system, and public safety
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal definitions and penalties; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on legal penalties for impaired operation.

Title: Task Force to Study Nonpublic Student Bus Transportation
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force to Study Nonpublic Student Bus Transportation to collect information from each local board of education on nonpublic school student busing programs other than for the transportation of students in special education; and requiring the Task Force to report by December 15, 2023, to certain committees of the General Assembly any recommendations as to how the State may support a reduction in the use of passenger vehicles for nonpublic school students and policies for certain busing programs.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Task Force to study nonpublic student bus transportation and proposes a refundable income tax credit of up to $1,500 per student for transportation expenses paid by parents or guardians of students attending nonpublic schools. The task force will evaluate current programs, impact on state resources, and recommend policies to reduce passenger vehicle use for student transportation.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Parents and guardians of students attending nonpublic schools, nonpublic school students, school transportation providers, and state transportation and education agencies.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a combination of a task force to study transportation issues and a new tax credit to incentivize transportation support for nonpublic school students, integrating policy research with financial incentives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce transportation barriers for students from low-income families, thereby possibly reducing child poverty.

Title: Anne Arundel County - School Vehicles - Duration of Operation
Synopsis: Altering the number of years that a school vehicle may be operated in Anne Arundel County from 12 years to 15 years.
bill_summary: The bill amends the rules for how long school vehicles can be operated in Anne Arundel County, increasing the maximum operation period from 12 to 15 years under certain conditions.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Department of Education or local transportation authorities
stakeholders: Students, school transportation providers, and local government in Anne Arundel County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a more flexible, maintenance-based approach to extending the lifespan of school vehicles, emphasizing inspections and structural repairs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could indirectly impact child poverty by ensuring safer and more reliable school transportation, potentially improving school attendance.

Title: Early Childhood Development - Child Care Scholarship Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Prohibiting the State Department of Education from increasing the copayment levels, reducing the reimbursement rates, reducing the income eligibility requirements, or implementing an enrollment freeze for the Child Care Scholarship Program in effect as of January 1, 2023, unless certain conditions are met.
bill_summary: The bill makes changes to the Maryland Child Care Scholarship Program, including funding levels, eligibility, copayment requirements, and program operations, with a focus on ensuring sufficient funding and preventing reductions or freezes unless specific conditions are met.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Children and families eligible for child care assistance in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a data-driven approach to setting reimbursement rates and includes provisions to prevent program freezes unless specific conditions are met, ensuring continuous support for child care providers and families.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing access to affordable child care for low-income families.

Title: Rural Health Collaborative Pilot Repeal and Mid Shore Health Improvement Coalition Funding
Synopsis: Repealing the provisions of law establishing and governing the Rural Health Collaborative Pilot; and requiring the Governor to provide an appropriation in the State budget for fiscal year 2024 and each fiscal year thereafter to fund the operations of the Mid Shore Health Improvement Coalition.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the Rural Health Collaborative Pilot in the mid-shore region and establishes funding for the Mid Shore Health Improvement Coalition, including ongoing state budget appropriations starting in fiscal year 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the Department of Health
stakeholders: Residents and healthcare providers in the mid-shore region of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily reallocates existing programs and establishes ongoing funding, with no new innovative technologies or approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program aims to improve healthcare access and outcomes in the mid-shore region, which could help reduce child poverty indirectly.

Title: Board of Public Works Public Comment Act
Synopsis: Requiring the Board of Public Works, for meetings held on or after October 1, 2024, to allow members of the public to submit certain public comments electronically except under certain circumstances; requiring public comments to be included in certain meeting materials and posted and retained online; and requiring an additional staff position at the Board to carry out requirements of the Act.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Board of Public Works to allow the public to submit comments electronically for meetings starting October 1, 2024. These comments must be included in meeting materials, posted online at least 24 hours before meetings, and retained online. The bill also mandates an additional staff position to manage these requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Public Works
stakeholders: Members of the public interested in public meetings and government transparency
innovative_summary: The bill employs digital technology to facilitate public participation in government meetings, making comments accessible online and in real-time.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but promotes government transparency and public engagement.

Title: Department of Human Services - Electronic Benefits Transfer Cards - Theft of Benefits (Prevent Electronic Benefits Theft Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Human Services to restore to a beneficiary any benefits lost due to theft; authorizing certain households to request a hearing within 90 days after a certain determination; requiring the State to give preference to certain vendors in the procurement process for electronic benefits distribution or administration; authorizing the Department to restore certain benefits; requiring the Department to take certain actions to reduce the vulnerability of Electronic Benefits Transfer cards to theft; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Human Services to reimburse beneficiaries for benefits lost due to theft or fraudulent use of Electronic Benefits Transfer (EBT) cards. It establishes procedures for reporting, investigating, and restoring stolen benefits, and mandates improvements in the security of EBT cards, including the use of microchips and enhanced fraud detection measures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Recipients of electronic benefits, low-income households, and vulnerable populations using EBT cards
innovative_summary: The bill employs new technologies such as microchips in EBT cards, two-way fraud alerts, and transaction monitoring using user behavior analytics to prevent and detect theft and fraud.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by ensuring families retain their benefits and are protected from theft, which can directly impact their ability to meet basic needs.

Title: Natural Resources - Greenspace Equity Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Greenspace Equity Program in the Department of Natural Resources to provide grants to eligible applicants for enhancing the public health and livability of overburdened and underserved communities by implementing projects to preserve, create, and enhance community greenspace; requiring the Department to submit certain grant applications to the Maryland State Clearinghouse for Intergovernmental Assistance; requiring certain grant applications to be subject to approval by the Board of Public Works; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Greenspace Equity Program within the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to provide grants for projects that enhance greenspace in overburdened and underserved communities, including land acquisition and stewardship activities, with oversight and approval processes involving the Board of Public Works and a new Greenspace Equity Advisory Board.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Overburdened communities, underserved communities, land trusts, local governments, and residents in targeted areas
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach combining land acquisition, community engagement, and inter-agency collaboration, with oversight by a new advisory board, to improve greenspace equity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by improving access to greenspace, which benefits public health and community livability.

Title: Maryland Developmental Disabilities Council - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Developmental Disabilities Council as an independent unit of State government with the authority to conduct and support advocacy, systems change, and capacity-building efforts to promote inclusive communities and equity in services for individuals with disabilities in the State, research best practices and provide related training and technical assistance to communities in the State, and inform State and local leaders about disability issues.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Developmental Disabilities Council as an independent unit of State government, responsible for advocacy, research, and policy advising related to developmental disabilities, with a focus on promoting inclusive communities and equity in services.
responsible_party: Maryland Developmental Disabilities Council
stakeholders: Individuals with developmental disabilities, their families, and related organizations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill creates a dedicated, independent council to coordinate advocacy, research, and policy efforts for developmental disabilities, emphasizing inclusive community development and systemic change.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by improving services and advocacy for children with developmental disabilities and their families.

Title: Elevator Safety - Privately Owned Single-Family Residential Elevators - Inspection and Registration Requirements
Synopsis: Establishing that an elevator installed in a privately owned single-family residential dwelling on or after October 1, 2023, is subject to certain inspection and registration requirements; prohibiting the Commissioner of Labor and Industry from disclosing to the public any information regarding a registered elevator unit installed in a privately owned single-family residential dwelling; and requiring the Commissioner to delete certain registration information on the completion of the final acceptance inspection on a certain unit.
bill_summary: The bill establishes inspection and registration requirements for elevators installed in privately owned single-family residential dwellings in Maryland, effective for installations on or after October 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety or relevant safety authority
stakeholders: Homeowners with private single-family residential elevators in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a regulatory approach to ensure safety through mandatory registration and inspections, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on safety regulations for residential elevators.

Title: Property Tax Credit - Disabled Law Enforcement Officers and Rescue Workers - Definition and Eligibility
Synopsis: Requiring a county or municipal corporation to define, by law, who is a law enforcement officer or rescue worker; altering eligibility for the tax credit to include certain disabled law enforcement officers or rescue workers who were domiciled in the State as, or any time within the 5 years before the officer or worker died or was determined to be disabled; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland counties and municipal corporations to define who qualifies as a law enforcement officer or rescue worker, and expands property tax credits for disabled officers, fallen officers, and rescue workers, including those who were domiciled in the state within five years before disability or death.
responsible_party: Maryland counties and municipal corporations
stakeholders: Disabled law enforcement officers, rescue workers, their families, and cohabitants in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes definitions and expands eligibility for property tax credits for disabled and fallen officers, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program may have a limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily benefiting families of disabled or fallen officers.

Title: State Board of Elections - Municipal Elections - Publication of Results on Website
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Elections to publish municipal election results on its website immediately after a municipality submits its election results; and requiring, within 30 days after the results of a municipal election are certified, the municipality to submit to the State Board an electronic copy of the election results for each office or question voted on at the election.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Elections to establish an electronic portal on its website for municipalities to submit election results, and to publish these results immediately after submission. Municipalities must submit detailed election results within 30 days of certification.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Municipal governments and voters in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new online portal and real-time publication of municipal election results to improve transparency and accessibility.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but enhances transparency in local elections.

Title: Investor-Owned Utilities - Prevailing Wage - Enforcement
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to enforce certain prevailing wage requirements for contractors and subcontractors working on projects involving and traffic control activities related to underground gas or electric infrastructure of an investor-owned gas company, electric company, or gas and electric company; requiring certain contractors and subcontractors to request from the Department a copy of a certain wage determination and ensure that employees are paid in compliance with existing prevailing wage rates; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires investor-owned gas and electric utilities in Maryland to ensure their contractors and subcontractors pay employees prevailing wages for work on underground infrastructure projects. It mandates the Maryland Department of Labor to enforce these wage requirements, provide guidance, and determine prevailing wages if not already established.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Contractors, subcontractors, and employees working on underground gas and electric infrastructure projects of investor-owned utilities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a direct enforcement approach by the Department of Labor to ensure prevailing wages, including guidance provision and wage determination, which enhances compliance and oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially reduce child poverty by ensuring fair wages for workers involved in infrastructure projects, leading to economic benefits for families.

Title: Agriculture - Use of Antimicrobial Drugs - Reporting Deadlines
Synopsis: Altering the date from February 1, 2020 and each February 1 thereafter, to July 1 each year, on which the Department of Agriculture must submit to the General Assembly a certain annual report regarding the use of medically important antimicrobial drugs in cattle, swine, and poultry to the General Assembly.
bill_summary: This bill amends the reporting deadlines for the Maryland Department of Agriculture regarding the use of medically important antimicrobial drugs in livestock, requiring annual reports to be submitted by July 1 each year starting in 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Livestock farmers, veterinarians, public health officials, and consumers concerned with antimicrobial use in agriculture
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates reporting deadlines and data collection procedures, without introducing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may contribute to public health improvements.

Title: City of Annapolis - Alcoholic Beverages - Art Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing an art establishment beer and wine license in the City of Annapolis; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners to issue the license to sell or serve beer and wine for on-premises consumption to a nonprofit organization primarily engaged in certain arts-related activities; and providing for a license fee of $1,000.
bill_summary: The bill establishes an art establishment beer and wine license in Annapolis, allowing nonprofit organizations engaged in art display, instruction, or live performances to sell or serve beer and wine on-site.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners in Annapolis
stakeholders: Nonprofit art organizations and their audiences in Annapolis
innovative_summary: The program introduces a specialized license for nonprofit art organizations to sell alcohol, integrating alcohol sales with arts activities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing on arts and alcohol licensing.

Title: Maryland Stadium Authority - Camden Yards Sports Facilities Funds and Bus Rapid Transit Fund
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Maryland Stadium Authority; establishing the Camden Yards Football Sports Facility Supplemental Financing Fund and the Camden Yards Baseball Sports Facility Supplemental Financing Fund to enable the Maryland Stadium Authority to take certain actions; requiring the Authority to administer the funds; altering the amount the Comptroller is required to distribute from the State Lottery Fund to certain funds; establishing the Bus Rapid Transit Fund to provide grants to eligible grantees; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes special funds and modifies the membership and operations of the Maryland Stadium Authority to support financing for sports facilities at Camden Yards, including football and baseball stadiums, and creates a Bus Rapid Transit Fund to support transit projects. It also allocates lottery funds to these new funds and other related programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Stadium Authority and Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Sports teams, sports fans, transit users, residents of Prince George's County, and the general public benefiting from sports and transit infrastructure
innovative_summary: The bill employs a financial and administrative approach to support sports and transit infrastructure through dedicated funds, leveraging lottery revenues and bond sales, which is a common but strategic approach to public infrastructure funding.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but may indirectly benefit communities through improved sports and transit facilities.

Title: Outdoor Preschool License Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Outdoor Preschool License Pilot Program in the State Department of Education to license outdoor, nature-based early learning and child care programs to expand access to affordable, high-quality early learning and child care programs and investigate the benefits of outdoor, nature-based classrooms; requiring the Department to submit a final report to the Governor and General Assembly by December 1, 2027, with recommendations for modifying or expanding the Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Outdoor Preschool License Pilot Program in Maryland, which licenses outdoor, nature-based early learning and child care programs to expand access to high-quality, affordable early childhood education and investigate the benefits of outdoor classrooms.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Children and families in Maryland, early childhood education providers, and communities interested in outdoor, nature-based learning environments.
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by licensing outdoor, nature-based early childhood programs and adapting existing quality assessment tools for this innovative setting.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve access to quality early childhood education, which can help reduce child poverty by supporting early development and family stability.

Title: St. Mary's County - Transfer of Child Support Unit and Personnel to the Child Support Administration
Synopsis: Transferring all the functions, powers, and duties of the Child Support Unit of the Office of the State's Attorney for St. Mary's County and certain personnel to the Child Support Administration of the Department of Human Services.
bill_summary: The bill transfers the functions, powers, and personnel of the Child Support Unit of the Office of the State’s Attorney for St. Mary’s County to the Child Support Administration of the Department of Human Services, effective October 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Child support enforcement agencies, residents of St. Mary’s County, families involved in child support cases
innovative_summary: The bill primarily involves administrative transfer of existing services and personnel, with no new technological or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve child support enforcement efficiency, which can help reduce child poverty.

Title: Correctional Officers’ Retirement System – Transfer of Membership – Modifications
Synopsis: Making certain members of the Correctional Officers' Retirement System eligible to receive creditable service at retirement for unused sick leave accrued by the member in the State Employees' Retirement System or State Employees' Pension System; and requiring the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System to transfer certain individuals' Employees' Retirement System or Employees' Pension System service to the Correctional Officers' Retirement System on June 30, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill allows certain members of the Correctional Officers' Retirement System to receive credit for unused sick leave from other Maryland state retirement systems upon retirement, and mandates the transfer of service credits for eligible individuals from the Employees' Retirement System or Pension System to the Correctional Officers' Retirement System by June 30, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Correctional officers and other Maryland state employees eligible for retirement system transfers
innovative_summary: The program employs a policy approach to enhance retirement benefits by integrating unused sick leave credits and consolidating service credits across multiple retirement systems, which is a relatively innovative approach to retirement benefits management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns retirement benefits for state employees.

Title: Gaming - Video Lottery Terminals - Local Impact Grants and Pimlico Community Development Authority Membership - Baltimore City
Synopsis: Altering the distribution of certain funds from local impact grants to Baltimore City; and altering the appointment process for certain members of the Pimlico Community Development Authority.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the distribution of funds from video lottery terminal local impact grants, including increasing the share allocated to Baltimore City and changing the appointment process for the Pimlico Community Development Authority members.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency
stakeholders: Baltimore City residents, local businesses, and community development projects in the Park Heights area
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted approach to fund community development and public safety projects, with specific allocations and reporting requirements, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by funding community development and safety projects, especially in underserved neighborhoods.

Title: Election Law - Ballot Issuance, Processing, and Reporting Procedures and 2024 Primary Date
Synopsis: Requiring a local board of elections to send, not later than 43 days before an election, a ballot to voters who have made a request and qualify to vote by absentee ballot; altering the procedures for the canvassing of and curing of errors on absentee and provisional ballots; prohibiting the tabulation of absentee ballot vote totals before the polls close; requiring that the statewide primary election and the primary election for the municipal offices of Baltimore City in 2024 be held on the second Tuesday in May; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland election procedures, including ballot issuance timelines, canvassing processes, and reporting of election results. It also changes the primary election date in 2024 to the second Tuesday in May.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters, election officials, political candidates in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies existing election procedures and reporting requirements; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Earnable Compensation, Nonvested Former Members, and Immediate Vesting
Synopsis: Specifying that the definition of "earnable compensation" does not include certain payments requiring the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System to pay a nonvested former member's accumulated contributions to the nonvested former member's designated beneficiary or estate if the nonvested former member dies before withdrawing the member's contributions; and providing a list of individuals who immediately vest on taking certain offices.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the definition of 'earnable compensation' for the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, specifies procedures for paying out nonvested former members' contributions upon death, and grants immediate vesting rights to certain high-level state officials upon taking office.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: State employees, former members of the retirement system, high-level state officials
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward legal clarification and procedural update without introducing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on retirement system rules and benefits.

Title: State Procurement - Small Procurement - Definition
Synopsis: Increasing certain dollar thresholds of spending for the purposes of defining "small procurement" for State procurement contracts.
bill_summary: The bill increases the dollar thresholds for defining 'small procurement' in Maryland's state procurement contracts, raising the limits from $50,000 to $100,000 for most categories and from $100,000 to $200,000 for construction and capital projects.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, Department of General Services and Department of Transportation
stakeholders: State agencies, contractors, and vendors involved in state procurement processes
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing procurement thresholds and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Family Prosperity Act of 2023
Synopsis: Altering the percentage of the federal earned income tax credit used for determining the amount that an individual may claim as a refund under the Maryland earned income tax credit under certain circumstances; repealing a certain limitation on the amount certain individuals may claim as a refund under the credit; altering the definition of "qualified child" and income eligibility requirements for purposes of qualifying for a certain credit against the State income tax for certain dependent children; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland's earned income tax credit and dependent child credit, increasing eligibility, changing refund calculations, and extending certain provisions through 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Low-income families and children in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a phased approach to tax credits, including increased refundability and adjustments for part-year residents, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to reduce child poverty by increasing support for low-income families with children.

Title: Financial Regulation - Maryland Community Investment Venture Fund - Establishment (Access to Banking Act)
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Community Investment Venture Fund as an instrumentality of the State for purposes of developing opportunities for banking institutions and credit unions to better serve the needs of low- to moderate-income tracts; providing for certain assessment offset credits for certain banking institutions and credit unions in certain areas; authorizing the use of the Banking Institution and Credit Union Regulation Fund for certain purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Community Investment Venture Fund, a private venture fund aimed at developing financial products and innovations to improve access to capital and financial services in low- to moderate-income areas, and provides assessment credits for banking institutions and credit unions that expand or establish branches in these areas.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Banking institutions, credit unions, and residents of low- to moderate-income areas in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs innovative approaches by creating a state-backed private venture fund that invests in financial innovations and provides assessment credits to incentivize branch expansion in underserved areas.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to directly impact child poverty by improving access to financial services in underserved communities.

Title: Maryland Energy Administration – Energy Programs – Modifications (Clean Transportation and Energy Act)
Synopsis: Altering the Electric Vehicle Recharging Equipment Program by extending the duration of the Program through fiscal year 2026, repealing the rebates that may be issued to retail service station dealers, and increasing the limitation on the total amount of rebates that the Maryland Energy Administration may issue in each fiscal year; altering the Medium-Duty and Heavy-Duty Zero-Emission Vehicle Grant Program by altering the definition of "grant"; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland's energy programs by extending the Electric Vehicle Recharging Equipment Program, increasing rebate limits, and expanding benefits for electric vehicle infrastructure, especially in low-income and underserved communities. It also establishes a grant program for medium- and heavy-duty zero-emission vehicles and equipment, with funding and priorities aimed at environmental justice and public health.
responsible_party: Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Residents, businesses, and government entities in Maryland, especially those in low-income and underserved communities, and the environment.
innovative_summary: The bill employs targeted incentives and grants for electric vehicle infrastructure and zero-emission vehicles, with a focus on underserved communities, representing a strategic approach to promoting clean transportation and energy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by improving access to clean transportation and energy benefits in low-income communities.

Title: Office of Statewide Broadband - Study of Broadband Expansion Incentives
Synopsis: Requiring the Office of Statewide Broadband within the Department of Housing and Community Development to conduct a study as to how the State can incentivize broadband service providers to expand broadband infrastructure to communities that are unserved or underserved; and requiring the Office to submit its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by January 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a study by the Office of Statewide Broadband to explore incentives for expanding broadband infrastructure in Maryland, including regulatory and financial measures, and reports findings by January 1, 2024. It also provides tax incentives such as a subtraction modification for qualified broadband grants and exempts sales and use tax on network equipment used for internet service and broadband deployment.
responsible_party: Office of Statewide Broadband within the Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Broadband service providers, unserved or underserved communities in Maryland, federal and private broadband infrastructure grant recipients
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining a study on incentives with tax benefits for broadband infrastructure, integrating financial incentives and regulatory considerations to promote broadband expansion.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by expanding broadband access to underserved communities, which can improve educational and economic opportunities.

Title: Economic Development - Build Our Future Grant Pilot Program and Fund (Innovation Economy Infrastructure Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Establishing the Build Our Future Grant Pilot Program in the Department of Commerce to provide funding for certain costs for infrastructure projects in eligible technology sectors; requiring certain grantees to provide matching funds and to demonstrate certain abilities; and requiring the Department to report to the Governor and the General Assembly on the projects funded through and the economic impact of the Program by July 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Build Our Future Grant Pilot Program and Fund to provide grants for infrastructure projects supporting innovation in various technology sectors in Maryland, with specific matching fund requirements and oversight.
responsible_party: Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Private companies, nonprofits, local governments, colleges, and universities in Maryland involved in technology infrastructure projects
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach to funding innovation infrastructure in key technology sectors, with significant matching fund requirements and a focus on fostering economic development through infrastructure investments.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty indirectly by fostering economic growth and job creation in technology sectors.

Title: Income Tax - Subtraction Modification for Military Retirement Income (Keep Our Heroes Home Act)
Synopsis: Increasing the amount of a certain subtraction modification under the Maryland income tax for certain military retirement income received by individuals under the age of 55 years to $12,500 and individuals at least 55 years of age to $20,000 during the taxable year for certain military service; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022.
bill_summary: The bill increases the amount of military retirement income that is exempt from Maryland income tax, with the exemption amount rising over time.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Military retirees in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill employs a straightforward tax exemption increase for military retirees, which is a common policy approach and not particularly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Baltimore County - Circuit Court Judgeships
Synopsis: Increasing the number of resident judges of the Circuit Court for Baltimore County from 20 to 21.
bill_summary: The bill increases the number of resident judges in the Baltimore County Circuit Court from 20 to 21.
responsible_party: Maryland Judicial Branch or Baltimore County Circuit Court
stakeholders: Residents of Baltimore County, legal community, judiciary
innovative_summary: The bill does not employ new technologies or approaches; it mainly adjusts the number of judgeships.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Cannabis Reform
Synopsis: Renaming the Alcohol and Tobacco Commission to be the Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission; establishing the Maryland Cannabis Administration as an independent unit of State government; establishing a regulatory and licensing system for adult-use cannabis; imposing a sales and use tax of 9% on the sale of cannabis; requiring the Administration, by July 1, 2023, to convert medical cannabis licenses to licenses to operate a medical and adult-use cannabis business; etc.
bill_summary: This bill legalizes and regulates adult-use cannabis in Maryland, establishes the Maryland Cannabis Administration as an independent agency, creates licensing, testing, and social equity programs, and sets tax and fee structures for cannabis sales.
responsible_party: Maryland Cannabis Administration
stakeholders: Adults 21 and over, social equity applicants, cannabis businesses, communities disproportionately impacted by past cannabis enforcement, medical cannabis patients
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach including social equity programs, a new independent cannabis agency, and modern regulations on advertising, testing, and licensing, integrating technology and social justice.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has high potential to impact child poverty by promoting social equity, community reinvestment, and economic opportunities in impacted communities.

Title: Carroll County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Residency Requirement
Synopsis: Requiring at least one applicant for an alcoholic beverages license in Carroll County to be a resident of the State, rather than the county, when an application is filed and to remain a resident of the State for the license to remain valid; etc.
bill_summary: The bill changes the residency requirements for applying for an alcoholic beverages license in Carroll County, Maryland, requiring applicants to be residents of the State rather than just the county, and to remain residents for the license to stay valid.
responsible_party: Carroll County Alcoholic Beverages Licensing Board
stakeholders: Applicants for alcoholic beverages licenses in Carroll County, Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies legal residency requirements for license applicants, which is a rule change rather than an innovative program employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it mainly changes licensing residency rules.

Title: Carroll County - Alcoholic Beverages - Modification of Seating Requirements
Synopsis: Modifying the seating requirements for Class B, Class BR, and Class C beer, wine, and liquor licenses in Carroll County.
bill_summary: The bill modifies seating requirements for certain alcohol licenses in Carroll County, allowing for increased seating at bars or counters for specific types of licensed establishments such as hotels, restaurants, and clubs.
responsible_party: Carroll County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Hotels, restaurants, clubs, and patrons in Carroll County
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes seating regulations for existing licenses, with no new technology or innovative approach introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly adjusts licensing rules for alcohol establishments.

Title: Carroll County - Alcoholic Beverages - Multiple Event Entertainment Licenses
Synopsis: Establishing an annual fee of $2,000 for a multiple event entertainment alcoholic beverages license where the number of events number 41 or more per year in Carroll County; and repealing the limit on the total number of days for which a multiple event entertainment license may be used.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new licensing fees and rules for multiple event entertainment alcoholic beverage licenses in Carroll County, including removing the limit on the number of days such licenses can be used annually.
responsible_party: Carroll County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Fire departments and arts centers in Carroll County, event organizers, local residents
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a tiered fee structure based on the number of events and removes the previous limit on days of license use, streamlining licensing for multiple events.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly concerns licensing rules for alcohol events.

Title: Town of Mount Airy (Carroll County and Frederick County) - Urban Renewal Authority
Synopsis: Granting the Town of Mount Airy in Carroll County and Frederick County the authority to exercise urban renewal powers within an urban renewal area under Article III, Section 61 of the Maryland Constitution; and authorizing the municipality to levy certain taxes and issue general obligation bonds and revenue bonds to carry out urban renewal powers.
bill_summary: The bill grants the Town of Mount Airy in Maryland the authority to undertake urban renewal projects, including slum and blight clearance, through the establishment of an urban renewal authority. It authorizes the municipality to acquire, redevelop, and dispose of property within designated areas, and to issue bonds to finance these activities.
responsible_party: Town of Mount Airy
stakeholders: Residents and property owners in Mount Airy's urban renewal areas, including those affected by slum and blight conditions.
innovative_summary: The program employs traditional urban renewal strategies, including property acquisition, redevelopment, and bond issuance, which are established approaches rather than new technological innovations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve living conditions and stimulate economic development, which could reduce child poverty in the affected areas.

Title: Alcoholic Beverages - Class 9 Limited Distillery License - Self-Distribution
Synopsis: Authorizing a holder of a Class 9 limited distillery license to apply for and obtain a Class 8 liquor wholesaler's license with certain privileges.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes holders of Class 9 limited distillery licenses to sell and deliver their products in bulk both within and outside Maryland, and allows them to apply for and obtain a Class 8 liquor wholesaler's license to distribute their own liquor.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcoholic Beverages Commission
stakeholders: Limited distillery license holders, consumers, and the alcohol distribution industry in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new licensing pathway for small distilleries to self-distribute their products directly, including the ability to obtain a wholesaler license, which is a new approach for small-scale producers.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly affects alcohol production and distribution regulations.

Title: Opioids - Opioid Restitution Advisory Council and Fund and Overdose Response Program
Synopsis: Authorizing the Attorney General to direct that an Opioid Restitution Fund Advisory Council committee be formed if required by a court or administrative order or settlement agreement entered into by the Attorney General; requiring the Maryland Department of Health, subject to the limitations of the State budget, to allow certain entities to choose the formulation or dosage of an opioid overdose reversal drug approved by the Food and Drug Administration with which the entity is provided through the Overdose Response Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a program for the distribution of opioid overdose reversal drugs, allows entities to choose formulations or dosages, creates a committee structure related to opioid restitution, and sets rules for the use of funds from opioid settlement agreements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals at risk of opioid overdose, healthcare providers, public health agencies, and communities affected by opioid misuse
innovative_summary: The bill employs a coordinated approach involving a new committee structure, flexible drug formulation choices for providers, and a dedicated fund for opioid settlement revenues, integrating technology and policy for opioid overdose prevention.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by decreasing opioid-related health crises and supporting affected families, but direct impact is moderate.

Title: Maryland Higher Education Commission - Access to Mental Health Advisory Committee - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Access to Mental Health Advisory Committee within the Maryland Higher Education Commission to study the provision of and access to mental health services in institutions of higher education; and requiring the Commission to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly by December 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Access to Mental Health Advisory Committee within the Maryland Higher Education Commission to study and recommend improvements in mental health services for college students.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: College students and higher education institutions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill creates a dedicated advisory committee to evaluate and improve mental health access using best practices, including telemedicine and off-campus services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve mental health support for students, which can indirectly impact child poverty by supporting student stability and success.

Title: State Employee and Retiree Health Benefits - Creditable Service
Synopsis: Requiring the inclusion of all State service while an individual was employed by the State in the Executive, Legislative, or Judicial Branch of government for the purpose of determining eligibility for State retiree health benefits.
bill_summary: The bill requires that all State service while employed by the Historic St. Mary's City Commission in the Executive, Legislative, or Judicial Branch be included in determining eligibility for State retiree health benefits, regardless of the employment period or system. It also clarifies eligibility and subsidy calculations for retirees and their dependents based on years of service and retirement circumstances.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Retired State employees and their dependents, especially those with service in the Historic St. Mary's City Commission
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to include all relevant State service in retiree health benefits calculations, ensuring fairness and consistency across different employment periods and systems.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns retiree health benefits for State employees.

Title: Income Tax Credit - Food Donations by Qualified Farms - Sunset Repeal and Alterations (Farmers Feeding Families Act)
Synopsis: Repealing certain termination provisions for a tax credit against the State income tax for fresh farm and organic fresh farm food donations; altering the amounts of the tax credit from 50% to 100% of the value of an eligible food donation and from 75% to 100% of the value of the donated certified organic produce a qualified farm is eligible to receive under certain circumstances; applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the sunset clause on a Maryland income tax credit for food donations made by qualified farms, extending the program until 2026. It also adjusts the credit percentages and the maximum amount of credits available per farm, and modifies the program's funding and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Qualified farms, food donors, Maryland residents benefiting from food donations
innovative_summary: The program employs a tax credit system to incentivize food donations from farms, with adjustments to credit percentages and a focus on organic produce, and includes transportation support for donations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by increasing food donations to those in need, but its direct impact is moderate.

Title: State Procurement - Purchasing - Compost, Mulch, and Soil Amendments and Aggregate
Synopsis: Requiring each unit of State government to include certain specifications for certain products produced from recycled or organic materials when establishing procurement specifications for compost, mulch, or other soil amendments or aggregate; requiring the Maryland Green Purchasing Committee to establish certain specifications for purchasing of compost, mulch, or other soil amendments or aggregates produced from certain materials and publish and maintain the specifications online for use by State agencies.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland state agencies to prioritize the use of compost, mulch, and soil amendments made from recycled or organic materials in their procurement processes. It also mandates the Maryland Green Purchasing Committee to establish and publish specifications for these products.
responsible_party: Maryland Green Purchasing Committee and Department of General Services
stakeholders: State agencies, local governments, and contractors involved in land maintenance and landscaping in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill promotes environmentally sustainable procurement practices by establishing specific specifications and online resources for recycled and organic products, encouraging the use of waste-derived materials in public land maintenance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on environmental procurement policies.

Title: Baltimore City - 41st District - Alcoholic Beverages - Licenses
Synopsis: Authorizing, for a certain period of time, the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to exchange a Class B-D-7 beer, wine, and liquor license in a certain area for a Class A-7 beer, wine, and liquor license under certain circumstances; repealing certain geographic and temporal restrictions on the issuance of Class A-7 beer, wine, and liquor licenses in Baltimore City; and altering a certain period of time during which a certain alcoholic beverages license may be issued.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Baltimore City to exchange certain alcohol licenses, repeals geographic and temporal restrictions on issuing certain licenses, and establishes a new marketplace license allowing multiple establishments to sell alcohol. It also sets the duration for these provisions and the associated fees.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, businesses, and consumers in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a marketplace license allowing multiple establishments to sell alcohol from a shared premises, employing a new approach to alcohol licensing and sales.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by supporting local businesses and economic activity, but direct effects are limited.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Restitution Orders - Recording Fees
Synopsis: Altering a certain provision to prohibit a court from assessing certain costs on a certain person or governmental unit for recording and indexing an order of restitution issued by any court in the State instead of the court in which the judgment of restitution was entered.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits courts from assessing costs on individuals or governmental units for recording and indexing restitution orders issued by any court in Maryland, including costs for recording a money judgment, a notice of lien, or a notice of satisfaction.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and judicial system
stakeholders: Individuals ordered to pay restitution, governmental units involved in recording restitution orders, and the courts
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal restriction on recording fees related to restitution orders, streamlining the process and reducing costs for involved parties.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly addresses legal procedures and costs related to restitution orders.

Title: Health and Human Services Transportation Improvement Act of 2023
Synopsis: Repealing the $500,000 cap on grants that may be awarded by the Maryland Transit Administration under the Maryland Senior Rides Program; repealing the $400,000 cap on the Job Access and Reverse Commute Program; establishing the State Coordinating Committee for Health and Human Services Transportation to examine transportation needs of the elderly, persons with disabilities, and residents requiring transportation assistance to jobs, appointments, citizen programs, and other engagements; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Rural Nonemergency Medical Transportation Program to provide transportation for eligible individuals in rural counties to medical services, and creates a State Coordinating Committee for Health and Human Services Transportation to improve transportation services for vulnerable populations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Residents of rural counties who need transportation to medical services, hospitals, nonprofit organizations providing transportation, and state agencies involved in health and human services
innovative_summary: The program employs a coordinated approach involving hospitals, nonprofit organizations, and state agencies to improve transportation for health and human services, including a new statewide committee to oversee and plan transportation services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by improving access to healthcare and services for underserved populations in rural areas.

Title: State Police Retirement System, Law Enforcement Officers’ Pension System, and Judges’ Retirement System – Surviving Spouse Benefit – Same–Sex Spouses
Synopsis: Authorizing the correction of the designated beneficiary election for certain retirees of the State Police Retirement System, Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System, or Judges' Retirement System who retired on or before December 31, 2012, if the retiree named an individual of the same sex to be a designated beneficiary and the retiree married the designated beneficiary on or after January 1, 2013.
bill_summary: The bill allows certain retirees of Maryland's State Police, Law Enforcement Officers', and Judges' Retirement Systems who married their same-sex designated beneficiaries after retirement to update their beneficiary designations and receive survivor benefits accordingly. It also provides for retroactive adjustments and lump-sum payments to reflect these marriages if they occurred before July 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency and the Boards of Trustees for the respective retirement systems
stakeholders: Retirees of the State Police, Law Enforcement Officers', and Judges' Retirement Systems and their spouses or designated beneficiaries
innovative_summary: The bill employs a legal and administrative approach to recognize and retroactively adjust survivor benefits for same-sex marriages, including retroactive payments with interest, which is a relatively innovative administrative solution in the context of retirement benefits.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily addresses retirement survivor benefits for retirees and their spouses.

Title: Human Relations - Housing Discrimination - Service Dogs
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from discriminating in the sale or rental of, or otherwise making unavailable or denying, a dwelling to an individual with a disability who has, obtains, or retains a certain service dog.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits discrimination in housing against individuals with disabilities who have, obtain, or retain a service dog or guide dog. It requires new multifamily dwellings to be accessible and exempts individuals with service dogs from certain lease restrictions and fees.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities who use service dogs or guide dogs, housing providers, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal protections and accessibility requirements for individuals with service dogs in housing, rather than establishing new programs or services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on housing discrimination protections for individuals with disabilities.

Title: State Board of Nursing – Sunset Extension, Licensure Exceptions, and Board Operations and Membership
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Nursing in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2025, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board; altering the exceptions to the registered nurse and licensed practical nurse licensure requirements; providing that, for a certain period of time, the Secretary of Health, rather than the Board, has authority over the infrastructure operations of the Board; etc.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date of the Maryland State Board of Nursing to July 1, 2025, modifies its operational structure by transferring infrastructure responsibilities to the Secretary of Health, and mandates an independent evaluation of the Board to improve its efficiency and effectiveness. It also updates licensing exceptions and member appointment procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Nursing professionals, nursing students, healthcare facilities, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive independent evaluation and strategic planning process for the State Board of Nursing, including the creation of new organizational units and a review of fee structures, which employs a modern approach to government oversight and organizational improvement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on organizational and operational reforms of the nursing board.

Title: Department of Aging - Long-Term Care and Dementia Care Navigation Programs
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Aging to oversee long-term care and train the staff of long-term care and dementia care navigation programs; requiring each area agency to establish a long-term care and dementia care navigation program; and requiring the Department to submit a report by October 1, 2024, and each year thereafter, to the Governor, the President of the Senate, the Speaker of the House, and certain committees of the General Assembly about the services provided by the program and to publish the report on its website.
bill_summary: The bill establishes long-term care and dementia care navigation programs overseen by the Maryland Department of Aging, requiring each area agency to develop and implement these programs, and mandates annual reporting on their activities and outcomes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Aging
stakeholders: Older adults with dementia, caregivers, healthcare providers, and residents needing long-term care services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a coordinated approach integrating existing services with new or expanded dementia care navigation, including data collection, best practice dissemination, and community outreach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty indirectly by improving elder care and support systems, but it is primarily focused on adult and senior populations.

Title: Workgroup on Black, Latino, Asian American Pacific Islander, and Other Underrepresented Behavioral Health Professionals - Extension of Dates
Synopsis: Extending the reporting and termination dates, to July 1, 2024, and June 30, 2025, respectively, for the Workgroup on Black, Latino, Asian American Pacific Islander, and Other Underrepresented Behavioral Health Professionals.
bill_summary: The bill extends the duration of the Workgroup on Underrepresented Behavioral Health Professionals, which studies shortages and recommends ways to increase diversity among behavioral health providers in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and University System of Maryland
stakeholders: Black, Latino, Asian American Pacific Islander, and other underrepresented behavioral health professionals and communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill establishes a dedicated workgroup to address diversity and shortages in behavioral health, including potential incentives and support strategies, which is a targeted approach to workforce diversity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by increasing access to behavioral health services in underserved communities.

Title: Economic Development - Industry 4.0 Technology Grant Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Industry 4.0 Technology Grant Program in the Department of Commerce to provide grants to certain small and medium-sized manufacturing enterprises to assist those manufacturers with implementing new Industry 4.0 technology or related infrastructure for certain purposes; establishing the Industry 4.0 Technology Grant Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund; and requiring the Governor to include in the budget bill for fiscal years 2025 through 2028 an appropriation of $1,000,000 to the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Industry 4.0 Technology Grant Program in Maryland to provide grants to small and medium-sized manufacturing enterprises for implementing Industry 4.0 technologies, such as smart hardware, software, robotics, AI, and related infrastructure, to increase productivity and competitiveness.
responsible_party: Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Small and medium-sized manufacturing enterprises in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a competitive grant process to fund the adoption of advanced Industry 4.0 technologies, encouraging modernization and technological innovation in manufacturing.
