Synopsis: Revising the minority business enterprise utilization program within the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission, including altering the definition of "minority business enterprise", altering the duties of the Office of Supplier Diversity and Inclusion, and merging the program for design/build and construction contracts with the program for the procurement of goods and services; extending until July 1, 2028, provisions relating to procurement from minority business enterprises by the Commission; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises and extends the minority business enterprise utilization programs within the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission, including defining requirements for certification, participation, and reporting, and establishes a new race-neutral program to remedy discrimination.
responsible_party: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission
stakeholders: Minority and women-owned businesses, local small businesses, and contractors working with the Commission
innovative_summary: The bill employs a combination of race-conscious and race-neutral strategies, including certification standards, reporting requirements, and a sheltered market program, to address discrimination and promote minority business participation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by promoting economic opportunities for minority and women-owned businesses.

Title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class B and Class C Beer, Wine, and Liquor Licenses, Inspections, Penalties, and Workgroup PG 302-23
Synopsis: Authorizing the holder of a Class B beer, wine, and liquor license, a Class C (fraternal/sororal/service organization) beer, wine, and liquor license, or a Class C (veterans' organization or club) beer, wine and liquor license in Prince George's County to serve beer, wine, and liquor by the glass or by the bottle for on-premises consumption; establishing the Workgroup to Study Best Practices for Safe Event Promotion and the Leveraging of Alcoholic Beverages Licenses in Prince George's County; requiring a certain report by December 1, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain alcohol licenses in Prince George's County to serve alcohol for on-premises consumption, establishes regulations for entertainment permits, inspections, and penalties, and creates a workgroup to study safe event promotion and leveraging alcohol licenses for revenue.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Board of License Commissioners and related county agencies
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, event organizers, residents of Prince George's County, county officials
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative approach by establishing a workgroup to study best practices for safe event promotion and revenue generation, integrating regulatory oversight with strategic planning.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on regulation and safety of events and alcohol licensing.

Title: Health Insurance - Step Therapy or Fail-First Protocol and Prior Authorization - Revisions
Synopsis: Requiring certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to establish a certain process for requesting an exception to a step therapy or fail-first protocol; prohibiting certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations from requiring more than a certain number of prior authorizations for a prescription for different dosages of the same prescription drug; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises regulations on step therapy protocols and prior authorization processes for health insurance plans in Maryland, including establishing exception procedures and limiting the number of prior authorizations required.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Insured individuals, healthcare providers, and insurance companies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces structured exception processes and limits on prior authorizations, improving transparency and efficiency in prescription drug coverage.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on insurance regulation.

Title: Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System - Membership - Emergency Medical Technicians
Synopsis: Authorizing membership in the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System for certain emergency medical technicians under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes emergency medical technicians employed by participating governmental units to become members of the Maryland Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System under certain conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency and the Board of Trustees of the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System
stakeholders: Emergency Medical Technicians, participating governmental units, and law enforcement and emergency services personnel in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill extends pension system membership to emergency medical technicians, integrating emergency medical services personnel into law enforcement pension benefits, which is a new approach to pension inclusion.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily affects emergency medical technicians' pension benefits.

Title: Law Enforcement Officers’ Pension System – Frostburg City Police Department
Synopsis: Requiring membership in the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System for local law enforcement officers of the Frostburg City Police Department under certain circumstances; providing that an individual is entitled to eligibility service and creditable service that was earned before the effective date of the Frostburg City Police Department's participation in the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that Frostburg City Police Department officers become members of the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System when the department joins, allowing for the transfer of their prior service credits and assets, and clarifies the transfer process and eligibility.
responsible_party: Maryland State Personnel and Pensions Department
stakeholders: Frostburg City Police Department officers and local government
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured process for transferring pension credits and assets when a police department joins a new pension system, ensuring continuity of service credits and clear legal procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on pension system administration for law enforcement personnel.

Title: Baltimore Regional Transit Commission - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Baltimore Regional Transit Commission to review and comment on annual budget requests of the Maryland Transit Administration, updates to the Central Maryland Transportation Plan, and certain annual reports and to perform other oversight and advocacy duties related to Baltimore region transit services; and requiring the Commission, by December 1 each year, to report its findings and recommendations on the Baltimore region transit systems to the Administration, the Governor, and the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Baltimore Regional Transit Commission to oversee, review, and comment on transit planning, budgeting, and performance in the Baltimore region, including coordination with local transit agencies.
responsible_party: Baltimore Metropolitan Council and Maryland Transit Administration
stakeholders: Transit riders, residents, businesses, and local governments in the Baltimore region
innovative_summary: The program creates a new regional transit oversight body with structured review, advocacy, and public engagement functions, employing a formal commission structure and regular reporting.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve transit services, which can increase access to employment and services for low-income families, thereby potentially reducing child poverty.

Title: Maryland-National Capital Park and Planning Commission - Collective Bargaining Agreement Implementation - Dispute Arbitration MC/PG 103-23
Synopsis: Altering the requirement that economic provisions of a certain final collective bargaining agreement for employees of the Maryland-National Capital Park and Planning Commission be subject to funding by the Montgomery County Council and the Prince George's County Council to instead require that certain terms and conditions of the final agreement be subject to approval by the Montgomery County Council and the Prince George's County Council; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the collective bargaining process for employees of the Maryland–National Capital Park and Planning Commission, including establishing procedures for mediation and arbitration, and clarifies that certain economic provisions of final agreements require approval from county councils and funding in the budget.
responsible_party: Maryland–National Capital Park and Planning Commission
stakeholders: Employees of the Maryland–National Capital Park and Planning Commission and the county councils of Montgomery and Prince George’s counties
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured mediation and arbitration process for collective bargaining disputes, including the use of mediator–arbitrators and specific criteria for decision-making.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily addresses collective bargaining procedures for a specific public agency.

Title: Execution on a Judgment - Child Support Arrearages - Workers' Compensation
Synopsis: Specifying that 25% of the net recovery by the debtor on a claim for workers' compensation is subject to execution on a judgment for a child support arrearage.
bill_summary: The bill specifies that 25% of a debtor's net recovery from workers' compensation insurance benefits can be used to satisfy child support arrearages through legal execution.
responsible_party: Maryland Courts and Judicial Proceedings Department
stakeholders: Debtors with workers' compensation claims and child support enforcement agencies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific percentage of workers' compensation benefits that can be garnished for child support arrearages, which is a targeted legal adjustment.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving child support collection.

Title: Institutions of Higher Education – Sports Wagering Contracts – Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting institutions of higher education from entering into a contract with a certain regulated gaming entity or a certain agent of a regulated gaming entity if the institution of higher education receives certain compensation for student participation in certain sports wagering; prohibiting institutions of higher education from entering into a contract with a sports marketing entity if the entity or the institution receives certain compensation for student participation in certain sports wagering; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits Maryland higher education institutions from entering into contracts with regulated gaming entities or sports marketing entities if they receive incentives based on student participation in sports wagering, and mandates that such contracts be publicly accessible.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission and Maryland State Government
stakeholders: Students at higher education institutions, higher education institutions, gaming and sports marketing companies
innovative_summary: The bill employs transparency measures and restrictions on incentives related to sports wagering contracts involving educational institutions, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on regulatory restrictions and transparency.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Administrative Fees
Synopsis: Altering the method by which administrative fees for participants in the State Retirement and Pension System are calculated by and remitted to the State Retirement and Pension System; and requiring the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System to provide certain notice to local participating employers.
bill_summary: The bill modifies how administrative fees for participants in the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System are calculated and reimbursed, including requiring the Board of Trustees to provide estimates to local employers and the Department of Budget and Management.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System Board of Trustees
stakeholders: Participants in the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, local employers, and the State of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured process for estimating and reimbursing administrative fees, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Amortization of Unfunded Liabilities and Surpluses
Synopsis: Altering the amortization periods to be used for certain unfunded liabilities or surpluses of the State Retirement and Pension System.
bill_summary: The bill changes the amortization periods for unfunded liabilities and surpluses of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, extending the timeline for paying off liabilities and adjusting contribution rates.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System Board of Trustees
stakeholders: State employees and retirees, taxpayers, and the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
innovative_summary: The bill employs a standard approach to pension funding by adjusting amortization periods, with some flexibility for tail volatility mitigation, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns pension funding policies for state employees.

Title: Vehicle Laws – Autonomous Vehicle Converters – Sale of Autonomous Vehicles
Synopsis: Authorizing an autonomous vehicle converter to sell, transfer, lease, offer for sale, or resell a converted autonomous vehicle or a motor vehicle purchased with the intent to convert the motor vehicle into a converted autonomous vehicle; establishing that certain portions of the Act apply only to motor vehicles intended for commercial or industrial use; and prohibiting an autonomous vehicle converter from holding certain occupational vehicle licenses issued under the Maryland Vehicle Law.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes autonomous vehicle converters to sell, transfer, lease, or resell converted autonomous vehicles, specifically for vehicles intended for commercial or industrial use, and clarifies that they cannot hold certain licenses as manufacturers or dealers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Autonomous vehicle converters, commercial and industrial vehicle operators, regulatory agencies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new category of vehicle converter and clarifies regulations around the sale and transfer of converted autonomous vehicles, employing new legal definitions and frameworks.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on vehicle regulation and licensing.

Title: Reproductive Health Protection Act
Synopsis: Prohibiting a judge from requiring a person to give certain testimony or a statement or to produce evidence for a case involving an alleged violation of the criminal law of another state relating to health care that is legally protected in the State; prohibiting a judge from issuing an ex parte order to intercept certain communication for the purpose of investigating or recovering evidence related to legally protected health care, subject to a certain exception; etc.
bill_summary: The bill, known as the Reproductive Health Protection Act, establishes protections for legally protected health care, including reproductive health services, from interstate legal actions and investigations that would not be considered crimes or liabilities within Maryland. It restricts cooperation with out-of-state investigations related to such health care, prohibits certain legal processes, and ensures health care providers and insurers are protected when providing or supporting legally protected health care.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, including courts, health departments, and insurance regulators
stakeholders: Individuals seeking or providing legally protected health care, including reproductive health services, in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive legal framework to protect Maryland residents and providers from out-of-state legal actions related to legally protected health care, including restrictions on interstate cooperation and legal processes, which is a novel approach to safeguarding reproductive rights.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on legal protections for health care services.

Title: State Procurement – Minority Business Enterprise Program – Extension and Reports
Synopsis: Altering to July 1, 2025, the termination date for certain provisions of law governing the Minority Business Enterprise Program and its application to offshore wind projects and video lottery terminals; and altering the date by which certain reports, studies, and guidelines must be submitted.
bill_summary: The bill extends the termination dates of various laws and programs related to the Maryland Minority Business Enterprise Program, including reports, studies, and guidelines, from 2023 to 2025, and updates deadlines for analysis and reporting.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs and the Certification Agency
stakeholders: Minority business enterprises, offshore wind project developers, state agencies involved in procurement and utilities, and minority and women-owned businesses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal and reporting deadlines; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on minority business programs and procurement policies.

Title: Hospitals - Testing for Fentanyl (The Josh Siems Act)
Synopsis: Requiring a hospital to include testing for fentanyl as part of a urine drug screening; and requiring the hospital, if a urine drug screening detects fentanyl, to report the deidentified test results  to the Maryland Department of Health through the State-designated health information exchange.
bill_summary: The bill requires hospitals in Maryland to include fentanyl testing in urine drug screens for patients with known or suspected drug overdoses if requested by a healthcare provider. If fentanyl is detected, the hospital must report de-identified results to the Department of Health. The law takes effect on October 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Hospital patients with suspected or known drug overdoses, healthcare providers, public health agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs rapid urine drug testing and mandatory reporting to enhance overdose detection and response, integrating technology and data sharing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could indirectly impact child poverty by improving overdose response and public health outcomes, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Health - Reproductive Health Services - Protected Information and Insurance Requirements
Synopsis: Regulating the disclosure of certain information related to legally protected health care by custodians of public records, health information exchanges, and electronic health networks; requiring that the regulations adopted by the Maryland Health Care Commission regarding clinical information to be exchanged through the State-designated exchange restrict data of patients who have obtained legally protected health care; establishing the Protected Health Care Commission; etc.
bill_summary: The bill regulates the disclosure of legally protected reproductive health information, establishes standards for health information exchanges, and clarifies insurance requirements related to abortion and reproductive health services in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Patients seeking reproductive health services, health care providers, health information exchanges, insurance companies, and government agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs new regulations and standards for health information exchange technology and data privacy, especially concerning sensitive reproductive health information.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve health privacy and access for reproductive health services, which can indirectly benefit children and families.

Title: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange - State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Extending the termination date of certain provisions of law that establish and govern the funding for the State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program; and requiring the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange, in consultation with the Maryland Insurance Administration, to conduct a study on available federal and State subsidies and report its findings and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill extends the duration of the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange's Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program, establishes a study on federal and state subsidies, and requires reporting on findings and recommendations.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange
stakeholders: Young adults aged 18 to 40 with income between 133% and 400% of the federal poverty level in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted subsidies and a comprehensive study to optimize health insurance coverage for young adults, including tracking and reporting mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing health coverage among young adults, which can have long-term economic benefits.

Title: Cancer Screening - Health Insurance and Assessment of Outreach, Education, and Health Disparities
Synopsis: Requiring insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to provide coverage for certain lung cancer diagnostic imaging and limiting the copayment, coinsurance, or deductible that the entities can require for lung cancer screening and diagnosis; and requiring the Maryland Department of Health to conduct an assessment on certain outreach, education, and health disparities in cancer screening and report the results to the General Assembly by January 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Breast and Lung Cancer Screening Awareness Program in the Maryland Department of Health, mandates insurance coverage for certain cancer screenings and diagnostic imaging, and requires the Department to assess outreach, education, and disparities related to cancer screening in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals in Maryland, especially underserved communities, and those at risk for breast and lung cancer
innovative_summary: The program combines public education, outreach, and insurance mandates with a stakeholder-driven assessment of disparities, employing a comprehensive approach to improve cancer screening and reduce health disparities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty indirectly by improving health outcomes and access to preventive care for underserved populations.

Title: Procurement - Minority Business Enterprises and Veteran-Owned Small Business Enterprises - Participation Goal Scorecard
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor's Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs to develop a scorecard to evaluate units of State government on the units' performance toward meeting certain participation goals under the Minority Business Enterprise Program and the Veteran-Owned Small Business Enterprise Program; establishing a certain grading scale for the scorecard; and requiring grades achieved by each unit to be published each year on the Office's website.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs to develop a scorecard to evaluate state government units on their performance in meeting participation goals for Minority Business Enterprises and Veteran–Owned Small Business Enterprises. The scorecard assigns grades based on achievement levels and mandates the publication of these grades annually on the Office's website and in reports to the General Assembly.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs
stakeholders: Minority Business Enterprises, Veteran–Owned Small Business Enterprises, State government units, general public
innovative_summary: The program introduces a new evaluation and grading system for state agencies' performance in minority and veteran business participation, with public reporting to incentivize improvement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on increasing minority and veteran business participation may indirectly support economic opportunities for disadvantaged communities, potentially reducing child poverty.

Title: State Government - Regulation Procedures and the Maryland Register
Synopsis: Requiring the Division of State Documents to make at least the 15 most recent issues of the Maryland Register available to the public for online searching; altering the requirements for a unit of State government to submit certain proposed or emergency regulations, work plans, and evaluation reports to the Joint Committee on Administrative, Executive, and Legislative Review, the Department of Legislative Services, and the Administrator of the Division of State Documents; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates the procedures for submitting, reviewing, and publishing regulations in Maryland. It requires the development of an electronic filing system for regulations and extends review periods, aiming to improve transparency and efficiency in regulatory processes.
responsible_party: Department of Information Technology and Division of State Documents
stakeholders: State government units, the Maryland General Assembly, and the public interested in regulations
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new electronic filing system for regulations, which employs digital technology to streamline submission, review, and publication processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on regulatory procedures.

Title: Public Safety - Regulated Firearms - Possession and Permits to Carry, Wear, and Transport a Handgun
Synopsis: Altering the penalty for a violation of the prohibition on wearing, carrying, or transporting a handgun; requiring the State Commission on Criminal Sentencing Policy to annually report certain information to the Governor and General Assembly; requiring the Department of State Police to transmit a certain summary of certain laws relating to firearms to certain persons; requiring the Secretary of State Police, in consultation with the Attorney General and the Maryland Department of Health, to develop a certain curriculum; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's firearm laws by increasing penalties for certain violations, establishing reporting requirements, developing a youth firearm safety and suicide prevention guide, and regulating permits to carry, wear, and transport handguns.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of State Police and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Firearm owners, minors, law enforcement, youth and families at risk of firearm-related harm
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach including education, safety guides, and enhanced permit regulations, but does not introduce new technologies or radically new government approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but aims to improve youth safety and reduce firearm-related injuries among minors.

Title: Town of Forest Heights (Prince George's County) - Urban Renewal Authority for Blight Clearance PG 410-23
Synopsis: Granting the Town of Forest Heights in Prince George's County the authority to exercise urban renewal powers in areas zoned for commercial use for blight clearance and redevelopment under Article III, Section 61 of the Maryland Constitution; and authorizing the municipality to levy certain taxes and issue general obligation bonds and revenue bonds to carry out urban renewal powers.
bill_summary: The bill grants the Town of Forest Heights in Prince George's County the authority to exercise urban renewal powers for blight clearance and redevelopment in areas zoned for commercial or residential use. It authorizes the municipality to levy taxes, issue bonds, and undertake activities to eliminate blight and promote redevelopment.
responsible_party: Town of Forest Heights
stakeholders: Residents, property owners, and businesses in Forest Heights, Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The program employs traditional urban renewal strategies, including bonds and land redevelopment, which are common approaches in municipal revitalization efforts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on blight clearance and redevelopment has the potential to improve living conditions and economic opportunities, which can help reduce child poverty.

Title: Prince George's Gateway Development Authority - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Prince George's Gateway Development Authority in Prince George's County to support and develop a certain neighborhood revitalization plan in coordination with certain residents; and requiring the Authority to report its comprehensive neighborhood revitalization strategy to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly on or before October 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Prince George's Gateway Arts Development Authority in Prince George's County to support neighborhood revitalization in specific target areas, including Mount Rainier, Brentwood, Cottage City, Bladensburg, Colmar Manor, and North Brentwood.
responsible_party: Prince George's Gateway Arts Development Authority
stakeholders: Residents, local businesses, and communities within the target areas in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The program employs a community-led approach to neighborhood revitalization, coordinating efforts across multiple municipalities and involving residents directly in planning.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving neighborhood conditions, housing, and economic opportunities in targeted areas.

Title: Residential Construction - Electric Vehicle Charging
Synopsis: Establishing and altering certain requirements related to the installation of equipment for the charging of electric vehicles during the construction of certain housing units; clarifying that a county or municipal corporation may require a greater number of electric vehicle parking spaces; requiring the Maryland Energy Administration to study certain issues related to the installation of electric vehicle parking spaces at multifamily residential buildings and submit a report to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2023; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires new residential construction and significant renovations to include electric vehicle charging infrastructure, such as EV-ready or EVSE-installed parking spaces, and establishes requirements for parking spaces in multifamily buildings. It also authorizes a study on the costs and implementation of these requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Residents, builders, and property owners of new and renovated residential buildings in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a proactive approach to integrate electric vehicle charging infrastructure into residential development, including a study to evaluate costs and future needs, representing a forward-thinking approach to sustainable transportation infrastructure.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but promotes sustainable development and future infrastructure improvements that could benefit communities.

Title: Electric Vehicle Charging Infrastructure - Requirements (Electric Vehicle Charging Reliability Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the Public Service Commission to expand the EV Pilot Program to allow participating electric companies to install EV charging stations in multifamily dwellings in underserved communities; requiring the Commission to terminate the expansion of the EV Pilot Program on December 31, 2025; requiring an electric company operating an EV charging network to ensure the EV charging stations in the EV charging network maintain certain uptime standards, subject to certain exceptions; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands Maryland's Electric Vehicle (EV) Pilot Program to include the installation of EV charging stations in multifamily dwellings in underserved communities, establishes minimum uptime standards for EV charging stations, and requires reporting and staffing requirements for electric companies operating EV charging networks. It also sets a termination date for the program expansion and details enforcement and corrective measures.
responsible_party: Public Service Commission of Maryland
stakeholders: Electric vehicle owners, residents of underserved communities, electric utility companies, and the general public interested in EV infrastructure
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to ensure reliable EV charging infrastructure, including uptime standards, detailed reporting, and targeted expansion into underserved communities, integrating regulatory oversight with infrastructure development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve access to EV charging in underserved communities, which may support economic mobility and reduce transportation costs for low-income residents.

Title: Baltimore Regional Water Governance Task Force
Synopsis: Establishing the Baltimore Regional Water Governance Task Force to study approaches to water and wastewater governance in the Baltimore region; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the Mayor of Baltimore City, the County Executive of Baltimore County, the Governor, and the General Assembly on or before January 30, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Baltimore Regional Water Governance Task Force to study and recommend improvements to water and wastewater governance in the Baltimore region, including exploring alternative governance models and assessing their fiscal implications.
responsible_party: Baltimore City and Baltimore County (jointly)
stakeholders: Residents and ratepayers in Baltimore City, Baltimore County, and surrounding jurisdictions served by the water and wastewater systems
innovative_summary: The bill proposes creating a regional task force to evaluate and recommend new governance structures for water and wastewater services, potentially employing innovative models for management and financing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve water service management and affordability, which can indirectly impact child poverty by ensuring reliable and affordable water access.

Title: Housing and Community Development - Common Ownership Community Website
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Housing and Community Development to establish and maintain a website that provides certain information on the rights and responsibilities of individuals living in a common ownership community.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development to create and maintain a website that provides information about the rights and responsibilities of residents in common ownership communities, including links to local programs and recent legislation.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residents of common ownership communities such as condominiums, cooperatives, and homeowners associations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a digital platform to centralize information and legislative updates for residents of common ownership communities, enhancing transparency and access to information.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it focuses on informational resources for residents.

Title: Drinking Water - Indirect Potable Reuse Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Indirect Potable Reuse Pilot Program in the Department of the Environment for the purpose of authorizing the regulated use of reclaimed water as a source for drinking water treatment facilities; providing for the issuance of potable reuse permits under the Pilot Program; applying certain public participation requirements to potable reuse permits; requiring the Department to submit a report on the status of the Pilot Program to the Governor and General Assembly on or before December 31, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Indirect Potable Reuse Pilot Program in Maryland, allowing the regulated use of reclaimed water as a source for certain drinking water facilities through a permitting process, with specific safety and testing requirements.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Public water systems, residents served by these systems, water treatment facilities
innovative_summary: The program employs advanced water treatment technologies such as reverse osmosis and UV disinfection, and introduces a pilot approach to regulated reuse of reclaimed water for drinking purposes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve water security and quality, which can indirectly benefit children, but its direct impact on child poverty is limited.

Title: Public Health - Chief Medical Examiner - Corrections to Autopsy Findings and Conclusions
Synopsis: Altering, from 60 days to 180 days, the time period after a medical examiner files findings and conclusions resulting from an autopsy during which a person in interest may request the medical examiner to correct findings and conclusions on the cause and manner of death recorded on a certificate of death.
bill_summary: The bill extends the time period during which a person in interest can request corrections to autopsy findings from 60 days to 180 days after the medical examiner files the findings.
responsible_party: Office of the Chief Medical Examiner, Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Families and individuals involved in autopsy cases and death investigations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes procedural rules for requesting corrections to autopsy findings; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Division of Rehabilitation Services and Developmental Disabilities Administration - Memorandum of Understanding
Synopsis: Requiring the Division of Rehabilitation Services in the State Department of Education and the Developmental Disabilities Administration in the Maryland Department of Health to enter into a memorandum of understanding, the terms of which shall include a data sharing agreement for the medical and psychological records of mutual clients in order to expedite decisions regarding eligibility for services.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Education's Division of Rehabilitation Services and the Maryland Department of Health's Developmental Disabilities Administration to enter into a memorandum of understanding that includes a data sharing agreement for medical and psychological records of mutual clients to expedite eligibility decisions for services.
responsible_party: Division of Rehabilitation Services and Developmental Disabilities Administration
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities and developmental disabilities seeking services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a data sharing agreement between two government agencies to improve service eligibility decisions, which is a relatively innovative approach to inter-agency collaboration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve access to services for individuals with disabilities, which can indirectly impact child poverty by supporting children with disabilities and their families.

Title: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission - Service Near Regional Transit Districts and Neighborhood Centers in Prince George's County - Contracts MC/PG 111-23
Synopsis: Authorizing the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission to enter into contracts with the District of Columbia or the District of Columbia Water and Sewer Authority for the construction, maintenance, and operation of a water supply, sewer, or drainage system for certain property located within a certain distance of a certain mass transit rail station and a regional transit district or neighborhood center in Prince George's County; and requiring that a contract entered into under the Act include and address certain items.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission to enter into contracts with entities in the District of Columbia for water, sewer, and drainage services for properties near transit stations and in Prince George's County, and establishes rules for these contracts.
responsible_party: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission
stakeholders: Property owners near transit stations in Prince George's County, District of Columbia Water and Sewer Authority, and related government agencies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach for inter-jurisdictional water and sewer service agreements, especially for properties near transit stations, utilizing contracts and rate-setting procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on infrastructure and contractual arrangements.

Title: Office of the Attorney General - Environmental and Natural Resources Crimes Unit - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Environmental and Natural Resources Crimes Unit of the Office of the Attorney General to investigate and prosecute cases against persons that violate State criminal environmental and natural resources laws; and requiring the Attorney General, by November 30 each year, to report to the Governor and the General Assembly on all the activities of the Unit and any actions taken by the Department of the Environment or the Department of Natural Resources in response to the findings and recommendations of the Unit.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Environmental and Natural Resources Crimes Unit within the Office of the Attorney General to investigate and prosecute violations of environmental and natural resources laws in Maryland, and to assist other departments in civil and criminal enforcement.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: Environmental agencies, law enforcement, natural resources departments, and the public concerned with environmental protection
innovative_summary: The bill creates a specialized unit within the Attorney General's office dedicated to environmental and natural resources law enforcement, employing full investigative and prosecutorial powers, and collaborating across state and federal agencies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's direct impact on child poverty is likely minimal, as it focuses on environmental law enforcement and natural resources protection.

Title: Baltimore City - Insurance - Certificates of Guarantee for County Bond Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing Baltimore City to honor certificates of guarantee that are issued by certain associations or on behalf of certain contractors in order to satisfy certain county bond requirements; and providing that Baltimore City is not required under certain provisions of law to honor certain certificates of guarantee.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Baltimore City and certain counties to honor certificates of guarantee issued by approved associations or contractors to meet county bond requirements, but they are not required to do so.
responsible_party: Baltimore City and specified Maryland counties
stakeholders: Contractors, associations issuing certificates of guarantee, county governments, and public improvement projects in Baltimore City and certain counties
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal recognition process for certificates of guarantee to facilitate county bond requirements, which is a new approach to managing public improvement financing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly pertains to bond requirements and certificates of guarantee.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Related Event Promoter's Permit
Synopsis: Clarifying that the defined term "related event" as it applies to a related event promoter's permit in Baltimore City includes events for which tickets are sold in advance or at the door or cover charges are imposed; reducing the number of days within which a person must apply for a permit, the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City must take certain actions relating to the permit, and alterations may be made to the permit; and altering the standards for determining the permit fee.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the definition of 'related event' for Baltimore City, establishes a related event promoter's permit process, sets application and permit fees, and outlines violations and penalties related to alcohol promotion events around the CIAA Basketball Tournament.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Event organizers, alcohol license holders, Baltimore City residents, attendees of related events, and local businesses
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized permit process for related events, including specific application procedures, fees, and regulations, to better manage alcohol-related events around a major sports tournament.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on event regulation and licensing.

Title: Baltimore City - 40th District - Alcoholic Beverages
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to issue a Class C beer, wine, and liquor license in a certain area of the 40th alcoholic beverages district in Baltimore City to the holder of a Class C beer and light wine license under certain circumstances; prohibiting certain license holders in certain areas of the 40th alcoholic beverages district from selling alcoholic beverages at certain times of day; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners to issue new alcohol licenses in the 40th district under specific conditions, modifies restrictions on license issuance near places of worship and schools, and sets specific hours for alcohol sales in certain areas.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, residents, and businesses in Baltimore City's 40th district
innovative_summary: The bill employs targeted licensing and zoning adjustments to regulate alcohol sales, including specific hours and location-based restrictions, which is a tailored approach to alcohol regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on licensing and zoning regulations.

Title: St. Mary’s County – Metropolitan Commission – New Facilities
Synopsis: Requiring the St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission to obtain the approval from the Commissioners of St. Mary's County before submitting a loan application where the Commission seeks to incur debt upon the full faith and credit of the county; requiring the Commission to cause studies, plans, and estimates to be made for new facilities in certain portions of the county; requiring any excess revenue made by the Commission in the sale or transfer of certain debt to be exempt from taxation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes procedures and requirements for the development, approval, and funding of new water and sewerage facilities in St. Mary's County, including public notices, hearings, and approval processes for loan applications and infrastructure projects.
responsible_party: St. Mary’s County Metropolitan Commission and the St. Mary’s County Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents and landowners in St. Mary's County, especially those affected by water and sewerage infrastructure projects
innovative_summary: The bill employs standard government procedures for public notice, hearings, and approval processes; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but may indirectly benefit residents through improved water and sewer services.

Title: Homeowners' Property Tax Credit - Qualified Homeowner - Application and Certification Requirements
Synopsis: Altering the application requirements for the homeowners' tax credit to allow homeowners with certain types of income to file an application every 3 years, subject to a certain certification requirement; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the application process for the Maryland homeowners' property tax credit, allowing certain homeowners with limited income sources to apply less frequently and to certify income status instead of submitting full documentation every year.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Homeowners with limited income, particularly those relying on Social Security, pensions, or annuities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a certification process for income verification, reducing the documentation burden for eligible homeowners and streamlining the application process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by making property tax relief more accessible to low-income families, especially seniors and those on fixed incomes.

Title: Labor and Employment - Workers' Compensation - Hernia
Synopsis: Establishing that a hernia caused as a result of repetitive trauma may be considered an occupational disease and be compensable subject to certain provisions of the workers' compensation law.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland's workers' compensation law to specify reporting requirements for hernia diagnoses and clarifies that hernias caused by repetitive trauma can be considered occupational diseases and be eligible for compensation.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor or Workers' Compensation Commission
stakeholders: Employees who suffer hernias, employers, and insurers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill clarifies legal definitions and reporting requirements for hernia claims, including those caused by repetitive trauma, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it primarily clarifies workers' compensation procedures for hernia claims.

Title: Garrett County Alcoholic Beverages Act of 2023
Synopsis: Altering a certain condition under which the Board of License Commissioners of Garrett County may issue a certain alcoholic beverages license to a hotel or motel; authorizing a gift basket permit holder to purchase certain alcoholic beverages from a wholesaler; authorizing a holder of a Class C multiple day beer license, beer and wine license, or beer, wine, and liquor license to hold another license that is issued by the Board; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies alcohol licensing rules in Garrett County, including licensing conditions for hotels and motels, permits for gift baskets, licensing for clubs, and Sunday alcohol sales regulations. It also establishes license expiration and extension procedures.
responsible_party: Garrett County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, hotels, motels, clubs, gift basket businesses, and the general public in Garrett County
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates licensing rules and procedures, with some adjustments to sale hours and license expiration, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may indirectly impact local economic activity through licensing changes.

Title: Electricity - Community Solar Energy Generating Systems Program and Property Taxes
Synopsis: Making permanent the Community Solar Energy Generating Systems Pilot Program; requiring a community solar energy generating system to serve at least 40% of its kilowatt-hour output to low-income and moderate-income subscribers under certain circumstances; authorizing a subscription coordinator to act on behalf of a subscriber organization; altering requirements related to the siting and size of certain community solar energy generating systems projects; authorizing the use of consolidated billing for certain charges; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes permanent the Community Solar Energy Generating Systems Pilot Program in Maryland, expands access for low- and moderate-income subscribers, establishes regulations for program operation including consolidated billing, and modifies property tax exemptions for community solar systems.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Low-income and moderate-income residents, community solar developers, electric utilities, and the general public
innovative_summary: The program employs new approaches such as consolidated billing, income verification methods, and targeted participation for underserved communities, integrating these with existing utility and environmental regulations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to affordable renewable energy for low- and moderate-income families.

Title: State Commission of Real Estate Appraisers, Appraisal Management Companies, and Home Inspectors - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Commission of Real Estate Appraisers, Appraisal Management Companies, and Home Inspectors in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2026, the termination provisions relating to certain statutory and regulatory authority of the Commission; and requiring an independent evaluation of the Commission to be conducted in consultation with the Office of Program Evaluation and Government Accountability in the Department of Legislative Services.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date of the State Commission of Real Estate Appraisers, Appraisal Management Companies, and Home Inspectors to July 1, 2026, and requires an independent evaluation of the Commission's adherence to diversity, equity, and inclusion standards, to be completed by January 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Real estate appraisers, appraisal management companies, home inspectors, and related industry stakeholders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs an independent evaluation process to assess the Commission's compliance with diversity, equity, and inclusion standards, which is a proactive approach to regulatory oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on regulatory oversight of real estate professionals.

Title: Energy Storage - Targets and Maryland Energy Storage Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Requiring the Public Service Commission to establish certain targets for the deployment of new energy storage devices in the State; requiring the Commission to establish and implement the Maryland Energy Storage Program to meet certain energy storage goals and develop a certain energy storage system in the State; and requiring the Commission to submit a certain report to the General Assembly by December 31, 2023, regarding the implementation of the Maryland Energy Storage Program and any needed statutory changes.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Public Service Commission to establish targets for deploying energy storage devices in the state, develop a Maryland Energy Storage Program to meet these targets, and report on program design by December 31, 2023. The program aims to deploy up to 3,000 MW of energy storage capacity by 2033.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Electric utilities, energy storage providers, Maryland residents, and the environment
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to develop a large-scale energy storage market through targets, competitive procurement, market incentives, and integration with existing energy policies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce energy costs and increase grid reliability, which can indirectly benefit low-income households, but its direct impact on child poverty is limited.

Title: Financial Institutions - Student Financing Companies - Required Registration and Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring student financing companies to register with the Commissioner of Financial Regulation before providing services in the State; requiring a student financing company to renew its registration on an annual basis; authorizing the Commissioner to adopt registration procedures for student financing companies, which may include certain fees; and requiring student financing companies to annually report certain information, to be made publicly accessible on a certain website, to the Commissioner beginning March 15, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill requires student financing companies to register with the Maryland Commissioner of Financial Regulation, report detailed information about their activities, and adhere to regulations to ensure transparency and consumer protection.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Commissioner of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Consumers of student financing products in Maryland, student financing companies, educational institutions, regulators
innovative_summary: The bill employs detailed reporting requirements and public data disclosure to increase transparency in the student financing market, utilizing regulatory oversight and data collection.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by increasing transparency and regulation of student financing, which can lead to better consumer protections and financial stability for families.

Title: Public Service Commission – Judicial Review – Proceedings
Synopsis: Clarifying that a certain proceeding for judicial review of a final decision or order by the Public Service Commission may be instituted in a circuit court for a county in which the public service company that is a party to the proceeding provides service or in the Circuit Court for Baltimore City.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the jurisdiction for judicial review of final decisions or orders by the Maryland Public Service Commission, specifying that such reviews can be initiated in a circuit court in the county where the public service company provides service or in Baltimore City.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Public service companies, consumers, and legal parties involved in Public Service Commission decisions
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies legal procedures and jurisdiction for judicial review, which is a legal procedural update rather than an innovative program employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it focuses on legal review procedures for utility decisions.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Violation Procedures and Fines
Synopsis: Establishing procedures for the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City, in the case of an alleged complaint against a licensed establishment or license holder, to make an offer of a monetary penalty as a compromise in lieu of a hearing before the Board under certain circumstances; and altering the maximum penalty for certain alcoholic beverages violations.
bill_summary: The bill establishes procedures for the Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners to offer monetary penalties as a compromise instead of a hearing for certain violations of alcoholic beverage laws, and modifies penalties for violations including selling to minors and pub crawl violations.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Licensed alcohol establishments and license holders in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new process allowing licensees to accept monetary penalties as a compromise, streamlining enforcement and potentially reducing hearings.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may improve community safety and enforcement efficiency.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - 46th Alcoholic Beverages District - Revisions
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to approve a license expansion to a noncontiguous property with a second separate use permit issued by the City if a certain condition is met; authorizing the establishment and conversion of various alcoholic beverages licenses in the 46th alcoholic beverages district; extending for 1 year the expiration of an alcoholic beverage licenses issued for  certain areas for certain transferal and renewal purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes revisions to Baltimore City's alcohol licensing laws, including authorizing license expansions, establishing and converting licenses in the 46th district, and extending the expiration dates of certain licenses until July 1, 2024.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners and Baltimore City government
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, Baltimore City residents, local businesses, and community organizations in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates licensing rules and extends license expiration dates; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Consumer Protection - Motor Vehicle Glass Repair or Replacement - Advanced Driver Assistance System Recalibration
Synopsis: Establishing consumer protections related to the repair or replacement of motor vehicle glass on motor vehicles equipped with an advanced driver assistance system; and establishing that a violation of the Act is an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice.
bill_summary: The bill establishes consumer protections related to the repair or replacement of motor vehicle glass on vehicles equipped with advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS). It requires repair facilities to inform customers if ADAS recalibration is needed, provide a written statement that repairs meet manufacturer specifications, and meet or exceed those specifications for recalibration. The bill also prohibits charging for unperformed services and mandates informing customers if recalibration is not completed.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or relevant motor vehicle safety agencies
stakeholders: Consumers with vehicles equipped with advanced driver assistance systems, motor vehicle repair shops, and vehicle manufacturers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific consumer protection requirements for the calibration of advanced driver assistance systems during vehicle glass repair or replacement, emphasizing transparency and adherence to manufacturer standards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on consumer protection and industry standards.

Title: Economic Development - Program Participation - Cannabis Business Establishments
Synopsis: Prohibiting the Department of Commerce from denying certain cannabis business entities conducting business in the State certain economic development program benefits under certain circumstances; clarifying the eligibility of certain cannabis business entities conducting business in the State under the Job Creation and One Maryland programs; authorizing certain cannabis business entities to reapply for benefits under certain economic development programs; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the Maryland Department of Commerce from denying certain economic development benefits and certifications to cannabis businesses solely because they are cannabis establishments, provided they meet other program requirements. It clarifies eligibility for cannabis businesses under various economic programs and allows businesses denied benefits before July 1, 2023, to reapply.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Cannabis business owners and operators in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach by explicitly including cannabis businesses in economic development programs and preventing discrimination against them, promoting inclusive economic growth.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to create jobs and economic opportunities for communities, which could help reduce child poverty.

Title: Higher Education - Appointment of Secretary and Student Financial Assistance - Accommodations at Public Institutions for Religious Beliefs
Synopsis: Providing that the Secretary of Higher Education is appointed by and serves at the pleasure of the Governor; requiring each institution of higher education to adopt a written policy that provides reasonable academic accommodations for students to practice sincerely held faith-based or religious beliefs; altering eligibility criteria for and the process for awards from the Delegate Howard P. Rawlings Program of Educational Excellence Awards; altering the administration of the Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes policies for reasonable academic accommodations for religious practices at public higher education institutions, reorganizes the Maryland Higher Education Commission, and expands financial aid programs including the Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship and the Guaranteed Access Grant, with specific eligibility criteria and funding provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Students attending public higher education institutions in Maryland, especially those practicing religious beliefs and low-income students
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to improve access to higher education through new policies, expanded financial aid, and organizational restructuring, integrating technology and outreach strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to higher education and financial aid for low-income students.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Sunday Sales
Synopsis: Altering the hours during which a licensee may sell alcoholic beverages on Sundays in Frederick County.
bill_summary: The bill amends alcohol sales hours in Frederick County, Maryland, allowing licensees to sell alcoholic beverages starting at 6 a.m. on Sundays, with specific hours for different types of licenses and establishments.
responsible_party: Frederick County Alcoholic Beverages Department or relevant licensing authority
stakeholders: Alcohol licensees, residents, and visitors in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes existing rules and hours for alcohol sales; it does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly adjusts alcohol sales hours.

Title: Prince George's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Main Street Laurel Development PG 404-23
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Prince George's County to issue up to five Class B-DD (Development District) beer, wine, and liquor licenses for restaurants located within the Main Street Laurel development.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the issuance of up to five new alcohol licenses for restaurants within Main Street Laurel in Prince George's County, Maryland.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Prince George’s County
stakeholders: Restaurants and businesses within Main Street Laurel, Prince George's County residents and visitors
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a targeted licensing program to promote development and economic activity in a specific urban area, utilizing a localized approach to alcohol licensing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to support local economic development, which can indirectly benefit children through improved community resources.

Title: Charles County - Property Tax - Credit for Volunteer Emergency Responders
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of Charles County to grant, by law, a  tax credit against the property tax imposed on the owner-occupied residence of certain emergency responders and their surviving spouses if the federal adjusted gross income of the emergency responder or the unmarried surviving spouse for the immediately preceding taxable years is $150,000 or less; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Charles County to grant a property tax credit to owner-occupied residences of emergency responders and their surviving spouses, with eligibility based on income and service status.
responsible_party: Charles County governing body
stakeholders: Emergency responders, their surviving spouses, and property owners in Charles County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a property tax credit program for emergency responders and their spouses, which is a common form of local tax relief but not particularly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily provides tax relief to emergency responders and their families.

Title: Maryland Native Plants Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Native Plants Program to respond to the increasing demand for, use of, and sale of native plants at retail garden centers and wholesale nurseries and to educate the public on native plants; requiring the Department of Agriculture to administer the Program in coordination with the University of Maryland Extension and to establish the "Maryland Natives" marketing program; requiring the University of Maryland Extension to hire an extension agent to serve as a native plant specialist for certain purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Native Plants Program to promote the use, sale, and public education about native plants in Maryland. It involves creating a native plant list, certification for growers and retailers, a marketing program, and educational resources managed by the University of Maryland Extension and the Department of Agriculture.
responsible_party: Department of Agriculture and University of Maryland Extension
stakeholders: Native plant growers, retailers, landscapers, the general public, and environmental organizations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach combining certification, marketing, and educational outreach, including a dedicated website and branding logo, to promote native plants.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve environmental quality and promote sustainable landscaping, which can indirectly benefit communities including children.

Title: Tax Sales - Data Collection - County Funding
Synopsis: Prohibiting the State Department of Assessments and Taxation from disbursing or authorizing the disbursement of certain funds to a county if the county has not provided certain information concerning its tax sales; altering the taxable year for which the Department is required to obtain certain information concerning county tax sales; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation to collect detailed data from counties about their tax sales, and prohibits disbursing funds to counties that do not provide this information. It also specifies the types of data to be collected and the process for doing so.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: County governments, property owners, and residents affected by tax sales in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs comprehensive data collection and reporting to improve transparency and oversight of county tax sale processes, but does not involve new technologies or approaches beyond data gathering.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on tax sale data collection and transparency could indirectly benefit vulnerable populations by improving tax sale processes, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: General Provisions - Commemorative Days - Dashain Day
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor annually to proclaim October 5 as Dashain Day, a festival originating in Nepal that celebrates and symbolizes victory of good over evil.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Governor of Maryland to annually proclaim October 5 as Dashain Day, a festival originating in Nepal that celebrates victory of good over evil.
responsible_party: Governor of Maryland
stakeholders: Nepalese community, South Asian communities, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill is a recognition and celebration of cultural diversity through official proclamation, rather than a new technological or innovative government program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Public Service Commission – Cybersecurity Staffing and Assessments (Critical Infrastructure Cybersecurity Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Requiring the Public Service Commission to include on its staff one or more employees that are experts in cybersecurity to perform certain duties; requiring the Commission to establish, in coordination with the Office of Security Management, cybersecurity standards and best practices for regulated entities; requiring each public service company to report a cybersecurity incident to certain entities; requiring the State Security Operations Center to immediately notify certain agencies of a certain reported cybersecurity incident; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Public Service Commission to include cybersecurity experts on its staff, establish cybersecurity standards for public service companies, and implement a zero-trust cybersecurity approach. It mandates regular assessments, incident reporting, and collaboration with cybersecurity agencies to enhance infrastructure security.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission and Department of Information Technology
stakeholders: Public service companies, utility consumers, state agencies, and cybersecurity entities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a proactive, comprehensive cybersecurity framework including zero-trust principles, regular third-party assessments, and enhanced collaboration with federal cybersecurity agencies, representing a modern approach to infrastructure security.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but improves infrastructure security which can indirectly benefit all residents, including children.

Title: Workgroup on Mold Standards and Remediation
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on Mold Standards and Remediation to study information on mold assessment and remediation to determine the best practices for identifying mold, preventing the development of mold within indoor environments, and remediating indoor molding conditions harmful to public health; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by October 1, 2024.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Workgroup on Mold Standards and Remediation to study and recommend best practices for identifying, preventing, and remediating indoor mold to protect public health.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Indoor environments, public health, mold-affected populations
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative approach involving multiple agencies and professional organizations to develop standardized mold assessment and remediation practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve health outcomes related to mold exposure, which can impact children in affected environments.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - Office of the Chief Medical Examiner
Synopsis: Establishing the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner in the Maryland Department of Health to advance forensic science and carry out other duties as provided by law; renaming the State Postmortem Examiners Commission to be the Postmortem Examiners Advisory Committee; requiring and authorizing the Department and the Office to perform certain duties and powers previously performed by the Commission; authorizing the Department to contract with a physician for employment with the Office on a per diem basis; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner within the Maryland Department of Health, renames the Postmortem Examiners Commission to the Postmortem Examiners Advisory Committee, and defines its duties. It also sets staffing, certification, and operational procedures for the Office, including autopsy and investigation protocols, and clarifies employment and reemployment rules for medical examiners and related personnel.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health, Office of the Chief Medical Examiner
stakeholders: Deceased individuals, families of the deceased, law enforcement, medical professionals, and the public involved in forensic investigations
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a dedicated Office of the Chief Medical Examiner with specific staffing, certification, and operational standards, and clarifies procedures for investigations and autopsies, employing modern forensic practices and ensuring independence of clinical findings.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on forensic investigation procedures and organizational structure.

Title: State Employees – Programs and Scholarships for Human Services Careers and Probation Agents and State Contributions to Supplemental Retirement Plans
