Synopsis: Establishing the Pilot Program for Human Services Careers; altering the eligibility criteria for the Maryland Loan Assistance Repayment Program for Police Officers and the Maryland Police Officers Scholarship Program to include probation agents who work for the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services; establishing the Pilot Program for Human Services Careers Scholarship; requiring the Maryland Higher Education Commission to make awards from the Human Services Careers Scholarship Pilot Program in fiscal year 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes pilot programs and scholarships to encourage careers in human services and law enforcement in Maryland, including collaboration with local schools, and provides funding and support for employees and students pursuing relevant careers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services and Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Students, current employees, and residents in Baltimore City, Baltimore County, and Prince George's County interested in human services and law enforcement careers
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining scholarships, mentorship, and collaboration with local schools to develop a pipeline of human services and law enforcement professionals, integrating education and employment support.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing employment opportunities in human services and law enforcement, which directly impacts families and children.

Title: Hunting, Wildlife Conservation, and Outdoor Recreation - Funding, Promotion, Management, Licenses, Permits, and Stamps
Synopsis: Altering the purpose of the Heritage Conservation Fund to include acquiring interests in land that can be used by the general public for hunting; establishing the Wildlife Conservation, Education, and Outreach Program to provide outreach and foster an interest in outdoor recreation and stewardship, hunting, and wildlife conservation; establishing a stamp for hunting sika deer; authorizing a nonresident attending a college or university in the State to purchase a resident hunting license; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland's wildlife conservation laws by expanding the Heritage Conservation Fund to include land for public hunting, establishing a Wildlife Conservation, Education, and Outreach Program, creating a Sika Deer hunting stamp, adjusting license fees, and addressing deer overpopulation through a state plan and potential rotational hunting strategies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Hunters, landowners, conservationists, students, and the general public interested in outdoor recreation and wildlife conservation
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new outreach program and a specific stamp for Sika Deer, and plans for a rotational hunting strategy to manage deer overpopulation, employing new approaches to wildlife management and public engagement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may indirectly benefit communities through outdoor recreation and conservation efforts.

Title: Public Employee Relations Act
Synopsis: Consolidating and altering certain laws governing collective bargaining for certain public employees, including laws related to the establishment of bargaining units, election and certification of exclusive representatives, employee and employer rights, unfair labor practices, and strikes and lockouts; establishing the Public Employee Relations Board to oversee collective bargaining activities for certain public employees; etc.
bill_summary: The bill consolidates and updates laws governing collective bargaining for public employees in Maryland, establishes the Public Employee Relations Board to oversee these activities, and repeals previous labor relations boards and statutes.
responsible_party: Public Employee Relations Board
stakeholders: Public employees, public employers, and employee organizations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive, modernized framework for public employee labor relations, including new procedures for elections, certification, and dispute resolution, employing a centralized independent board.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to improve working conditions and bargaining rights for public employees, which can indirectly benefit children through improved public services.

Title: Alcoholic Beverages – Use of Alcoholic Beverages for Educational Purposes
Synopsis: Authorizing certain students who are at least 18 years old and under the age of 21 years to taste certain alcoholic beverages while participating in a course or program in enology, fermenting, brewing, or hospitality and tourism offered by a qualified institution of higher education without criminal penalty to the student, instructor, or institution of higher education under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill allows certain underage students enrolled in higher education programs related to enology, brewing, or hospitality to taste alcoholic beverages during their courses without facing criminal penalties, provided specific conditions are met. It also clarifies rules around underage alcohol possession and consumption, especially in educational contexts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Higher Education Institutions
stakeholders: Students enrolled in higher education programs related to enology, brewing, or hospitality, educational institutions, and alcohol educators in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by integrating practical tasting experiences into higher education curricula for students under the legal drinking age, under controlled conditions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting educational practices and legal rules.

Title: Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program - Modifications
Synopsis: Modifying the Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program by clarifying and altering certain provisions relating to the administration of the Program; establishing the employer and employee shares of the total rate of contribution; prohibiting the total rate of contribution from exceeding 1.2% of an employee's wages; requiring the State to pay for certain contributions for certain covered employees; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to reimburse certain community providers for certain employer contributions in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program by clarifying administration, establishing contribution shares, prohibiting contribution rates from exceeding a certain percentage, and outlining employer and employee responsibilities, including state reimbursement for certain employer contributions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Employees, employers, community providers, and self-employed individuals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach integrating state-funded reimbursements, contribution sharing, and a new insurance-based leave system, utilizing technology for claims and data management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by supporting parental leave, family caregiving, and bonding, which can improve child well-being and economic stability.

Title: Frederick County – Alcoholic Beverages – Miniature Golf Course License
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County to issue a Class B-MGC (miniature golf course) beer, wine, and liquor license to a miniature golf course under certain circumstances; authorizing a license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption under certain circumstances; requiring a license holder to submit an annual gross sales report for alcohol, golf games and food to the Board before a license may be renewed; and providing an annual license fee of $1,500.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Frederick County to issue a new type of alcohol license for miniature golf courses, allowing them to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption under specific conditions, including food offerings and sales limits.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County
stakeholders: Miniature golf courses, visitors to these courses, local residents, and alcohol consumers in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The program introduces a specialized alcohol license tailored for miniature golf courses, integrating alcohol sales with recreational activities and specific operational requirements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on licensing and sales regulations for recreational venues.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Basket of Cheer
Synopsis: Repealing the requirement in Frederick County that alcoholic beverages in a basket of cheer be produced in Maryland.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the requirement that alcoholic beverages in a 'basket of cheer' in Frederick County be produced in Maryland, and allows certain license holders to provide baskets of cheer as prizes at benefit performances without the Maryland production restriction.
responsible_party: Frederick County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders, event organizers, benefit performers, and the general public in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies the rules for providing baskets of cheer as prizes, removing the Maryland production requirement, which is a minor regulatory change.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly changes licensing rules for baskets of cheer.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Consumption Permits
Synopsis: Altering the quantity of certain alcoholic beverages an individual may consume under certain consumption permits issued in Frederick County.
bill_summary: The bill amends alcohol consumption permits in Frederick County, Maryland, allowing for increased quantities of beer, wine, and liquor to be consumed on licensed premises under certain permits, and introduces a new permit type with higher allowances and fees.
responsible_party: Frederick County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcohol consumers and licensed alcohol establishments in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new permit type that allows for higher quantities of alcohol to be consumed on premises, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting alcohol consumption regulations.

Title: Corporations - Filing Requirements for Dissolution and Termination of Registration or Qualification - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing certain provisions of law applicable to the State Department of Assessments and Taxation that prohibit the acceptance of articles of dissolution and issuance of a certificate of termination for certain corporations unless certain reports on personal property are filed with the Department; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain requirements that previously prevented the State Department of Assessments and Taxation from accepting articles of dissolution and issuing certificates of termination for corporations unless specific reports on personal property were filed. It simplifies the process for corporations to dissolve or terminate registration or qualification in Maryland.
responsible_party: State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Corporations registered or qualified in Maryland, including domestic and foreign corporations
innovative_summary: The bill streamlines and removes certain procedural barriers in the dissolution and termination process for corporations, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly changes corporate dissolution procedures.

Title: Commercial Vehicles - Police-Initiated Towing - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions related to the rates the Department of State Police sets for tow companies involved in certain police-initiated towing; establishing the Committee on Rate Setting and Complaint Resolution for Police-Initiated Medium-Duty and Heavy-Duty Towing and Recovery; and requiring the Committee, on or before December 1, 2023, to recommend approved rates to the Department of State Police that should be charged for police-initiated towing and recovery services.
bill_summary: The bill modifies regulations for police-initiated towing of commercial vehicles in Maryland, including establishing a committee to set rates and handle complaints, and requires tow companies to ban per pound billing by October 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of State Police
stakeholders: Commercial vehicle owners, towing companies, law enforcement agencies, and the general public involved in commercial vehicle towing
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a dedicated committee to set towing rates and handle complaints, and mandates a transition away from per pound billing, employing a structured approach to rate regulation and dispute resolution.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on regulatory and procedural changes in commercial vehicle towing.

Title: Wicomico County - Sanitary District - Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of Wicomico County to create a sanitary district.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the governing body of Wicomico County to create a sanitary district, allowing for the establishment of a district and its governing sanitary commission.
responsible_party: Wicomico County governing body
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in Wicomico County who will be served by the sanitary district
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a local sanitary district governance structure, which is a standard approach for managing sanitation services at the county level.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns sanitation district creation and governance.

Title: Howard County – Archery Hunting – Safety Zone and Position of Archery Hunter Ho. Co. 15–23
Synopsis: Reducing from 150 yards to 50 yards the size of the safety zone for archery hunters in Howard County who are under the authority of a deer management permit or who are actively participating in a hunting program administered by the county within which archery hunting may not take place except under certain circumstances; and requiring certain archery hunters in Howard County to be in an elevated position when hunting any wild bird or mammal within 50 to 150 yards of certain buildings.
bill_summary: The bill amends regulations for archery hunting in Maryland, specifically adjusting safety zones and hunter positioning requirements near buildings and inhabited areas, with particular provisions for Howard County.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Archery hunters, residents near hunting areas, wildlife management authorities
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates safety regulations and hunting protocols; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns hunting safety regulations.

Title: Public Safety – Refrigerants – Limitations on Use
Synopsis: Providing that, notwithstanding any other provision of law, except for regulations issued by the Department of the Environment, no provision of the State building code or other law or regulation may prohibit or otherwise limit the use of a refrigerant if the refrigerant is designated as acceptable for use under federal listing requirements and any appliance containing the refrigerant meets federal safety standards and use conditions.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the Maryland state building code and other laws from restricting the use of certain federally approved refrigerants in appliances, provided they meet safety standards.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Manufacturers, service providers, and users of appliances containing refrigerants in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill aligns state regulations with federal standards, ensuring the use of environmentally acceptable refrigerants without state restrictions, promoting consistency and safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Prince George's County - Land Use - Development of Neglected Property PG 406-23
Synopsis: Authorizing Prince George's County to exercise powers of eminent domain to acquire and develop or redevelop, for a public purpose, certain neglected property located in the county that has been designated as a transit-oriented development and is located within a business improvement district; and prohibiting land or property taken by the county through the use of eminent domain under the provisions of the Act to be taken without just compensation, as agreed on between the parties, or awarded by a jury.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Prince George's County to use eminent domain to acquire and develop neglected property within transit-oriented development areas, specifically within business improvement districts, for economic development purposes.
responsible_party: Prince George's County government
stakeholders: Property owners, local residents, businesses, and developers in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill employs the use of eminent domain specifically for neglected properties within transit-oriented development zones, which is a strategic approach to urban redevelopment.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to impact child poverty indirectly by promoting economic development and revitalization in targeted areas.

Title: Juvenile Services Education Program - Transfer of Locally Employed Educational Professionals
Synopsis: Requiring educational professionals employed by a county board of education, the Baltimore City Board of School Commissioners, or a county public library system who transfer to the Juvenile Services Education Program to be given credit as State employees for certain years of service for the purpose of establishing leave accrual rates; authorizing an individual who transfers to the Program to transfer leave balances in excess of a certain limit under certain circumstances; and applying the Act retroactively.
bill_summary: The bill requires that educational professionals transferring from local public schools or libraries to the Juvenile Services Education Program in Maryland be placed in comparable positions with similar pay and benefits, including the transfer of leave balances and credit for years of service. It also establishes procedures for maintaining leave and employment continuity.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Educational professionals employed by local public schools or libraries transferring to the Juvenile Services Education Program
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes transfer procedures and benefits for educational professionals moving between local public education and juvenile services, ensuring continuity of employment benefits, which is a procedural improvement rather than a new technological approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a moderate impact on child poverty by ensuring stability and continuity for educational staff working with at-risk youth, potentially improving educational outcomes.

Title: Transportation – Assaults on Public Transit Operators – Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Transit Administration to submit a report by December 1, 2023, and each year thereafter on assaults on public transit operators to each local executive authority, the State's Attorney for each county, and certain committees of the General Assembly; and requiring the report to include information on the nature of each assault, the mode of transit involved, the location of the assault, whether the police were involved, and the outcome of any investigation.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Transit Administration to submit annual reports on assaults on public transit operators, including details of each assault, comparisons with other states, and best practices for prevention. It also mandates additional data collection and evaluation of safety measures, with the goal of improving safety for transit workers.
responsible_party: Maryland Transit Administration
stakeholders: Public transit operators and transit riders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill promotes data collection, comparison, and evaluation of safety practices, including exploring new technologies and establishing a statewide transit safety officer, which introduces a comprehensive and proactive approach to transit safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily focuses on safety and data reporting for transit workers.

Title: Public Information Act - Decisions of the State Public Information Act Compliance Board - Appeals
Synopsis: Authorizing an applicant to appeal a certain decision issued by the State Public Information Compliance Board; authorizing a party aggrieved by a final judgment of a circuit court in a proceeding for judicial review of a certain decision of the Board to appeal to the Appellate Court of Maryland.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland Public Information Act to allow applicants to appeal decisions made by the State Public Information Act Compliance Board and to permit parties aggrieved by a final judgment in judicial review to appeal to the Maryland Court of Appeals.
responsible_party: Maryland State Public Information Act Compliance Board and Maryland courts
stakeholders: Public record requesters, government agencies, legal professionals, and the general public involved in public information access
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal appeals process for decisions related to public information access, including appeals of board decisions and court judgments, enhancing transparency and accountability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but improves transparency in public information access.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Performing Arts Theater License
Synopsis: Establishing in Harford County a performing arts theater beer and wine license that authorizes the holder to sell or serve beer and wine in certain performing arts theaters at retail for on-premises consumption; and establishing an annual license fee of $500.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new performing arts theater beer and wine license in Harford County, Maryland, allowing nonprofit theaters to sell or serve beer and wine during performances and related events.
responsible_party: Harford County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Performing arts theaters, nonprofit organizations, theater attendees, local community
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized license for performing arts theaters to sell alcohol, integrating alcohol sales into cultural and entertainment venues.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting theater operations and attendees.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Alteration of License Quota
Synopsis: Altering the quota used to determine the maximum number of certain alcoholic beverages licenses that the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County may issue from one for every 3,000 individuals to one for every 4,000 individuals.
bill_summary: The bill alters the quota for issuing certain alcoholic beverage licenses in Harford County, increasing the population threshold from 3,000 to 4,000 individuals for the purpose of limiting the number of licenses issued.
responsible_party: Harford County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license applicants and businesses in Harford County
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes licensing quotas based on population, which is a standard regulatory adjustment, not an innovative program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class HC (Health Club) License
Synopsis: Establishing a 6-day and a 7-day Class HC (health club) beer and wine license in Harford County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County to issue the license to a person who sells health club services; exempting the holder of the license from certain distance requirements related to places of worship and schools; establishing an annual fee of $1,300 for a 6-day license and $1,400 for a 7-day license; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new Class HC (Health Club) license in Harford County allowing health clubs with certain amenities to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption, with specific licensing rules and fees.
responsible_party: Harford County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Health clubs, members, and patrons in Harford County
innovative_summary: The program introduces a specialized alcohol license for health clubs, integrating alcohol sales into health club services, which is a novel approach to licensing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on licensing rules for health clubs.

Title: Hate Crimes - Commission on Hate Crime Response and Prevention - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission on Hate Crime Response and Prevention to develop strategies to prevent and respond to hate crime activity and evaluate State laws and policies relating to hate crimes; and requiring the Commission to report to the General Assembly on or before December 1 each year, beginning in 2024, on legislative recommendations to address hate crimes in the State.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Commission on Hate Crime Response and Prevention within the Maryland Office of the Attorney General. The commission will develop strategies to prevent and respond to hate crimes, evaluate related laws and policies, and report annually on policy and legislative recommendations.
responsible_party: Office of the Maryland Attorney General
stakeholders: Individuals and communities affected by hate crimes in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a dedicated commission with diverse community and organizational representation to systematically address hate crimes, including annual reporting and policy evaluation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on hate crime prevention and response.

Title: Criminal Law and Procedure - Cannabis - Fines for Smoking in Public, Stops, and Searches
Synopsis: Altering the maximum fines for smoking cannabis in a public place; prohibiting a law enforcement officer from initiating a stop or a search of a person, a motor vehicle, or a vessel based solely on certain factors; prohibiting, under certain circumstances, a law enforcement officer from conducting a search of a certain area of a motor vehicle or vessel; providing that evidence obtained in violation of certain provisions of the Act is not admissible in certain proceedings; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reduces fines for smoking cannabis in public, clarifies that evidence obtained solely from the odor of cannabis or related factors cannot be used to justify stops, searches, or arrests, and prohibits law enforcement from initiating stops or searches based solely on certain cannabis-related factors.
responsible_party: Maryland State Law Enforcement and Judicial System
stakeholders: Individuals suspected of cannabis possession or use, law enforcement agencies, legal system
innovative_summary: The bill introduces restrictions on the use of odor and related factors as sole grounds for law enforcement stops and searches, and reduces fines for public cannabis smoking, employing a more rights-based approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, mainly through legal and procedural reforms.

Title: Income Tax - Automated External Defibrillator Tax Credit
Synopsis: Allowing an individual or a business entity to claim a credit against the State income tax for the first $500 of the purchase price of an automated external defibrillator purchased for use at a restaurant location in the State with annual gross income of at least $400,000; prohibiting the credit from being claimed more than once by any individual or business entity for each restaurant location; and providing certain other limitations.
bill_summary: The bill allows individuals or business entities owning a restaurant in Maryland with annual gross income of at least $400,000 to claim a tax credit of up to $500 for purchasing an automated external defibrillator (AED) for use at the restaurant. The credit can be claimed once per restaurant location, with a maximum of $1,500 per year, and is applicable for five years starting from the 2023 tax year.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Restaurant owners and employees, restaurant customers, public health and safety organizations
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a tax credit program to incentivize the purchase of AEDs by restaurants, leveraging tax policy as a tool for public health promotion.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily promotes health safety measures in restaurants.

Title: Prince George's County - Board of Education and School System Revisions PG 502-23
Synopsis: Altering the duties and responsibilities of the Prince George's County Board of Education and certain officers of the county board; altering the voting authority of the student board member; requiring the county board to retain counsel and pay certain counsel fees and expenses incurred for defending a member in litigation involving a member's service in the member's official capacity on the county board under certain circumstances; altering certain procedures for the election of the student member of the county board; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes various changes to the governance, election procedures, and oversight of the Prince George's County Board of Education, including establishing an Office of Accountability and Compliance with an Inspector General, modifying the composition and election of the board, and implementing a system of public campaign financing for county offices but excluding the student member.
responsible_party: Prince George’s County Board of Education and County Government
stakeholders: Students, parents, educators, and residents of Prince George’s County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new Office of Accountability and Compliance with an Inspector General, and a system of public campaign financing for county offices, employing new oversight and transparency approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by improving school governance, accountability, and resource allocation.

Title: Natural Resources - Oyster Inspection and Severance Taxes - Increase
Synopsis: Increasing the amount of the inspection tax levied on marketable oysters shipped in the shell to any place outside the State from 30 cents to $1 per bushel; increasing the amount of the severance tax levied on oysters caught within certain natural oyster bars from $1 to $2 per bushel; repealing a certain requirement that a certain tax increase be used for the oyster seed program; and requiring that $1 of each $2 of the severance tax levied be used by certain county oyster committees for the repletion of natural oyster bars.
bill_summary: The bill increases the inspection tax on oysters shipped out of Maryland and the severance tax on oysters caught within certain natural oyster bars. It also changes how the severance tax revenue is used, directing funds to county oyster committees for oyster bar repletion, and repeals a previous requirement that part of the tax increase be used for the oyster seed program.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Oyster fishermen, oyster industry, local counties involved in oyster repletion
innovative_summary: The bill primarily adjusts tax rates and directs existing funds to specific oyster conservation efforts, without introducing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on oyster industry regulation and conservation.

Title: Wicomico County - Sunday Hunting and Archery Hunting Safety Zones
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Natural Resources to allow a person to hunt game birds and mammals on each Sunday of the game bird and game mammal seasons from 30 minutes before sunrise until 10:30 a.m. in Wicomico County; authorizing the Department to allow Sunday hunting in Wicomico County on public land, subject to certain time restrictions; and adding Wicomico County to the list of counties in which the safety zone for archery hunters extends 50 yards from certain structures occupied by human beings.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Sunday hunting in Wicomico County for game birds, mammals, and deer during specific seasons, and adjusts safety zones for archery hunters, extending the distance from structures in Wicomico County.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Hunters, residents, and landowners in Wicomico County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the option for Sunday hunting in Wicomico County and adjusts safety zones, which is a new approach to hunting regulations in the area.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting hunting regulations and safety zones.

Title: Baltimore County - Property Tax Exemption - Real Property Owned by Fire Company or Rescue Squad
Synopsis: Altering a certain exemption from property tax for real property that is located in Baltimore County that is owned by an incorporated, nonprofit fire company or rescue squad by providing that the exemption applies only if the property is used or will be used exclusively for the purposes of the fire company or rescue squad; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the property tax exemption rules for real property owned by fire companies or rescue squads in Baltimore County, specifying that the exemption applies only if the property is used or will be used exclusively for certain fire or rescue purposes.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Department of Finance or relevant local tax authority
stakeholders: Fire companies, rescue squads, property owners in Baltimore County
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies and restricts existing property tax exemptions rather than introducing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly concerns property tax rules for fire and rescue organizations.

Title: Prince George's County - Economic Development - Business Improvement Districts PG 407-23
Synopsis: Authorizing Prince George's County to create certain business improvement districts intended to promote the general welfare of the residents, employers, employees, property owners, tenants, consumers, and general public with the geographic area of the districts; requiring the county to adopt certain local laws to provide for the creation and organization of a district; removing Prince George's County from the scope of law governing the establishment of business improvement districts; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Prince George's County to create and organize Business Improvement Districts, including establishing a district corporation, imposing taxes, and defining governance and expansion procedures.
responsible_party: Prince George's County government
stakeholders: Property owners, business owners, residents, and commercial tenants within the district
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured process for establishing Business Improvement Districts with local governance, tax authority, and expansion procedures, employing a formalized approach to district management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on district organization and economic development.

Title: Baltimore County - Insurance - Certificates of Guarantee for County Bond Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing Baltimore County to honor certificates of guarantee that are issued by certain associations or on behalf of certain contractors in order to satisfy certain county bond requirements; and providing that Baltimore County is not required under certain provisions of law to honor certain certificates of guarantee.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain counties in Maryland to honor certificates of guarantee issued by approved associations or contractors to satisfy county bond requirements, but does not require counties to do so.
responsible_party: Baltimore County and other specified Maryland counties
stakeholders: Contractors and associations issuing certificates of guarantee, and county governments involved in public improvements
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal recognition process for certificates of guarantee to facilitate county bonding requirements, which is a new approach to county bonding procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly pertains to county bonding procedures.

Title: Libraries – Regional Resource Centers – Governance Requirements
Synopsis: Altering the requirements for governance of libraries designated as regional resource centers; and establishing a governing board for each regional resource center.
bill_summary: The bill establishes governance requirements for regional resource centers of libraries in Maryland, including the creation of a governing board for each center, defining its composition, powers, and responsibilities, and setting standards for operation and funding.
responsible_party: Maryland State Library Board and regional governing boards
stakeholders: Public library users and library systems in Maryland, especially those served by regional resource centers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured governance model for regional library resource centers, including dedicated governing boards and formalized operational standards, which is a new approach to library management in Maryland.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access to library resources and services, especially in underserved regions.

Title: Transit - Grant Funding for Local Service - Alterations
Synopsis: Establishing the Locally Operated Transit System Grant Program in the Department of Transportation; and authorizing program funds to be sourced from federal and State public transportation programs.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Locally Operated Transit System Grant Program to provide increased and inflation-adjusted funding for local transit systems in Maryland, sourced from federal and state transportation funds, starting in fiscal year 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Locally operated transit systems and their riders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs inflation adjustment mechanisms and performance indicators, including independent audits, to improve transit funding efficiency and accountability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve transit access, which can help reduce child poverty by increasing mobility and access to services.

Title: Harford County - Advisory Plumbing Board
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of Harford County to enact a local law providing for the membership and terms of the Harford County Advisory Plumbing Board.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Harford County to establish a local law defining the membership and terms of its Advisory Plumbing Board, which assists in drafting, adopting, and enforcing plumbing codes.
responsible_party: Harford County governing body
stakeholders: Plumbers, residents, and businesses in Harford County affected by plumbing codes and regulations
innovative_summary: The bill allows for local customization of plumbing code enforcement through the establishment of an advisory board, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily pertains to plumbing regulation governance.

Title: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Health Care Commission - Dental Services - Survey and Regional Needs Assessment
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health, in consultation with the Maryland Hospital Association, to conduct a survey of hospitals to identify the availability of hospital operating resources for dentist use; requiring the Department and the Maryland Health Care Commission, in consultation with the Maryland Hospital Association, to develop regional plans to ensure the availability of appropriate operating space for the performance of dental procedures for Maryland Medical Assistance Program recipients; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Health Care Commission to review and revise reimbursement rates for adult and pediatric dental services under the Maryland Medical Assistance Program. It also mandates surveys and regional needs assessments to ensure adequate access to dental care, including services requiring anesthesia or sedation, and to develop plans for operating room capacity for dental procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Medicaid recipients, dental providers, hospitals, and ambulatory surgery centers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs data analysis, regional needs assessments, and capacity planning to improve access to dental care, including the use of new data collection and regional planning approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by improving access to dental care for children on Medicaid.

Title: Behavioral Health Care - Treatment and Access (Behavioral Health Model for Maryland)
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access to make recommendations to provide appropriate, accessible, and comprehensive behavioral health services that are available on demand to individuals in the State; establishing the Behavioral Health Care Coordination Value-Based Purchasing Pilot Program in the Maryland Department of Health; requiring the Department to apply for certain federal planning grant funds; requiring the Department to apply to participate in a certain demonstration program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access to improve behavioral health services, creates a pilot program for value-based care coordination, expands telehealth services including audio-only calls, and sets up certified community behavioral health clinics in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals in Maryland requiring behavioral health services, including mental health and substance use disorder patients, providers, and community organizations.
innovative_summary: The bill employs new approaches such as a value-based purchasing pilot program, expansion of telehealth including audio-only services, and the establishment of certified community behavioral health clinics, integrating technology and innovative care models.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by improving access to behavioral health services for children and families in need.

Title: Medicaid Waiver Programs - Waitlist and Registry Reduction (End the Wait Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain Medicaid funding to be used to provide community services to individuals waiting for services through waiver programs; authorizing certain Medicaid funding to be used for expanding provider capacity in certain waiver programs; and altering the uses of certain funding appropriated to the Dedicated Purpose Account in the fiscal year 2023 budget bill.
bill_summary: The bill aims to reduce waitlists for various Medicaid waiver programs by 50% starting in fiscal year 2024, expand provider capacity, and allocate funds for community services for individuals on waiting lists. It also includes budget appropriations for various programs and initiatives across health, education, economic development, and public safety sectors.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Individuals waiting for Medicaid waiver services, providers, and families of individuals with disabilities
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining funding, provider recruitment, and capacity expansion to address Medicaid waitlists, integrating health and education agencies for targeted service delivery.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to essential health and support services for children with disabilities and their families.

Title: Commercial Law and Financial Institutions - Credit Regulation - Shared Appreciation Agreements
Synopsis: Making certain shared appreciation agreements subject to the Maryland Mortgage Lender Law and other provisions of law that regulate certain loans of single extensions of closed end credit and revolving credit plans; and authorizing the Commissioner of Financial Regulation to adopt certain regulations regarding the enforcement of and compliance with provisions of law that regulate shared appreciation agreements.
bill_summary: The bill regulates shared appreciation agreements by making them subject to existing laws governing certain loans, and authorizes the Maryland Financial Regulation Commissioner to adopt regulations for enforcement and compliance.
responsible_party: Maryland Commissioner of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Borrowers, lenders, and financial institutions involved in shared appreciation agreements in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces regulation and oversight of shared appreciation agreements, integrating them into existing loan laws and establishing a regulatory framework.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to impact child poverty by regulating financial agreements that could affect household financial stability.

Title: Health Insurance - Reimbursement for Services Rendered by a Pharmacist
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Medical Assistance Program, the Maryland Children's Health Program, and certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to provide coverage for all services rendered to an enrollee by a licensed pharmacist within the pharmacist's lawful scope of practice to the same extent as services rendered by any other health care practitioner; and applying the Act to all policies, contracts, and health benefit plans issued, delivered, or renewed by January 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland's Medicaid, Children's Health Program, and certain insurers to cover all services provided by licensed pharmacists within their scope of practice, and ensures reimbursement for these services regardless of employment or physician oversight. It also mandates coverage for contraceptive devices without prior authorization and streamlines access to contraceptives.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Medicaid enrollees, children, and residents receiving health insurance in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill expands pharmacists' scope of practice to include all services within their lawful scope and mandates coverage and reimbursement for these services, promoting broader access to healthcare through pharmacists.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to healthcare services and contraceptives, which can improve health outcomes and economic stability for families.

Title: Behavioral Health Programs - Residential Programs - Food Service Facility Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to adopt regulations that establish certain food service facility standards that are appropriate to residential programs that have less than 17 residents.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that regulations requiring residential behavioral health programs to comply with food service facility standards are not applicable to programs with fewer than 17 residents that are licensed under specific COMAR regulations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Residential behavioral health programs and their residents with fewer than 17 residents
innovative_summary: The bill mainly clarifies regulatory exemptions and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly addresses regulatory exemptions for small residential programs.

Title: Pharmacists - Therapy Management Contract - Form
Synopsis: Providing that a therapy management contract may be entered into in writing or orally; requiring, if a therapy management contract is entered into orally, the parties to the therapy management contract to reduce the contract to writing within 30 days after entering into the therapy management contract; and providing that a therapy management contract may be in electronic form.
bill_summary: The bill updates regulations regarding therapy management contracts for pharmacists, allowing these contracts to be entered into orally or in writing, with a requirement to reduce oral agreements to writing within 30 days. It also permits contracts to be in electronic form.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Pharmacy
stakeholders: Pharmacists, authorized prescribers, and patients receiving drug therapy management services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces flexibility in the formation of therapy management contracts by allowing oral and electronic agreements, which is a modern approach to healthcare agreements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly updates contractual procedures for healthcare providers.

Title: State Board of Dental Examiners - University of Maryland School of Dentistry Faculty - Qualifying for Examination
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which a dentist who is a faculty member at the University of Maryland School of Dentistry and was trained at a foreign dental school must be qualified by the State Board of Dental Examiners to take an examination offered by the American Board of Dental Examiners, Inc., or its successor organization.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the qualifications for foreign-trained faculty members at the University of Maryland School of Dentistry to take the ADEX dental examination, which can lead to a general dental license in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners
stakeholders: Foreign-trained faculty members at the University of Maryland School of Dentistry and potential dental licensees in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill streamlines the qualification process for foreign-trained faculty members to take the dental licensing exam, potentially increasing the pool of qualified dentists.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting dental faculty qualifications.

Title: Study on the Utilization of the Expedited Licensing Process for Service Members, Veterans, and Military Spouses
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor, in consultation with the Department of Veterans Affairs, to conduct a study on the utilization of the expedited licensing process for service members, veterans, and military spouses for certain occupational and professional licenses in the State; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor, in consultation with the Department of Veterans Affairs, to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by June 30, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Labor, in consultation with the Department of Veterans Affairs, to conduct a two-year study on the use of the expedited licensing process for service members, veterans, and military spouses, including outreach and best practices, with a report due by June 30, 2024.
responsible_party: Department of Labor in consultation with the Department of Veterans Affairs
stakeholders: Service members, veterans, and military spouses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill promotes better utilization and awareness of existing expedited licensing processes for military-connected individuals, focusing on outreach and best practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly focuses on licensing processes for military personnel and their families.

Title: Alcohol and Tobacco Commission – Technical Corrections and Clarifications
Synopsis: Correcting certain references to the Comptroller of Maryland to be the Executive Director of the Alcohol and Tobacco Commission, as appropriate; and clarifying certain powers and duties of the Executive Director of the Commission relating to alcoholic beverages regulation and enforcement.
bill_summary: The bill makes technical corrections and clarifications to the Maryland Alcohol and Tobacco Commission, including updating references to the Executive Director, clarifying powers and duties, and streamlining enforcement and licensing procedures for alcohol and tobacco products.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcohol and Tobacco Commission
stakeholders: Alcohol and tobacco licensees, law enforcement, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing legal and administrative frameworks without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it mainly involves regulatory and administrative updates.

Title: Calvert County - Civil Infractions - Prosecutorial Designations
Synopsis: Authorizing the State's Attorney of Calvert County to designate county attorneys or assistant county attorneys to prosecute civil infractions; and authorizing the designated attorneys to exercise the powers of the State's Attorney when prosecuting civil infractions.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the State’s Attorney of Calvert County to designate a county attorney or assistant to prosecute civil infractions, and grants them certain prosecutorial powers.
responsible_party: Calvert County State’s Attorney and County Attorney
stakeholders: Residents and individuals involved in civil infractions in Calvert County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new prosecutorial designation process for civil infractions within Calvert County, allowing designated attorneys to exercise specific powers.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Hunting Offenses - Expungement
Synopsis: Authorizing a person to file a petition for expungement of certain criminal records based on a conviction for certain hunting offenses.
bill_summary: The bill allows individuals convicted of certain hunting offenses to petition for expungement of their criminal records after a specified period, which varies depending on the offense.
responsible_party: Maryland State Judiciary or Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services (implied)
stakeholders: Individuals with hunting offense convictions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific expungement process for hunting offenses, which is a targeted legal reform but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily changes legal procedures for record expungement.

Title: Calvert County - Length of Service Award Program - Benefits
Synopsis: Altering a certain benefit amount for certain fire and rescue volunteers; and authorizing the board of commissioners to approve an increase in benefit payment for certain fire and rescue volunteers.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the benefits for Calvert County volunteer fire and rescue volunteers, including increasing death benefits and allowing the county board to approve benefit increases based on cost-of-living adjustments.
responsible_party: Calvert County Board of County Commissioners
stakeholders: Volunteer fire and rescue personnel in Calvert County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a provision allowing the county to increase volunteer benefits based on cost-of-living adjustments, which is a flexible approach to benefit management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily benefits volunteer emergency responders.

Title: Public Utilities - Certificate of Public Convenience and Necessity and Meter Aggregation
Synopsis: Defining "generating station" as it relates to the requirement to obtain a certificate of public convenience and necessity or approval from the Public Service Commission for a person who constructs a generating station that has the capacity to produce more than 2 but not more than 14 megawatts of electricity from a solar photovoltaic system; requiring an electric company to provide meter aggregation for certain eligible customer-generators under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates regulations concerning solar photovoltaic systems and meter aggregation, including defining 'generating station' for small-scale solar projects, streamlining approval processes, and requiring electric companies to provide meter aggregation for certain eligible customer-generators.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission and electric utilities
stakeholders: Solar energy developers, eligible customer-generators, electric utility customers, and local communities involved in solar projects
innovative_summary: The bill introduces streamlined approval processes and mandates meter aggregation for specific customer groups, employing existing technologies in a new regulatory framework to facilitate small-scale solar energy adoption.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may indirectly support community development and energy affordability.

Title: Task Force on Preventing and Countering Elder Abuse
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force on Preventing and Countering Elder Abuse to study existing laws, policies, and practices relating to elder abuse and crimes commonly committed against older adults; and requiring the Task Force to submit a final report by December 31, 2024, to the Governor and the General Assembly with its findings and recommendations regarding changes to State law, policy, and practice that would aid in preventing elder abuse.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Task Force on Preventing and Countering Elder Abuse to review laws, policies, and practices related to elder abuse and make recommendations for improvements, including prevention, prosecution, and resource allocation.
responsible_party: Department of Aging
stakeholders: Older adults in Maryland, especially vulnerable seniors and their caregivers
innovative_summary: The bill creates a dedicated task force to comprehensively review and recommend improvements to elder abuse prevention and response, employing a coordinated, multi-agency approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program primarily targets elder abuse prevention and does not directly address child poverty.

Title: Town of Sharpsburg - Parking of Vehicles - Restrictions
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from parking certain vehicles in the Town of Sharpsburg, Washington County, subject to a certain exception.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits parking certain types of vehicles in the Town of Sharpsburg, Washington County, with specific exceptions, and establishes fines for violations.
responsible_party: Town of Sharpsburg, Washington County
stakeholders: Vehicle owners and residents of Sharpsburg
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward regulatory approach to vehicle parking restrictions without employing new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Elections - Election Judges - Minimum Compensation
Synopsis: Establishing a minimum training course compensation of $50 and minimum daily compensation of $250 for election judges for each election day and each early voting day actually served; requiring the State Board of Elections to reimburse each local board elections for $50 of the extra compensation that is paid to each returning election judge; and requiring the State Board to develop and implement a marketing campaign to assist in the recruitment of individuals to serve as election judges.
bill_summary: The bill establishes minimum compensation levels and training reimbursements for election judges in Maryland, including specific rates for different counties, and requires the State Board of Elections to develop a recruitment marketing campaign.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Election judges and voters in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted marketing campaign to recruit diverse election judges and standardizes compensation to improve election administration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on election judge compensation and recruitment.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program and Health Insurance - Required Coverage for Biomarker Testing
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, health maintenance organizations, and managed care organizations to provide coverage for biomarker testing that is supported by medical and scientific evidence; establishing requirements for deductibles, copayments, and coinsurance for biomarker testing; and requiring the Maryland Health Care Commission to report to certain committees of the General Assembly on the impact of providing biomarker testing.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain health insurance providers to cover biomarker testing that is supported by medical and scientific evidence. It establishes rules for coverage, including limits on deductibles and copayments, and sets reporting requirements for the impact of this coverage.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Medicaid recipients, health insurance policyholders, healthcare providers, and patients requiring biomarker testing
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by mandating coverage for biomarker testing supported by scientific evidence, which is a relatively recent development in personalized medicine and healthcare coverage.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve health outcomes and reduce disparities through access to advanced diagnostics, which could indirectly impact child poverty by improving health and economic stability.

Title: Maryland Educator Shortage Reduction Act of 2023
Synopsis: Altering the qualifications for early childhood education teacher certification completed through an alternative teacher preparation program; requiring the State Department of Education, in consultation with the Maryland Higher Education Commission, to establish specific goals for the recruitment and retention of teachers in teacher preparation programs; requiring that "high staff qualifications" for publicly funded eligible prekindergarten providers must be implemented by the 2027-2028 school year; etc.
bill_summary: The Maryland Educator Shortage Reduction Act of 2023 aims to improve teacher recruitment, retention, and diversity through establishing new programs, scholarships, and data dashboards, and by joining the Interstate Teacher Mobility Compact.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Future and current teachers, students in high-need schools, and diverse populations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs new approaches such as a comprehensive dashboard, service obligation scholarships, and interstate licensure agreements to address teacher shortages innovatively.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing qualified teachers in high-need schools and areas.

Title: Real Estate Brokers - Disability or Death and Termination of Employment of a Broker
Synopsis: Requiring an adult family member to submit a death certificate or evidence of disability to the State Real Estate Commission before the family member may carry on the business of a disabled or deceased licensed real estate broker; permitting a certain business to designate a licensed real estate broker to provide real estate brokerage services under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland laws regarding real estate brokers, specifically addressing procedures for family members to carry on a deceased or disabled broker's business, and allows businesses to designate other licensed brokers to continue brokerage services if a broker is terminated or incapacitated.
responsible_party: Maryland State Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Licensed real estate brokers, real estate businesses, and their clients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured process for family members and businesses to designate other licensed brokers to continue real estate services in cases of death, disability, or termination, streamlining continuity of brokerage operations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on regulatory procedures for real estate professionals.

Title: Special Education - Judicial Actions - Attorney's Fees and Related Costs
Synopsis: Authorizing a court to award reasonable attorney's fees and related costs to the parent of a child with a disability who is the prevailing party in a certain special education proceeding; prohibiting a court from awarding attorney's fees and related costs to certain parents in a certain proceeding under certain circumstances; and authorizing an award of attorney's fees and related costs to a parent of a child with a disability who is a prevailing party under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes courts to award attorney's fees and related costs to parents of children with disabilities who prevail in special education disputes, with specific rules about settlement offers and justification for rejecting them.
responsible_party: Office of Administrative Hearings and courts in Maryland
stakeholders: Parents of children with disabilities, children with disabilities, public education agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal process for awarding attorney's fees and costs in special education disputes, including considerations for settlement offers and justification, which is a structured approach to legal disputes in education.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access to fair legal processes in special education, which can support children with disabilities in educational attainment.

Title: Maryland Holocaust Remembrance Day
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to annually proclaim January 27 as Maryland Holocaust Remembrance Day; and requiring the proclamation to include a declaration of the purposes of Maryland Holocaust Remembrance Day.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Governor of Maryland to annually proclaim January 27 as Maryland Holocaust Remembrance Day, emphasizing reflection, education, and a pledge to remember the Holocaust and its lessons.
responsible_party: Governor of Maryland
stakeholders: Maryland residents, educators, religious communities, political bodies, media, and future generations
innovative_summary: The bill primarily establishes a commemorative day and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Maryland Insurance Commissioner Enforcement - Specialty Mental Health Services and Payment of Claims - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Extending the termination date by 2 years for certain provisions of law relating to Maryland Insurance Commissioner enforcement duties regarding administrative services organizations that administer a certain delivery system for specialty mental health services.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for certain enforcement duties of the Maryland Insurance Commissioner related to specialty mental health services and administrative services organizations, from 2 years to 4 years.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Specialty mental health service providers, administrative services organizations, and consumers of mental health services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends existing enforcement authority and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on regulatory enforcement.

Title: Employees' Retirement and Pension Systems - Reemployment Earnings Limitation - COVID-19 Exemption
Synopsis: Exempting a certain retiree of the Employees' Retirement and Pension Systems from a certain earnings limitation when the retiree is reemployed by a certain previous employer for a certain time period to assist with the administration of federally funded grants or projects related to the COVID-19 pandemic; and providing for the retroactive application of the Act to January 1, 2020.
bill_summary: The bill exempts certain retirees of Maryland's Employees’ Retirement and Pension Systems from earnings limitations when reemployed by the Maryland Department of Health for up to 5 years to assist with COVID-19 related grants and projects, retroactively from January 1, 2020, through December 31, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Retirees of Maryland's Employees’ Retirement and Pension Systems, Maryland Department of Health, COVID-19 response efforts
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted exemption for retirees to support COVID-19 response efforts, allowing reemployment without earnings limitations, which is a strategic approach to leveraging experienced personnel during a public health crisis.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but supports COVID-19 response efforts which can indirectly benefit public health and safety.

Title: Video Lottery Employee Licenses - Crimes of Moral Turpitude - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which the State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission is required to disqualify an applicant who committed a crime involving moral turpitude from holding a video lottery employee license.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to change the criteria for disqualifying applicants for video lottery employee licenses, specifically removing gambling offenses from the disqualification criteria and clarifying conditions related to crimes involving moral turpitude.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission
stakeholders: Applicants for video lottery employee licenses, video lottery operation licensees, and the general public interested in gaming integrity
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates licensing rules and disqualification criteria, with no new technology or innovative approach introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Prior Authorizations of State Debt - Alterations
Synopsis: Amending certain prior authorizations of State Debt to alter the requirement that certain grantees provide certain matching funds; extending the termination date of certain grants; altering the authorized uses of certain grants; and changing the names of certain grantees.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes various grants and funding for community development, historic preservation, infrastructure, and public facilities projects across multiple counties in Maryland, extending the duration of these grants until 2030.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, local communities, historic preservation groups, and public facility users
innovative_summary: The bill primarily allocates funding for traditional infrastructure, community, and historic projects without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on community development and infrastructure could indirectly benefit children by improving local resources and environments, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Family Law - Child Care - Criminal Background Investigations
Synopsis: Altering provisions relating to criminal background investigations for certain individuals who care for or supervise children; and requiring certain facilities to apply to the Central Repository for a national and State criminal history records check for each employee, employer, individual, or volunteer.
bill_summary: The bill requires child care facilities and related organizations to conduct criminal background checks on employees, volunteers, and other individuals who care for or have access to children, using both state and federal records. It establishes procedures for applying, submitting fingerprints, and handling the records, and mandates that the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and the Department of Education oversee these processes.
responsible_party: Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and the Department of Education
stakeholders: Children in child care facilities, child care providers, volunteers, and families
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive, technology-driven approach to criminal background checks, integrating federal and state records, and establishing a secure, centralized system for ongoing verification.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to reduce child poverty by ensuring safer child care environments, which can support families' stability and children's well-being.

Title: Locating the New Federal Bureau of Investigation Headquarters in Maryland
Synopsis: Urging the U.S. General Services Administration to select for the new Federal Bureau of Investigation headquarters one of the two finalist sites located in Maryland.
bill_summary: This resolution urges the U.S. General Services Administration to select a site in Maryland, either Greenbelt or Landover, for the new FBI headquarters, emphasizing the benefits of locating the facility in Maryland for security, diversity, and infrastructure reasons.
responsible_party: U.S. General Services Administration and Maryland state government
stakeholders: Maryland residents, Maryland government, FBI employees, local communities in Greenbelt and Landover
innovative_summary: The bill does not introduce new technologies or approaches; it is a political resolution advocating for a specific site location.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it focuses on the location of a federal facility.

Title: Criminal Law - Wearing, Carrying, or Transporting Firearms - Restrictions (Gun Safety Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from knowingly wearing, carrying, or transporting a firearm in certain locations; prohibiting a person from wearing, carrying, or transporting a firearm onto certain property unless the owner or owner's agent has given certain permission; altering certain provisions of law relating to the authority of the Secretary of State Police to limit the wearing, carrying, or transporting of a handgun at certain times and locations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes restrictions on wearing, carrying, or transporting firearms in certain locations, including public places, private property, and areas with specific designations. It also sets rules for permits, training, and enforcement related to firearm possession in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland State Police and local law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, firearm owners, public and private property owners, vulnerable populations, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining restrictions, permit requirements, training, and enforcement to improve firearm safety and reduce gun-related incidents.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by reducing gun violence and increasing safety in vulnerable areas.

Title: Department of Natural Resources – Documents – Digital or Electronic Issuance
Synopsis: Expanding the requirement that the Department of Natural Resources make available and issue certain licenses and stamps in a digital or electronic format; and providing that, if the Department cannot issue certain licenses, stamps, permits, registrations, or certificates in a digital or electronic format because of federal restrictions, it is the intent of the General Assembly that the Department issue certain licenses, stamps, permits, registrations, or certificates in a digital or electronic format whenever the federal restrictions are eliminated.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to make available and issue most of its licenses, stamps, permits, registrations, and certificates in a digital or electronic format, with certain exceptions. It also allows individuals to satisfy requirements by possessing or displaying these documents electronically.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Individuals and entities holding licenses, permits, or certificates issued by the Department of Natural Resources in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill promotes digital transformation by requiring most licenses and permits to be issued electronically, reducing paper use and increasing accessibility.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on administrative and licensing processes.

Title: Department of Transportation - Financing and Commission on Transportation Revenue and Infrastructure Needs (State and Federal Transportation Funding Act)
