Synopsis: Repealing a requirement that the Capital Debt Affordability Committee include certain debt that is secured by future federal aid within its review of State tax supported debt; altering the calculation of the maximum amount of debt secured by future federal aid that the Department of Transportation may issue; providing that the maximum amount of debt that may be issued is calculated as of June 30; establishing the Maryland Commission on Transportation Revenue and Infrastructure Needs; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Maryland Commission on Transportation Revenue and Infrastructure Needs to review and make recommendations on transportation funding, infrastructure, and related policies. It also modifies transportation debt limits and financial forecasting requirements for the Department of Transportation.
responsible_party: Department of Transportation and Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: Transportation agencies, policymakers, and residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive review process and includes recommendations for innovative transportation funding strategies, but does not specify new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving transportation infrastructure and funding, which can enhance access to opportunities.

Title: Property Tax - Exemption for Dwellings of Disabled Veterans - Application
Synopsis: Altering the application requirements for a certain property tax exemption for a dwelling house owned by a disabled veteran or surviving spouse of a disabled veteran by adding a rating decision of the disabled veteran's disability from the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs to the type of supporting documents that may be included with application.
bill_summary: The bill amends the application process and requirements for property tax exemptions for dwellings owned by disabled veterans, active duty service members, and surviving spouses of those who died in the line of duty in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Disabled veterans, active duty service members, surviving spouses of fallen service members, property owners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates application procedures and clarifies eligibility criteria for existing property tax exemptions, without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns property tax exemptions for specific veteran populations.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Expungement of Records (REDEEM Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Providing that any unpaid court fees or costs are not a bar to a certain expungement; requiring a court to waive certain court fees and costs when ordering or effecting a certain expungement; adding malicious destruction of property to the list of misdemeanor convictions that may be expunged; and altering the waiting periods applicable to the filing of petitions for expungement of convictions of certain crimes.
bill_summary: The bill, known as the REDEEM Act of 2023, makes it easier for individuals to have their criminal records expunged by removing barriers such as unpaid court fees, expanding the list of misdemeanors eligible for expungement, and adjusting the waiting periods for filing expungement petitions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Courts and Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Individuals with criminal records seeking expungement, the justice system, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to reform expungement laws, including waiving court fees and expanding eligibility, which is a significant policy innovation in criminal record management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to reduce barriers to employment and housing for individuals with criminal records, which can help alleviate child poverty.

Title: Disaster Service and Uniformed Services Leave Modernization Act of 2023
Synopsis: Adding certain State employees to certain provisions of law authorizing disaster service leave with pay; authorizing certain appointing authorities to waive certain requirements for disaster service leave and to increase the number of days of disaster service leave under certain circumstances; defining "uniformed services" for the purpose of adding certain individuals to certain provisions of law relating to certain paid leave and military administrative leave; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modernizes Maryland's disaster service and uniformed services leave policies for state employees, clarifying definitions, expanding eligible personnel, and increasing leave options and flexibility during emergencies and military duties.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management and State Personnel and Pensions Department
stakeholders: State employees, emergency responders, military personnel, and volunteers involved in disaster and emergency response
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive update to existing leave policies, including expanded definitions, increased leave flexibility, and integration of military and volunteer service considerations, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting the working conditions and leave options of state employees involved in emergency and military service.

Title: Maryland Nonprofit Development Center Program - Nonprofit, Interest-Free, Micro Bridge Loan (NIMBL) Account - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill for fiscal year 2024 or fiscal year 2025 an appropriation of $1,000,000 to the Maryland Nonprofit Development Center Program Fund to be used for loans under the Nonprofit, Interest-Free, Micro Bridge Loan (NIMBL) Account; and repealing a requirement that 5% of proceeds from video lottery terminals go to the NIMBL Account.
bill_summary: The bill establishes funding and program details for the Maryland Nonprofit Development Center's interest-free micro bridge loan program (NIMBL), including budget allocations, fund management, and the source of funding from video lottery terminal proceeds.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations in Maryland, particularly those seeking interest-free loans for operations or development
innovative_summary: The program employs a novel approach by providing interest-free micro bridge loans to nonprofits, funded through a specific allocation from video lottery terminal proceeds, integrating gaming revenue into nonprofit support.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to directly support nonprofit organizations that serve children and families, thereby potentially reducing child poverty.

Title: Property Tax Credit - Public Safety Officer
Synopsis: Repealing the definition of "public safety officer" for purposes of a certain credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on a dwelling owned by a public safety officer; repealing a certain limitation on the amount of the credit; requiring the governing body of a county or municipal corporation that authorizes the credit to establish, by law, the definition of "public safety officer" for purposes of eligibility for the credit; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the existing definition of 'public safety officer' for a property tax credit and requires local governing bodies to define 'public safety officer' by law for the purpose of eligibility for the property tax credit for public safety officers.
responsible_party: County or municipal governing bodies in Maryland
stakeholders: Public safety officers and property owners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a flexible, locally defined approach to determining eligibility for a property tax credit for public safety officers, allowing local governments to tailor the definition and criteria.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns property tax credits for public safety officers.

Title: Clerks of the Circuit Courts - Civil Commissions - Presentation and Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring an appointee for a civil commission to contact the clerk of the circuit court to which the commission was delivered by the Governor to coordinate a time and place for the administration of the oath of office and presentation of the commission; altering the frequency with which the clerk of a circuit court must report to the Secretary of State the name and office of each officer who has taken the oath of office; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates procedures for appointing and reporting civil commission officers in Maryland, including requiring appointees to contact clerks for oath administration and updating reporting requirements to the Secretary of State.
responsible_party: Clerks of the Circuit Courts and the Secretary of State of Maryland
stakeholders: Public officers, clerks of the circuit courts, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates existing legal procedures and reporting requirements; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing on administrative procedures for public officers.

Title: Labor and Employment - Apprenticeship 2030 Commission and Representation on the Apprenticeship and Training Council
Synopsis: Requiring that the Apprenticeship and Training Council and consultants to the Council include representation by individuals who are Asian, Black, and Latino; establishing the Apprenticeship 2030 Commission to examine and make recommendations to expand access to apprenticeships to reduce skill shortages in high-demand occupations and provide affordable training for career pathways for young people; and requiring the Commission to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Apprenticeship 2030 Commission to expand access to apprenticeships, reduce skill shortages, and increase the number of apprenticeships in high-demand sectors, with specific goals for 2030. It also mandates increased diversity representation on the Apprenticeship and Training Council and its consultants.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and the Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: Unemployed and underemployed individuals, high school students, employers, labor organizations, and diverse communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive, multi-stakeholder approach to significantly expand registered apprenticeships, incorporate best practices from other states and countries, and focus on high-demand sectors, with a strong emphasis on diversity and inclusion.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by providing career pathways and skill development opportunities for youth and underemployed populations.

Title: Property Tax - Real Property Tax Assessment and Tax Rate Increases - Notice Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring certain notices relating to increases in property assessments; altering certain notice requirements relating to the intention of a county or municipal corporation to set a certain real property tax rate that exceeds the constant yield tax rate and requiring instead certain notice when a county or municipal corporation intends to increase its real property tax rate.
bill_summary: The bill updates notice requirements for property tax assessment increases and for counties or municipalities planning to set or increase property tax rates above the constant yield tax rate, including public notices and hearings.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Property owners, local governments, and taxpayers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies legal notice procedures and transparency requirements for property tax rate changes, without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, mainly affecting transparency and procedural aspects of property taxation.

Title: Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center - Student FAFSA Data - Reporting Requirement
Synopsis: Altering a reporting requirement to require the Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center to report certain student Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) data to certain committees of the General Assembly on or before December 15 each year, beginning in 2023 and ending in 2028; and requiring the Maryland Higher Education Commission to provide the Center with access to student FAFSA data.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center to report student FAFSA data to legislative committees annually from 2023 to 2028, and mandates the Maryland Higher Education Commission to provide the Center with access to FAFSA data.
responsible_party: Maryland Longitudinal Data System Center and Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Students applying for federal and state financial aid in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs data integration and reporting to improve tracking of student financial aid application behaviors, enhancing data-driven policy making.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by improving access to financial aid information and support for students from low-income families.

Title: State Police Retirement System and Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System - Deferred Retirement Option Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Increasing the maximum number of years of eligibility service that certain members of the State Police Retirement System or Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System may have to participate in the Deferred Retirement Option Program (DROP) from 30 to 32; increasing the number of years that certain members of the State Police Retirement System or Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System may participate in the DROP from 5 to 7; and authorizing certain individuals to elect to extend their participation in the DROP.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum years of eligibility service for members of the State Police Retirement System and Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System to participate in the Deferred Retirement Option Program (DROP), allows certain individuals to extend their participation, and sets specific rules for participation and extension deadlines.
responsible_party: Maryland State Police and Department of State Police
stakeholders: Members of the State Police Retirement System and Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System
innovative_summary: The program introduces an extension option for existing DROP participants, allowing them to extend their participation up to age 60, which is a new approach to retirement planning for law enforcement personnel.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns retirement benefits for law enforcement personnel.

Title: Electricity - Net Energy Metering and Virtual Net Energy Metering - Accrual of Net Excess Generation (Net Metering Flexibility Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain eligible customer-generator to accrue net excess generation for an indefinite period; requiring the Public Service Commission to establish a method for calculating the value of certain accrued net excess generation; and requiring that a subscriber of a community solar energy generating system accrue virtual net excess generation in the same manner as a certain eligible customer-generator.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's net energy metering laws to allow eligible customer-generators to accrue net excess generation indefinitely, modifies billing cycles, and establishes a pilot community solar program with virtual net energy metering.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Electric utility customers, especially those with solar or renewable energy systems, and community solar participants
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a pilot community solar program with virtual net energy metering and allows indefinite accrual of net excess generation, employing new approaches to energy crediting and community solar integration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce energy costs for low-income households through community solar and net metering benefits.

Title: State Board of Social Work Examiners - Conditional Licenses to Practice Social Work
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Social Work Examiners, under certain circumstances, to issue a conditional license to practice social work to an applicant who, except for passing a required examination, has met the appropriate education and experience requirements for a certain license if the required examination was unavailable to the applicant for a period of at least 15 business days; providing that a conditional license is valid until 180 days after the examination becomes readily available to the applicant; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Social Work Examiners to issue conditional and temporary licenses to social workers under certain circumstances, such as administrative delays or unforeseen events that prevent timely examination availability. It establishes rules for the issuance, validity, renewal, and reporting related to these licenses.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Social Work Examiners
stakeholders: Social workers seeking licensure, social work clients, and the public safety in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces a new approach to licensing by allowing conditional and temporary licenses to address delays and emergencies, employing technology for reporting and oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to improve access to social work services by reducing licensing delays, which could help address child poverty indirectly.

Title: Public Health - Mental Health Advance Directives - Awareness and Statewide Database
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to develop and implement a public awareness campaign to encourage the use of mental health advance directives in the State; and requiring the Behavioral Health Administration and the Maryland Health Care Commission jointly to study how first responders and behavioral health crisis providers can access a certain advanced directive database when responding to a behavioral health crisis and to report to certain committees of the General Assembly on their findings on or before December 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to run a public awareness campaign promoting the use of mental health advance directives. It also mandates a study by the Behavioral Health Administration and the Maryland Health Care Commission on establishing a centralized database of mental health advance directives accessible to first responders and behavioral health providers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health, Behavioral Health Administration, Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Individuals with mental health needs, mental health providers, first responders, families, and behavioral health organizations in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill promotes the development of a centralized, accessible database of mental health advance directives and a statewide awareness campaign, employing technology and outreach strategies to improve mental health crisis response.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve mental health crisis response, which can indirectly benefit children in affected families, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Prince George's County - Prince George's County Reentry Employment Incentive Program - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor, for each of fiscal years 2025 through 2028, to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $500,000 to the Prince George's County Office of the County Executive to be used for the Prince George's County Reentry Employment Incentive Program; and requiring that funds made available by the Act are supplemental to, and may not supplant, funds otherwise available for the reentry employment incentives in Prince George's County.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Governor to allocate $500,000 annually from 2025 to 2028 to the Prince George's County Office of the County Executive for the Reentry Employment Incentive Program, supporting employment initiatives for formerly incarcerated individuals.
responsible_party: Maryland Governor's Office and Prince George's County Office of the County Executive
stakeholders: Formerly incarcerated individuals in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted funding to support reentry employment incentives, which is a focused approach but not highly innovative in terms of technology or new methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving employment opportunities for formerly incarcerated individuals, which can positively impact families.

Title: Maryland Aviation Commission - Duties, Composition, and Member Orientation
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Aviation Commission to consider information and advice from certain additional stakeholders when carrying out the Commission's duties; requiring the Commission to consider the aviation, economic, business, environmental, health, and community-related impacts or any other impacts the Commission finds relevant; requiring that certain members of the Commission appointed by the Governor are to be recommended by the Anne Arundel County and Howard County Senate delegations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new policies and requirements for the Maryland Aviation Commission, including stakeholder engagement, member orientation, and annual reporting, to improve airport operations and mitigate negative community impacts.
responsible_party: Maryland Aviation Commission
stakeholders: Local communities near airports, airport industry stakeholders, Maryland residents
innovative_summary: The bill introduces structured stakeholder engagement, mandatory orientation for members, and annual public reporting, which are innovative approaches to airport governance and community impact mitigation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on community impacts and stakeholder engagement may indirectly benefit children in affected communities, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Maryland State Arts Council - Funding
Synopsis: Clarifying the calculation for certain funding for the Maryland State Arts Council for fiscal year 2025 and each fiscal year thereafter; repealing a certain requirement for certain funds distributed to the Maryland State Arts Council to be included in the Council's prior fiscal year appropriation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the calculation method for funding the Maryland State Arts Council from the state's general fund and revenue from the admissions and amusement tax, and repeals a previous requirement related to fund inclusion in prior fiscal year appropriations.
responsible_party: Maryland State Arts Council
stakeholders: Artists, arts organizations, and the general public interested in arts and culture in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates funding calculation rules and repeals a previous requirement; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on arts funding and revenue distribution.

Title: Task Force to Study Crime Classification
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force to Study Crime Classification to study and make recommendations regarding a method for classifying crimes and civil offenses under State law and to identify and logically categorize all crimes and civil offenses that exist under State law; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and General Assembly on or before December 31, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Task Force to Study Crime Classification and Penalties in Maryland, tasked with reviewing and making recommendations on the classification of crimes and civil violations, penalties, and related legal issues.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Legal system, criminal justice system, Maryland residents
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive review and recommendation process for criminal classification and penalties, potentially involving new categorization approaches and legal reforms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing on legal classifications and penalties.

Title: Environment - Statewide Recycling Needs Assessment and Producer Responsibility for Packaging Materials
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "organics recycling" to include the processing of certain compostable packaging materials in a certain manner; requiring the Department of the Environment to approve a single producer responsibility organization to represent the interests of producers by October 1, 2023; establishing a producer responsibility advisory council to provide advice and make recommendations regarding establishing and implementing a producer responsibility program in the State for packaging materials; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a statewide producer responsibility program for packaging materials, requiring producers to submit responsibility plans, and creating an assessment of recycling needs, infrastructure, and environmental impacts. It also sets up a producer responsibility advisory council and a recycling trust fund.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Producers, local governments, recycling facilities, and residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive, modern approach to recycling and waste reduction, including producer responsibility plans, assessments, and incentives, integrating new regulations and oversight mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by improving environmental quality and creating recycling-related jobs, especially in underserved communities.

Title: Criminal Law - Child Pornography - Accessing and Intentionally Viewing
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from knowingly or intentionally accessing and intentionally viewing a certain visual representation of a child under the age of 16 years.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland law to prohibit knowingly accessing and intentionally viewing visual representations of children under 16 that are indistinguishable from real children, including computer-generated images, with specific restrictions and penalties.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Individuals involved in child exploitation crimes, law enforcement, legal system, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs advanced definitions including computer-generated images indistinguishable from real children, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but aims to protect children from exploitation, which can have long-term social benefits.

Title: State Employee and Retiree Health and Welfare Benefits Program – Domestic Partnerships
Synopsis: Establishing that the terms "spouse", "family", "immediate family", "dependent", and any other terms that denote a spousal relationship shall be construed to include a party to a domestic partnership for purposes of the State Employee and Retiree Health and Welfare Benefits Program; and establishing that the provisions of the Program that apply to spouses shall apply to parties who have entered into a domestic partnership.
bill_summary: The bill expands the definition of spousal relationships in Maryland's State Employee and Retiree Health and Welfare Benefits Program to include domestic partnerships, allowing individuals in such partnerships to access the same benefits as spouses.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Budget and Management or equivalent agency responsible for state employee benefits
stakeholders: State employees, retirees, and individuals in domestic partnerships in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill adopts a broader legal recognition of domestic partnerships within state employee benefits, aligning legal and health benefits policies to include non-married, cohabiting partners.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily addresses benefits for adult domestic partners and employees.

Title: Income Tax – Out–of–State Taxes Paid by Pass–Through Entities – Addition Modification
Synopsis: Providing, for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022, an addition modification under the Maryland income tax for the amount of a certain tax credit claimed for certain taxes paid to another state by a pass-through entity under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland income tax law to include a credit for taxes paid to other states by pass-through entities, and clarifies how residents can claim credits for taxes paid to other states, especially those paid by pass-through entities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Residents and pass-through entities in Maryland that pay taxes to other states
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a tax credit mechanism for taxes paid to other states by pass-through entities, which is a new approach to handling multi-state taxation for these entities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on tax law adjustments.

Title: Commercial Law – Abandoned Property – Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller, as Administrator of abandoned property in the State, to determine the value of certain nonmonetary abandoned property; and authorizing the Administrator, if it is determined the property has no commercial value and need not be offered for sale, to return the property to the holder, destroy the property, or dispose of the property.
bill_summary: The bill updates the procedures for the Maryland Comptroller to determine the value of nonmonetary abandoned property, and clarifies the circumstances under which such property can be sold, returned, destroyed, or otherwise disposed of.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Property owners, abandoned property holders, and the general public involved in abandoned property transactions
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a more streamlined process for handling nonmonetary abandoned property, including valuation and disposal procedures, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily deals with abandoned property procedures.

Title: Income Tax - Work Opportunity Tax Credit - Technical Correction
Synopsis: Correcting a certain incorrect cross-reference to the federal Internal Revenue Code relating to the federal work opportunity credit.
bill_summary: This bill corrects a cross-reference in Maryland's tax code related to the federal work opportunity tax credit.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Employers and individuals eligible for the federal work opportunity tax credit in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill makes a technical correction to align state law with federal tax law, which is a standard legal update.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty as it is a technical correction to tax law.

Title: Income Tax - Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering eligibility for the State child and dependent care tax credit; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022.
bill_summary: The bill alters the eligibility criteria and income limits for the Maryland child and dependent care tax credit, including adjustments to income thresholds and refund provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Revenue
stakeholders: Taxpayers in Maryland who claim the child and dependent care tax credit
innovative_summary: The bill makes adjustments to existing tax credit rules, with no new technology or innovative approach introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting tax credit eligibility and refunds.

Title: National Capital Strategic Economic Development Fund - Annual Appropriation and Authorized Uses
Synopsis: Altering the amount of a certain appropriation the Governor is required to make for the National Capital Strategic Economic Development Fund; and repealing a provision of law requiring 100% of the National Capital Strategic Economic Development Fund to be used for community enhancement projects in sustainable communities located, at least in part, within the boundary created by Interstate 495 in the State and the District of Columbia beginning in fiscal year 2024.
bill_summary: The bill increases funding for the National Capital Strategic Economic Development Fund, specifies the annual appropriations from 2021 to 2025, and repeals the requirement that 100% of the fund be used solely for community enhancement projects within certain sustainable communities in Maryland and the District of Columbia.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Communities within Prince George's County and Montgomery County, Maryland, and the District of Columbia
innovative_summary: The bill primarily increases funding and clarifies geographic scope for community development projects, without introducing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on community enhancement projects in specific areas may indirectly benefit children by improving community conditions.

Title: Real Property - Sheriff's Sales - Procedures and Subordinate Interests
Synopsis: Establishing that a sheriff's sale of real property extinguishes subordinate liens on the land being sold; providing that certain provisions of the Act do not impair a lien on land affected by a judgment in favor of a local government for real property maintenance violations or nuisance condition violations that is indexed and recorded in accordance with the Maryland Rules; and authorizing the Judiciary to transfer up to $12,000,000 of a General Fund appropriation to a certain special fund on or before June 30, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill updates procedures related to sheriff's sales of real property, including notice requirements and the extinguishing of subordinate liens upon sale, and authorizes the transfer of funds to improve real property records.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Property owners, lienholders, and the public involved in real estate transactions and sheriff's sales in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill employs updated legal procedures and enhances real property records management, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting property and lien procedures.

Title: Office of the Attorney General - Independent Investigations Division - Authority to Prosecute
Synopsis: Expanding the investigative jurisdiction of the Independent Investigations Division of the Office of the Attorney General to include a police-involved incident resulting in serious bodily injury to an individual that is not otherwise within the jurisdiction of the Division; requiring the Division to submit an annual report on its activities in the prior calendar year to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before January 31; authorizing the Attorney General to prosecute certain criminal matters under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands the authority and jurisdiction of the Independent Investigations Division of the Maryland Office of the Attorney General to investigate police-involved incidents resulting in death or serious injury, and allows the Attorney General to prosecute related criminal cases. It also requires the Division to report annually on its activities.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: Individuals involved in police-involved incidents, law enforcement agencies, the general public
innovative_summary: The bill enhances oversight and investigative powers of the Attorney General's office, including the ability to prosecute criminal cases and employ new investigative tools, which represents a significant strengthening of police accountability mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily focuses on police accountability and investigation procedures, with limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Corrections - Incarcerated Individuals
Synopsis: Altering the term "inmate" to be "incarcerated individual" meaning an individual who is actually or constructively detained or confined in a correctional facility.
bill_summary: The bill changes the terminology used in Maryland law and official documents from 'inmate' to 'incarcerated individual' and requires the correction of related references in the Annotated Code of Maryland.
responsible_party: Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals and legal/administrative entities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates terminology and references in legal documents, which is a standard legal update process, not an innovative program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include specific programs targeting it.

Title: Carroll County - Public Facilities Bond
Synopsis: Authorizing and empowering the County Commissioners of Carroll County to borrow not more than $65,600,000 in order to finance the construction, improvement, or development of certain public facilities in Carroll County, and to effect such borrowing by the issuance and sale at public or private sale of its general obligation bonds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Carroll County to issue up to $65,600,000 in bonds to finance public facilities, water and sewer projects, and fire department facilities, including loans to volunteer fire departments for emergency equipment and facilities.
responsible_party: Carroll County Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents of Carroll County, volunteer fire departments, public facilities users
innovative_summary: The program employs traditional bond financing mechanisms for public infrastructure and emergency services, which are standard government practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily supporting infrastructure and emergency services.

Title: Natural Resources - Black Bear Damage Prevention and Reimbursement Fund - Uses
Synopsis: Altering the Black Bear Damage Reimbursement Fund to authorize grants from the Fund to be made for projects that prevent damages caused by black bears and reduce conflicts between black bears and humans; renaming the Fund to be the Black Bear Damage Prevention and Reimbursement Fund; increasing the maximum amount of reimbursement from the Fund per person annually authorized for damage caused by black bears to $5,000; authorizing the Governor to include at least $50,000 in the annual budget bill for the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Black Bear Conflict Reduction and Damage Prevention and Reimbursement Fund, which provides grants for nonlethal projects to prevent black bear damages and conflicts, and increases reimbursement limits for damages caused by black bears.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Black bears, local communities, farmers, pet owners, and other residents affected by bear conflicts and damages
innovative_summary: The bill promotes proactive, nonlethal conflict prevention measures and supports community-based projects, employing innovative approaches to wildlife conflict mitigation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but may benefit communities by reducing conflicts and damages.

Title: Alcoholic Beverages - Class 4 Limited Winery License - Food Service
Synopsis: Authorizing the holder of a Class 4 limited winery license to prepare, sell, or serve any food under certain conditions; altering certain requirements for off-premises and on-premises consumption at a limited winery; and removing the 14-day notice requirement for certain planned promotional events at a limited winery.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes holders of Class 4 limited winery licenses in Maryland to prepare, sell, and serve certain foods, and makes various adjustments to licensing rules, including food service and promotional event requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Limited winery license holders, consumers, and the Maryland wine industry
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a more flexible food service model for wineries, allowing them to prepare and serve a broader range of foods and host promotional events with fewer restrictions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily pertains to winery licensing and food service regulations.

Title: Washington County - Sheriff's Salary - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the salary of the Washington County Sheriff to be 90% of the salary of the State's Attorney of Washington County; and repealing the requirement for the Washington County Salary Study Commission to study and issue a report that contains recommendations relating to the salary of the Sheriff of Washington County.
bill_summary: The bill alters the salary structure of the Washington County Sheriff, establishing that the Sheriff shall receive 90% of the salary of the Washington County State's Attorney, and repeals the previous requirement for a salary study commission to recommend sheriff's salary.
responsible_party: Washington County government
stakeholders: Residents of Washington County, Washington County officials, and law enforcement agencies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new salary calculation method for the Washington County Sheriff based on a percentage of the State's Attorney's salary, replacing a previous study-based approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it primarily concerns law enforcement salary structures.

Title: Public Safety - Law Enforcement - Body-Worn Cameras (Body-Worn Camera Appropriation and Financing Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of General Services, in coordination with the Department of Information Technology, to negotiate certain contracts with third parties for the acquisition or maintenance of body-worn cameras, equipment, or technology for certain law enforcement agencies; requiring the Department of Information Technology, in coordination with the Department of General Services, to study the cost and feasibility of implementing a statewide uniform storage and access system for law enforcement body-worn camera data; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of General Services, in coordination with the Department of Information Technology, to negotiate contracts for acquiring and maintaining body-worn cameras and related equipment for law enforcement agencies. It also mandates a study on the cost and feasibility of implementing a statewide uniform storage and access system for body-worn camera data, with a report due by December 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Department of General Services and Department of Information Technology
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies and the public served by law enforcement in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a coordinated approach to procurement and data management for body-worn cameras, including a study on a statewide storage system, which is a relatively innovative approach to standardizing and securing law enforcement data.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on law enforcement technology and data management.

Title: Baltimore City – West North Avenue Development Authority – Membership and Procurement
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the West North Avenue Development Authority; exempting the Authority from certain provisions of State procurement law; and altering the report on the Authority's comprehensive neighborhood revitalization strategy the Authority is required to submit to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly to be due by December 15, 2023, to include any procurement activities undertaken by the Authority, and to be also submitted to the House Health and Government Operations Committee.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the West North Avenue Development Authority in Baltimore City, modifies its membership, reporting requirements, and procurement exemptions, and sets its operational timeline until September 30, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Economic Development and related agencies
stakeholders: Residents and communities impacted by the West North Avenue target area in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized development authority with procurement exemptions and community-based membership, employing a targeted approach to neighborhood revitalization.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to directly impact child poverty by revitalizing neighborhoods and improving community resources.

Title: Maryland Achieving a Better Life Experience (ABLE) Program - Account Establishment - Procedures
Synopsis: Establishing certain procedures regarding the persons who may establish or receive distributions from an ABLE account in the Maryland ABLE Program for a certain eligible individual; and requiring the Maryland 529 Board to adopt certain procedures regarding the establishment and operation of an ABLE account by a person other than a certain designated beneficiary.
bill_summary: The bill establishes procedures for the Maryland ABLE Program, including rules for establishing and operating ABLE accounts by individuals other than the designated beneficiary, and clarifies who can establish an account for an eligible individual.
responsible_party: Maryland 529 Board
stakeholders: Eligible individuals with disabilities and their families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces procedures for third-party establishment and operation of ABLE accounts, which is a new approach to managing these accounts in Maryland.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve financial stability for individuals with disabilities, which can indirectly impact child poverty.

Title: Maryland Legal Services Corporation - Affordable Life, Wills, and Estate Planning for Seniors Grant Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Affordable Life, Wills, and Estate Planning for Seniors Grant Program in the Maryland Legal Services Corporation to provide eligible seniors access to affordable civil law-related services; and requiring the Governor to provide an appropriation of $225,000 in the annual budget for the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Affordable Life, Wills, and Estate Planning for Seniors Grant Program within the Maryland Legal Services Corporation to provide legal services to seniors, including wills, powers of attorney, trusts, and health directives, especially targeting rural communities.
responsible_party: Maryland Legal Services Corporation
stakeholders: Seniors aged 65 and older with limited income, especially in rural communities
innovative_summary: The program employs outreach, referral hotlines, and contracts with grantees to deliver legal services to seniors, including targeted efforts in rural areas.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty indirectly by supporting seniors, but its direct impact on child poverty is limited.

Title: Certified Community Behavioral Health Clinics - Planning Grant Funds and Demonstration Application
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to apply to the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration at the Center for Mental Health Services for federal planning, development, and implementation grant funds related to certified community behavioral health clinics for fiscal year 2025; and requiring the Department to apply to the Administration for inclusion in the state certified community behavioral health clinic demonstration program for fiscal year 2026.
bill_summary: The bill directs the Maryland Department of Health to apply for federal planning and demonstration grant funds to establish and operate certified community behavioral health clinics, which provide comprehensive mental health and substance use services, starting in fiscal year 2025 and 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with mental health or substance use needs in Maryland, including veterans and military service members
innovative_summary: The bill proposes establishing certified community behavioral health clinics with a bundled payment system and quality incentives, employing federal certification standards and innovative payment models.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve mental health and substance use treatment access, which can contribute to reducing child poverty indirectly.

Title: Baltimore City - Commercial Use - Definition
Synopsis: Defining "commercial use" in Baltimore City to include multifamily residential development if the development is located within a waterfront commercial zoning district and within a 0.50-mile radius of a commuter rail station.
bill_summary: The bill redefines 'commercial use' in Baltimore City to include certain multifamily residential developments located within a waterfront commercial zoning district and within 0.5 miles of a commuter rail station.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Zoning Department or relevant local zoning authority
stakeholders: Residents, developers, and businesses in Baltimore City, especially those near waterfronts and transit stations
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted geographic and land use approach to define commercial use, potentially encouraging development in strategic waterfront and transit areas.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on land use and zoning.

Title: State Board of Physicians – Inactive and Emeritus Status
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Physicians to place a licensee on emeritus status under certain circumstances; requiring the Board, under certain circumstances, to reinstate the license of an individual who is on inactive or emeritus status; exempting licensees who are on inactive status or emeritus status from continuing medical education requirements; repealing the requirement that the Board issue a license to an individual who is on inactive status under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Physicians to place physicians on emeritus status, establish rules for inactive status, and clarifies restrictions on practicing medicine and using medical titles for licensees on inactive or emeritus status. It also sets conditions for reinstatement of licenses and defines the scope of practice and representation for such licensees.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Physicians
stakeholders: Physicians licensed in Maryland, especially those on inactive or emeritus status
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal emeritus status for physicians, providing a structured pathway for retirement while maintaining a connection to the medical community, and clarifies legal and practice boundaries for these licensees.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on licensing and practice regulations for physicians.

Title: Workers' Compensation - Benefits - Offset and Study
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which the payment of a benefit by a governmental unit or quasi-public corporation to a covered employee offsets the liability for benefits under the workers' compensation law; and stating that it is the intent of the General Assembly that the Maryland Association of Counties and the Professional Fire Fighters of Maryland jointly research and report data and analysis on the effects of the Act by December 1, 2024, to interested parties and certain committees of the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland's workers' compensation law to clarify how benefits paid by government entities offset other benefits, considers tinnitus as part of hearing loss, and mandates an evaluation of the impact of these changes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor or Workers' Compensation Commission
stakeholders: Covered employees, fire fighters, military personnel, and dependents in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive review and reporting approach to assess the impact of legal changes on workers' compensation benefits, including research by relevant associations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may indirectly benefit families of covered workers through improved benefits.

Title: Economic Development - Upper Shore Regional Council - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of certain voting and nonvoting members of the Upper Shore Regional Council.
bill_summary: This bill amends the membership structure of the Upper Shore Regional Council, changing the composition of voting and nonvoting members, including county officials, municipal officials, and members of the General Assembly.
responsible_party: Upper Shore Regional Council
stakeholders: County officials, municipal officials, and residents of the Upper Shore region
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates governance structure; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs targeting it.

Title: Prince George's County - Judges of the Orphans' Court - Compensation
Synopsis: Authorizing the County Executive and County Council of Prince George's County to determine the compensation for the judges of the Orphans' Court for Prince George's County.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Prince George's County government to determine the compensation for judges of the Orphans' Court, replacing fixed salaries with a system where the County Executive and County Council set the annual pay.
responsible_party: Prince George's County government (County Executive and County Council)
stakeholders: Judges of the Orphans' Court in Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a local government authority to set judicial compensation, replacing fixed salaries with a flexible, locally determined pay structure.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Commission to Advance and Strengthen Fire Fighting and Emergency Medical Services Within Maryland
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission to Advance and Strengthen Fire Fighting and Emergency Medical Services Within Maryland to study and make recommendations regarding the effectiveness and viability of certain incentives, offerings, or practices employed in other states to attract, support, and retain individuals in fire fighting and emergency medical services roles; and requiring the Commission to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Commission to study and recommend ways to improve recruitment and retention of fire fighting and emergency medical services personnel in Maryland, including evaluating incentives used in other states.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Firefighters, emergency medical services personnel, volunteer and career fire companies, Maryland residents
innovative_summary: The bill proposes creating a commission to analyze and recommend incentive programs, which is a strategic approach to addressing workforce shortages in emergency services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve emergency services, which can indirectly benefit children by improving safety and response times.

Title: University System of Maryland - Board of Regents - Quasi-Endowment Funds
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of Regents of the University System of Maryland to make transfers of not more than $150,000,000 subject to certain conditions to establish quasi-endowment funds; and authorizing the Board to use investment income produced by quasi-endowment funds in accordance with the University System of Maryland Policy on Endowment Fund Spending Rule to provide need-based student financial aid.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the University System of Maryland's Board of Regents to establish quasi-endowment funds by transferring up to $150 million from fund balances held by the State Treasurer. The investment income from these funds can be used to support need-based student financial aid and facility renewal projects. The bill also requires annual reporting on investment performance.
responsible_party: University System of Maryland, Board of Regents
stakeholders: Students of the University System of Maryland, especially those requiring need-based financial aid
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new quasi-endowment fund structure that allows the university to leverage investment income for student aid and capital projects, representing a strategic financial approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to higher education through need-based financial aid.

Title: Business Regulation - Home Improvement Commission - Guaranty Fund and Award Limits
Synopsis: Increasing the funding level of the Home Improvement Guaranty Fund that is administered by the Home Improvement Commission from $250,000 to $1,000,000; increasing a certain Fund threshold that determines whether a fee is assessed to each contractor; and increasing the limit, from $100,000 to $250,000, on the amount of money the Commission may award from the Fund to all claimants for the acts or omissions of a single contractor, subject to a certain reimbursement to the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill increases the funding level and award limits of the Maryland Home Improvement Guaranty Fund, modifies fee assessments for contractors, and updates rules for claims and reimbursements related to home improvement disputes.
responsible_party: Maryland Home Improvement Commission
stakeholders: Homeowners, contractors, and claimants involved in home improvement disputes in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program primarily involves regulatory updates and funding adjustments; it does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Natural Resources - Restorative Aquaculture Pilot Program
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources to establish a Restorative Aquaculture Pilot Program to provide financial incentives to holders of aquaculture leases who maintain the lease in accordance with certain criteria, maintain the restorative conditions for at least 4 years, and meet certain other criteria the Department considers necessary; authorizing a holder of an aquaculture lease who is participating in the Pilot Program to meet certain requirements by shellfish seed planting only; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Restorative Aquaculture Pilot Program in Maryland to provide financial incentives to aquaculture leaseholders who engage in shellfish planting and meet certain environmental and operational criteria, aiming to benefit water quality and habitat.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Aquaculture leaseholders, environmental agencies, local communities, and water quality stakeholders
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted financial incentive approach for restorative aquaculture activities, with specific criteria and metrics for environmental benefits, and includes a pilot phase with regulatory oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on environmental restoration and aquaculture.

Title: Economic Development – Sports Entertainment Facilities – Financing and Construction
Synopsis: Altering the amount of taxable or tax exempt bonds that the Maryland Stadium Authority may issue for certain sports entertainment facilities from $200,000,000 to $220,000,000; altering the entities from which the Authority is required to have received a request for financing and construction management services concerning a sports entertainment facility; altering the entities with which the Authority is required to enter into an agreement before issuing bonds to finance a sports entertainment facility; etc.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum amount of bonds that can be issued for sports entertainment facilities from $200 million to $220 million, and clarifies the requirements for financing, including requests and agreements with relevant entities. It also specifies reporting requirements for the maintenance and repair of these facilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Stadium Authority
stakeholders: Sports entertainment facilities, local governments, nonprofit organizations, and the general public interested in sports and entertainment infrastructure
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates financial limits and procedural requirements for sports entertainment facility projects, with no significant use of new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on infrastructure financing and management.

Title: Alcoholic Beverages – Manufacturer’s Licenses and Off–Site Permits
Synopsis: Extending the termination date, to June 30, 2024, for provisions relating to the authorization of holders of certain manufacturer's licenses to sell and deliver and to directly ship their own alcoholic beverages products to certain individuals under certain circumstances; establishing the maximum amount of beer and liquor that holders of certain manufacturer's licenses may directly ship to consumers in a calendar year; delaying the effective date for the authorization of certain manufacturer off-site permits to July 1, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill extends the expiration date of certain laws allowing manufacturer license holders to sell, deliver, and ship alcoholic beverages directly to consumers, sets limits on the amount of alcohol that can be shipped annually, and delays the implementation of certain off-site permit authorizations.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcohol and Tobacco Commission
stakeholders: Alcohol manufacturers, consumers, and retailers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a regulated direct shipping program for alcohol manufacturers, including annual shipment limits and reporting requirements, which is a relatively new approach to alcohol distribution regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily regulates alcohol sales and shipping.

Title: Film Production Activity Income Tax Credit - Alterations and Maryland Entertainment Council
Synopsis: Expanding eligibility for the credit against the State income tax for certain film production activities to include documentaries and talk, reality, and game shows; increasing the percentage of total direct costs that qualify for the tax credit; increasing the aggregate amount of tax credit certificates that the Secretary of Commerce may issue for fiscal years 2024 through 2026; establishing the Maryland Entertainment Council to study and make recommendations regarding Maryland's film, television, and entertainment industry; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands Maryland's film production tax credit to include documentaries and talk, reality, and game shows, increases the percentage of costs eligible for the credit, and establishes the Maryland Entertainment Council to study and promote the industry. It also sets program start and end years, and allocates funding for the tax credits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Film, television, and entertainment industry professionals and related businesses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill creates a new state entertainment council to develop a strategic plan for Maryland's entertainment industry and encourages the use of emerging technologies and independent film entities, representing a modern approach to industry development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by promoting industry growth and job creation in Maryland.

Title: St. Mary's County - Public Facilities Bond
Synopsis: Authorizing and empowering the County Commissioners of St. Mary's County, from time to time, to borrow not more than $56,000,000 in order to finance the construction, improvement, or development of certain public facilities in St. Mary's County, and to effect such borrowing by the issuance and sale at public or private sale of its general obligation bonds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes St. Mary's County to borrow up to $56 million through bonds to finance the construction and improvement of various public facilities, including schools, roads, parks, and public safety buildings, and to levy taxes to repay the bonds.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Government
stakeholders: Residents of St. Mary's County, including children, families, and local communities benefiting from public facilities
innovative_summary: The program employs traditional bond financing methods for public infrastructure development, with no new or innovative technologies or approaches specified.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve public facilities that can benefit children and families, thereby potentially reducing child poverty indirectly.

Title: Task Force to Study Solar Incentives
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force to Study Solar Incentives to study the types and impact of solar energy incentives and make recommendations regarding measures and incentives needed to ensure that the State meets the solar energy goals established in the State's renewable energy portfolio standard, minority business participation, the creation of good quality jobs, equitable access to renewable energy, and efficient use of land; and requiring the Task Force to submit its report to the General Assembly on or before December 15, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Task Force to Study Solar Incentives in Maryland, tasked with analyzing current solar incentives, federal incentives, and land use for solar development, and making recommendations to meet renewable energy goals.
responsible_party: Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Solar energy industry, environmental groups, local governments, minority business enterprises, residents, and land developers in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive study approach to optimize solar incentives, land use, and equitable access, integrating federal and state policies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to improve access to renewable energy and create jobs, which could help reduce child poverty.

Title: Natural Resources - Land Conservation - Establishment of Goals and Programs (Maryland the Beautiful Act)
Synopsis: Establishing certain goals and programs related to land conservation; establishing the Local Land Trust Revolving Loan Program to provide loans to land trusts to purchase land for conservation purposes; authorizing the Maryland Environmental Trust to exercise certain remedies under certain circumstances; prohibiting a person from making any false statements affecting a Local Land Trust Revolving Loan Program loan; establishing the 40 x 40 Land Conservation Implementation Grant Program to support land conservation goals; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes land conservation goals and programs in Maryland, including a land trust revolving loan program, grants for land stewardship and conservation, and a 40x40 land conservation initiative aiming to conserve 30% of land by 2030 and 40% by 2040.
responsible_party: Maryland Environmental Trust
stakeholders: Land trusts, local governments, conservation organizations, and communities involved in land conservation and environmental stewardship.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining revolving loans, grants, and conservation goals, with a focus on large-scale landscape conservation and community engagement, integrating financial mechanisms and strategic planning.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to impact child poverty indirectly through community engagement and environmental benefits, but does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Sediment Control Plans, Discharge Permits for Stormwater Associated With Construction Activity, and Notice and Comment Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment to review and update specifications for sediment control plans in a certain manner on or before December 1, 2025, and every 5 years thereafter; prohibiting the Department from authorizing the discharge of stormwater associated with construction activity under a general discharge permit unless certain requirements are satisfied; and requiring the Department to take certain public notice and comment actions if a person makes a written request within the public notification period of the permit.
bill_summary: The bill updates regulations on sediment control plans and stormwater discharge permits for construction activities in Maryland. It requires the Department of the Environment to review and update sediment control specifications periodically, restricts the use of general permits for large or sensitive construction sites unless certain conditions are met, and enhances enforcement and public notice procedures.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Construction companies, environmental groups, local governments, and communities near construction sites
innovative_summary: The bill employs a proactive approach by requiring periodic updates to sediment control standards based on recent data and stakeholder consultation, and enhances public participation and enforcement mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on environmental regulation and enforcement.

Title: Charles County - Task Force to Study School Bus Operator Contracts and Wages
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force to Study School Bus Operator Contracts and Wages in Charles County; requiring the Task Force to study issues related to student transportation, bus driver wages, and multiyear contracts for bus contractors in Charles County and to research best practices in surrounding jurisdictions related to the facilitation of student transportation; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the members of the Charles County Delegation to the General Assembly on or before September 1, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a task force to study school bus operator contracts and wages in Charles County, and considers the Charles County Board of Education as a joint employer of certain school bus contractor employees for wages, benefits, and workplace policies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: School bus contractors, bus drivers, Charles County public school students, and employees involved in school transportation
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative approach by establishing a dedicated task force to study and recommend improvements in school bus transportation and employment practices, integrating stakeholder input and best practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve wages and working conditions for bus drivers, which could directly impact child poverty by improving employment stability and income for workers involved in school transportation.

Title: Local Procurements - Minority Business Enterprise Utilization Programs - Certification
Synopsis: Requiring that a county or municipality that operates a minority business enterprise utilization program for county or municipal procurements and has a process for the certification of minority business enterprises shall accept as certified a person that holds a certification as a minority business enterprise by the State certification agency.
bill_summary: The bill requires counties and municipalities in Maryland that operate minority business enterprise programs to accept certifications from the state certification agency, streamlining the certification process for minority businesses.
responsible_party: Maryland State Certification Agency and local governments
stakeholders: Minority business enterprises and local government procurement programs
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes certification acceptance across local governments, reducing redundancy and streamlining certification processes for minority businesses.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing on business certification and procurement processes.

Title: Port of Deposit State Historical Park - Planning
Synopsis: Altering composition of the stakeholder advisory committee to advise the Department of Natural Resources on the scope and management of Port of Deposit State Historical Park; requiring the Department to make a certain report to the General Assembly on or before September 1, 2024; extending the deadline for the Bainbridge Development Corporation to transfer certain property to the Department to June 1, 2025; authorizing the Governor to include in the State budget an appropriation of at least $400,000 for certain purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Port of Deposit State Historical Park as a partnership park focused on educating the public about Black American history and preserving archaeological sites, including transferring property from the Bainbridge Development Corporation to the Department of Natural Resources, and creating a stakeholder advisory committee.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Public, local community, historians, archaeologists, and residents of Cecil County
innovative_summary: The program employs a collaborative partnership approach with a stakeholder advisory committee and archaeological surveys, integrating historical preservation with community engagement and archaeological research.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but contributes to community development and education.

Title: Fire, Rescue, or Emergency Medical Services Entities - Peer Support Programs
Synopsis: Altering the defined term "peer support counseling program" for peer services offered to fire, rescue, or emergency medical services members to be "peer support program"; and requiring peer support programs to be evidence-based.
bill_summary: The bill updates the terminology and requirements for peer support programs for fire, rescue, and emergency medical services members in Maryland. It mandates the development of best practices, standards, and training guidelines for these programs, and requires a report and public dissemination of information related to peer support specialists.
responsible_party: Behavioral Health Administration in collaboration with the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems
stakeholders: Fire, rescue, and emergency medical services members in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill promotes evidence-based peer support programs and establishes standards and best practices, integrating mental health support into emergency services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve mental health support for emergency responders, which can indirectly benefit children by improving overall family and community well-being.

Title: Insurance – Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund – Assessments
Synopsis: Altering the formula for the calculation of certain assessments by the Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund; requiring the Board of Trustees of the Fund, under certain circumstances, to authorize the Fund to withdraw certain amounts from the money held by the Fund from a prior overassessment; prohibiting members of the Industry Automobile Insurance Association from being subject to an annual assessment under certain circumstances; requiring in a certain fiscal year that additional funds be allocated to the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the assessment process and funding allocations for the Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund, including rules for withdrawing funds from overassessment accounts, assessment calculations, and allocations of penalties, with the aim of improving the fund's financial management.
responsible_party: Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund and its Board of Trustees
stakeholders: Auto insurance companies, policyholders, and uninsured motorists in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a detailed financial management approach for the insurance fund, including specific rules for fund assessments, withdrawals, and allocations, but does not introduce new technologies or radically new approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on insurance fund management does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Preserve Telehealth Access Act of 2023
Synopsis: Extending to June 30, 2025, the inclusion of certain audio-only telephone conversations under the definition of "telehealth" for the purpose of certain provisions of law relating to reimbursement and coverage of telehealth by the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations; requiring the Maryland Medical Health Care Commission to study and make recommendations regarding the delivery of health care services through telehealth by December 1, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The Preserve Telehealth Access Act of 2023 extends the inclusion of audio-only telephone conversations as a form of telehealth for reimbursement and coverage purposes until 2025, and requires a study on telehealth delivery and payment parity by the Maryland Health Care Commission.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Patients, healthcare providers, insurers, and health plans in Maryland
