innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to telehealth, including audio-only services, and mandates a study to evaluate delivery methods and payment models, which is a relatively innovative approach to telehealth policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to improve access to healthcare for underserved populations, including children, by expanding telehealth services and ensuring reimbursement parity.

Title: Video Lottery Operation License - Renewal
Synopsis: Altering the number of years before the end of the term of a video lottery operation license that a licensee is required to provide certain notice of intent to renew the license and is authorized to apply for renewal; providing for the term of a renewed license; requiring the State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission to renew a certain license unless the Commission makes a certain finding; requiring the Commission, under certain circumstances, to provide a licensee a certain hearing; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates the rules for renewing video lottery operation licenses in Maryland, including notice periods, application processes, fees, and the distribution of proceeds from video lottery terminals, with a focus on renewal procedures and financial allocations.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission
stakeholders: Video lottery licensees, Maryland state education fund, and the general public benefiting from education funding
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured renewal process for video lottery licenses, including fee payments and distribution of proceeds to education, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty through increased funding to the Education Trust Fund from lottery proceeds.

Title: Human Relations - Civil Rights Enforcement - Powers of the Attorney General
Synopsis: Authorizing the Attorney General to investigate, prosecute, and remediate certain civil rights violations under certain circumstances and in a certain manner; authorizing the Attorney General to intervene in certain causes of action under certain circumstances; establishing certain penalties and authorizing the Attorney General to obtain certain relief in certain civil actions, conciliation agreements, and settlement agreements; authorizing the Attorney General to recover certain investigation and litigation costs in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Attorney General to investigate, prosecute, and remediate civil rights violations, establish a Civil Rights Enforcement Fund, and coordinate efforts with the Maryland Commission on Civil Rights.
responsible_party: Office of the Maryland Attorney General
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, civil rights organizations, and individuals affected by discrimination
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a dedicated enforcement mechanism and a specialized fund to support civil rights enforcement and community outreach, employing a coordinated government approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by addressing discrimination and promoting equal rights, which can improve economic opportunities for affected families.

Title: Towing or Removal of Vehicles - Reclamation Hours
Synopsis: Limiting, to at a minimum from 6 a.m. to midnight, the hours during which a certain person in possession of a vehicle that has been towed or removed from a parking lot is required to provide an opportunity for the vehicle owner or the owner's agent to retake possession of the vehicle; and altering a certain signage requirement imposed on the owner or operator of a parking lot relating to hours during which a towed vehicle may be reclaimed.
bill_summary: The bill limits the hours during which vehicle owners or their agents can reclaim towed vehicles to between 6 a.m. and midnight, 7 days a week, and requires signage to reflect this. It also mandates that vehicles be immediately delivered to a specified storage facility and not moved for at least 72 hours.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or relevant parking authorities
stakeholders: Vehicle owners, parking lot operators, towing companies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes and restricts the hours for vehicle reclamation after towing, improving transparency and consumer rights, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on towing regulations.

Title: Department of Service and Civic Innovation and Maryland Corps Program Service Year Option Pathways - Established (Serving Every Region Through Vocational Exploration Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Establishing the Department of Service and Civic Innovation; providing that the purpose of the Department is to promote service and volunteerism in the State; establishing the Secretary of Service and Civic Innovation and the duties and responsibilities of the Secretary; altering the provisions of the Maryland Corps Program, including requiring the Department to administer the Program; establishing the Young Adult Service Year Option Pathway Fund; providing for the purposes, use, administration, and contents of the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Department of Service and Civic Innovation, creates the Maryland Corps Program with two pathways (Young Adult Service Year and Service Year Option), and sets up related funds, advisory boards, and evaluation mechanisms to promote service, volunteerism, and workforce development in Maryland.
responsible_party: Department of Service and Civic Innovation
stakeholders: Recent high school graduates, young adults, community organizations, state and local government agencies, and underserved populations in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach integrating service programs with workforce development, funding mechanisms, and independent evaluations, leveraging technology for program management and data transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by providing service opportunities, education support, and workforce pathways for youth and young adults, especially those underrepresented.

Title: Maryland National Guard - Tricare Premium Reimbursement Program - Establishment (Health Care for Heroes Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Establishing the Tricare Premium Reimbursement Program in the Military Department for the Department to award grants to reimburse certain members of the National Guard for the cost of premiums for certain health care and dental care plans; and requiring the Department to adopt regulations to administer and implement the program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Tricare Premium Reimbursement Program in Maryland to reimburse eligible National Guard members and their families for part of their health and dental insurance premiums.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Military
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland National Guard and their immediate families
innovative_summary: The program employs a straightforward reimbursement approach to support military families' healthcare costs, which is a common method but tailored for this specific group.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could indirectly benefit children in military families by reducing financial burdens related to healthcare.

Title: Fair Wage Act of 2023
Synopsis: Increasing the State minimum wage rate; repealing the authority of the Board of Public Works to temporarily suspend an increase in the minimum wage rate; and repealing the requirement that the Governor's budgets for certain fiscal years include certain provider rate increases.
bill_summary: The bill increases the Maryland minimum wage based on inflation and annual growth, and adjusts reimbursement rates for community service providers and health care providers, while also establishing a rate-setting study and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Community service providers, health care providers, employees, and individuals receiving services
innovative_summary: The bill employs a data-driven, inflation-adjusted approach to setting minimum wages and provider reimbursement rates, including a comprehensive rate-setting study and annual reporting.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by increasing wages and improving service funding.

Title: Recovery Residence Grant Program – Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Recovery Residence Grant Program within the Maryland Department of Health to award competitive grants to recovery residences to support operations, services, and programs; requiring the Department to establish certain procedures; requiring the annual budget bill to include $500,000 for the Program in each of fiscal years 2024 through 2027; and requiring the Department to submit an annual report to the Governor and General Assembly about the number of grants and the program's grant recipients by December 1, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Recovery Residence Grant Program within the Maryland Department of Health to provide grants to recovery residences that support individuals with substance use and mental health disorders, focusing on certified, nonprofit recovery residences.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Recovery residences, individuals with substance use and mental health disorders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a structured grant process to support certified recovery residences, integrating peer support services and strict sobriety policies, which is a comprehensive approach to supporting recovery housing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by supporting stable recovery environments for individuals, which can positively impact families and children.

Title: Education - Maryland Meals for Achievement In-Classroom Breakfast Program - Annual Appropriation
Synopsis: Increasing the appropriation required by the Governor in the annual budget bill for the Maryland Meals for Achievement In-Classroom Breakfast Program from $7,550,000 to $12,050,000.
bill_summary: The bill increases the annual appropriation for the Maryland Meals for Achievement In–Classroom Breakfast Program from $7,550,000 to $12,050,000, supporting funding for in-classroom breakfast programs in schools.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Students in Maryland schools, particularly those benefiting from in-classroom breakfast programs
innovative_summary: The bill primarily increases funding for an existing school breakfast program; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing access to nutritious breakfast, which can improve student well-being and academic performance.

Title: Goodwill Industries of Chesapeake Excel Center in Baltimore City - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the name of a recipient from the Goodwill Excel Center to the Goodwill Industries of Chesapeake Excel Center in Baltimore City; and requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $500,000 to the Goodwill Industries of Chesapeake Excel Center in Baltimore City for each of fiscal years 2024 and 2025.
bill_summary: The bill allocates $500,000 annually for fiscal years 2024 and 2025 to the Goodwill Industries of Chesapeake Excel Center in Baltimore City, and changes the name of the recipient organization.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government (Governor's Office and Budget Department)
stakeholders: Participants of the Goodwill Industries of Chesapeake Excel Center in Baltimore City, including job training and education program attendees
innovative_summary: The bill primarily involves funding allocation and organizational name change; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by supporting workforce development and education for community members.

Title: Residential Property - Service Agreements - Prohibitions
Synopsis: Prohibiting certain service agreement for maintenance, purchase, or sale of residential property from containing certain provisions; and prohibiting the recordation of service agreements prohibited under the Act.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits exclusive listing agreements for residential property from being effective for more than one year, and restricts certain service agreements related to residential property from containing specific provisions, including being effective for more than one year. It also requires the Maryland Real Estate Commission to include an assessment of the use and impact of exclusive listing agreements in its annual report.
responsible_party: Maryland Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Real estate agents, property owners, and consumers involved in residential property transactions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces restrictions on the duration of exclusive listing agreements and service agreements for residential property, and mandates an assessment of their impact, which is a new regulatory approach in Maryland.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is likely minimal, as it primarily regulates real estate agreements and industry practices.

Title: Behavioral Health Care Coordination Value-Based Purchasing Pilot Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Behavioral Health Value-Based Purchasing Pilot Program in the Maryland Department of Health to establish and implement an intensive care coordination model using value-based purchasing in the specialty behavioral health system; requiring the Governor, for fiscal years 2025 through 2027, to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $600,000 for the Pilot Program; and requiring the Department to report by November 1, 2027 on the findings and recommendations from the Pilot Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a three-year pilot program in Maryland to improve behavioral health care through intensive care coordination and value-based purchasing, aiming to reduce hospital emergency visits and inpatient admissions among at-risk adults.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Adults with behavioral health conditions at risk of hospital utilization in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by integrating value-based purchasing with intensive care coordination in behavioral health, utilizing electronic health records and data exchange.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving behavioral health outcomes, but its direct impact is moderate.

Title: Public Health - Parkinson's Disease - Advisory Committee and Website
Synopsis: Altering the duties of the Parkinson's Disease Registry Advisory Committee; requiring the Committee to meet quarterly beginning on July 1, 2023; requiring the Maryland Department of Health, in collaboration with the State-designated health information exchange, to establish and maintain a website with certain information related to Parkinson's disease by October 1, 2023; and requiring the Committee to report to certain committees of the General Assembly on recommendations for establishing a fully functional State Parkinson's Disease Registry.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Maryland Parkinson's Disease Advisory Committee, creates a Parkinson's Disease Registry, and requires the Department of Health to collect, maintain, and share data related to Parkinson's disease and Parkinsonisms. It also mandates the creation of a public website with epidemiological data and sets rules for confidentiality and reporting.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals diagnosed with Parkinson's disease and Parkinsonisms, healthcare providers, researchers, and the general public in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive data collection and sharing system, including a public website with detailed epidemiological data, and establishes a formal advisory committee to guide the registry, representing a modern approach to disease surveillance and public health transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily focuses on disease data collection and public awareness.

Title: Labor and Employment - Noncompete and Conflict of Interest Provisions - Application of Prohibition
Synopsis: Altering the application of the prohibition on including a noncompete or conflict of interest provision in an employment contract or similar document or agreement that restricts the ability of an employee to enter into employment with a new employer or to become self-employed in the same or similar business or trade.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits noncompete and conflict of interest provisions in employment contracts for employees earning up to 150% of the state minimum wage, making such provisions null and void.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Employees earning up to 150% of the minimum wage, employers, legal professionals
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal restriction on noncompete clauses for a broad range of employees, aligning employment law with public policy to protect workers' mobility.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to improve economic mobility for low- to moderate-income workers, which could help reduce child poverty indirectly.

Title: Surplus Military Equipment Reporting - Extension
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of State Police to submit a report to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before February 1 each year relating to the acquisition of equipment by law enforcement agencies through surplus programs; and requiring the Department of State Police to include on its public website in a prominent location a link to a certain report.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of State Police to annually report on law enforcement agencies' acquisition of surplus military equipment and to publish a link to a federal report on excess Department of Defense property transfers on its website.
responsible_party: Department of State Police
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill enhances transparency by requiring the department to publish reports and links to federal surplus equipment transfers online.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Primary and Secondary Education - Virtual Education
Synopsis: Requiring a teacher preparation program to include certain training related to teaching in a virtual learning environment as a component of instruction; providing that a county board of education may authorize a county superintendent of schools, under certain circumstances, to provide virtual education days to students instead of closing the public schools in the county because of severe weather conditions; altering the requirements for virtual schools established by a county board of education; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the inclusion of virtual education training for teachers, allows virtual education days during severe weather, establishes standards and approval processes for virtual schools, and creates plans and regulations for operating public schools during prolonged emergencies with a focus on virtual learning.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Public school students, teachers, school administrators, and families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces comprehensive standards, training, and operational plans for virtual education, including during emergencies, and promotes the development of virtual schools with quality standards and oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by expanding access to virtual education and support services, especially for underserved populations.

Title: Gaming - Sports Wagering - Independent Evaluation of Sports Wagering Content and Sports Wagering Facility Application Amendments
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Lottery and Gaming Control Commission to identify and license certain independent evaluators to evaluate and rate certain sports wagering content provided by sports wagering experts, sports wagering influencers, and content partners; authorizing the Commission and the Sports Wagering Application Review Commission to consider a request to amend a Class B-2 sports wagering facility license application for the purpose of altering the proposed location of the facility under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a licensing and evaluation system for independent evaluators of sports wagering content in Maryland, requiring the Maryland Lottery and Gaming Control Commission to identify, license, and regulate these evaluators, and mandates that sports wagering licensees contract with them for content evaluation.
responsible_party: Maryland Lottery and Gaming Control Commission
stakeholders: Sports wagering licensees, sports wagering content creators, sports wagering consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal licensing and regulation process for independent evaluators of sports wagering content, employing a new approach to content oversight in the sports betting industry.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing on content regulation within sports wagering.

Title: Health Services Cost Review Commission - Members - Appointment
Synopsis: Requiring that the members of the Health Services Cost Review Commission be appointed with the advice and consent of the Senate of Maryland.
bill_summary: This bill requires that members of the Maryland Health Services Cost Review Commission be appointed with the advice and consent of the Maryland Senate.
responsible_party: Maryland Senate and Governor's Office
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland Health Services Cost Review Commission, healthcare policy makers, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal appointment process involving Senate advice and consent for the commission members, enhancing oversight and transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may influence healthcare costs and access indirectly.

Title: Historic St. Mary's City Commission Reform Act of 2023
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of law governing the Historic St. Mary's City Commission, including laws relating to membership of the Commission, appointment of certain officers, Commission meeting times, and duties; and specifying the process for the Commission to collaborate with an affiliated nonprofit organization.
bill_summary: The bill reforms the governance and operations of the Historic St. Mary's City Commission, including membership, collaboration with affiliated nonprofit organizations, and program development, and establishes a dedicated fund.
responsible_party: Historic St. Mary's City Commission
stakeholders: Visitors, students, educators, local community, and stakeholders involved in historic preservation and education in St. Mary's City
innovative_summary: The bill promotes collaboration between the Commission and nonprofit organizations, including developing policies for joint activities and leveraging private fundraising, which introduces a structured approach to public-private partnerships.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but supports educational and cultural programs that could benefit children indirectly.

Title: Law Enforcement Officers’ Pension System – City of Bowie Police Department – Transfers and Purchases of Service
Synopsis: Authorizing a transfer of service credit to, and a purchase of service credit in, the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System for local law enforcement officers of the City of Bowie Police Department hired on or after January 1, 2007, and not later than December 31, 2015, under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill allows certain former employees of the City of Bowie Police Department to transfer or purchase service credits into the Maryland Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System if they meet specific employment and contribution withdrawal conditions, with the opportunity to do so before December 31, 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Former police officers of the City of Bowie Police Department who are eligible to transfer or purchase service credits
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a temporary, specific window for police officers to transfer or purchase service credits, which is a targeted policy change rather than a new technology or innovative approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns pension credit transfers for police officers.

Title: Maternal Mortality Review Program - Local Teams - Access to Records
Synopsis: Requiring certain health care providers and health care facilities to provide to the local team, on request of the chair, prompt access to all relevant medical records associated with a case under review by the Maternal Mortality Review Program without undue delay; and providing that certain provisions of law related to the confidentiality of medical records do not apply to certain disclosures made to a local team.
bill_summary: The bill enhances access to medical records and information for local maternal mortality review teams, requiring healthcare providers and facilities to provide immediate access to relevant records upon request, and clarifies that confidentiality laws do not restrict disclosures to these teams.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Maternal health care providers, local maternal mortality review teams, women whose deaths are being reviewed, and the general public concerned with maternal health outcomes.
innovative_summary: The bill improves the efficiency and immediacy of data access for maternal mortality reviews, streamlining processes and clarifying legal provisions to facilitate timely reviews.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to improve maternal health outcomes, which can indirectly reduce child poverty by promoting healthier pregnancies and births.

Title: Electronic Health Networks and Electronic Medical Records - Nursing Homes - Release of Records
Synopsis: Authorizing a nursing home that contracts with or uses an electronic health information network or electronic medical record vendor to direct the network or vendor to release electronic medical records and electronic health care transactions to a business associate of the nursing home.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes nursing homes in Maryland that use electronic health networks or electronic medical record vendors to direct those vendors to release patient records and health transactions to business associates, with patient or their representative consent, and sets rules for how this information should be released and charged.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or designated health information exchange
stakeholders: Nursing homes, patients, healthcare providers, electronic health record vendors
innovative_summary: The bill facilitates data sharing between nursing homes and business associates through electronic health networks, emphasizing timely and fee-free data exchange, which supports healthcare quality improvement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns data sharing protocols for nursing homes.

Title: Public Safety - State Disaster Recovery Fund
Synopsis: Establishing the State Disaster Recovery Fund to provide disaster recovery assistance to units of local government for individuals and families and for the repair, restoration, reconstruction, or replacement of public facilities, low-interest or no-interest loans to businesses and nonprofits when a federal disaster declaration is not received, and disaster-related assistance for the unmet needs of individuals and families after a federal disaster declaration or in the event of a certain denial of federal assistance; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the State Disaster Recovery Fund as a nonlapsing fund to provide disaster-related assistance to individuals, families, and local governments when federal disaster aid is not received, and sets rules for its administration, funding, and reporting.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: Individuals, families, local governments, businesses, and nonprofits affected by disasters in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program creates a dedicated, perpetual disaster recovery fund with specific rules for use, investment, and reporting, integrating state and local efforts with federal disaster response.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The fund has the potential to directly assist vulnerable populations affected by disasters, which can help reduce child poverty in disaster-impacted communities.

Title: Real Estate - Real Estate Brokerage Services and Termination of Residential Real Estate Contracts (The Anthony Moorman Act)
Synopsis: Requiring a real estate broker or an escrow agent, if a purchaser terminates a certain transaction under certain circumstances, to distribute trust money to the purchaser within 30 days after a certain written notice of the termination is sent; requiring a holder of trust money who makes a certain distribution to notify the seller and purchaser of the distribution within a certain period of time, subject to a certain exception; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes rules for the distribution of trust money in real estate transactions, including procedures for termination of transactions, notification requirements, and dispute resolution processes involving escrow agents and real estate brokers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation (or relevant real estate regulatory agency)
stakeholders: Real estate buyers, sellers, brokers, and escrow agents in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces structured procedures for trust money distribution and dispute resolution, including notification and protest processes, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on trust money distribution procedures is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Annual Corrective Bill
Synopsis: Correcting certain errors or omissions in certain articles of the Annotated Code; clarifying language; correcting certain obsolete references; reorganizing certain sections of the Annotated Code; providing that this Act is not intended to affect any law other than to correct technical errors; and providing for the correction of certain errors and obsolete provisions by the publishers of the Annotated Code.
bill_summary: This bill is an annual correction bill that amends various sections of Maryland law to fix errors, update references, and clarify language across multiple articles, including health, education, natural resources, public safety, and more.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Legislative Services and publishers of the Annotated Code of Maryland
stakeholders: Maryland residents, government agencies, and organizations affected by the technical corrections and updates in the law
innovative_summary: The bill employs a systematic approach to correcting and updating legal references and language, which is a standard legal housekeeping process rather than an innovative program employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is minimal as it mainly corrects technical errors and updates legal references without establishing new programs or interventions directly targeting child poverty.

Title: Home Amenity Rentals - Sales and Use Tax Imposed and Local Tax Authorized
Synopsis: Applying the sales and use tax to a sale or use of certain home amenity rentals; and authorizing a county or municipality to impose a certain home amenity rental tax under certain circumstances and subject to certain limitations.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Maryland counties and municipalities to impose a local tax on home amenity rentals, which are short-term rental uses of residential property portions occupied for up to 15 hours. It sets the framework for the tax rates, procedures, and definitions related to these rentals.
responsible_party: Maryland counties and municipalities for implementing and collecting the local home amenity rental tax
stakeholders: Owners and operators of short-term home rentals, local governments, and residents in affected areas
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new local tax specifically targeting home amenity rentals, utilizing existing tax frameworks and allowing digital platforms to facilitate collection, which is a modern approach to local taxation of short-term rentals.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns taxation policies for short-term rentals.

Title: Department of Natural Resources' Real Property - Exchange With Private Real Property
Synopsis: Authorizing the State to exchange real property owned by the State for the use and benefit of the Department of Natural Resources with private real property under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to exchange certain state-owned land for privately owned land under specific conditions without following the usual procedures, and clarifies rules for the sale or transfer of certain state properties.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: State of Maryland, landowners, local governments
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a streamlined process for land exchanges between the state and private owners, reducing procedural requirements under specific conditions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may influence land use and community development indirectly.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Military Service Credit
Synopsis: Authorizing members of the State Retirement and Pension System to receive service credit at the rate of 4 months for each full year of attendance at a United States service academy that interrupts the member's employment, not to exceed a total of 16 months.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes members of the Maryland State Retirement System to receive credit for military service, including attendance at U.S. service academies, and outlines the conditions and limits for such credits.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland State Retirement System with military service or academy attendance
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific provision for granting retirement credit for attendance at U.S. service academies, which is a specialized approach within military service credit policies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns retirement benefits for military service members.

Title: Vehicle Laws – Certificate of Title – Surviving Spouse
Synopsis: Prohibiting the Motor Vehicle Administration from charging a fee for the issuance of a new certificate of title to a surviving spouse under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration from charging a fee for issuing a new certificate of title to a surviving spouse when ownership of a vehicle is transferred upon the death of the owner.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Surviving spouses and vehicle owners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific exemption from fees for a particular vehicle title transfer, simplifying the process for surviving spouses.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Public Safety - Deputy State Fire Marshal - Probationary Status and Promotion
Synopsis: Requiring a certain deputy State fire marshal to be on probation for a period of 2 years after the date of appointment to the Office of the State Fire Marshal under certain circumstances; and specifying the pay that a certain deputy State fire marshal is entitled to on promotion.
bill_summary: The bill establishes that deputy State Fire Marshals must serve a 2-year probationary period after appointment, and clarifies pay and promotion rules for police employees and fire marshals, including pay steps upon promotion.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Deputy State Fire Marshals, police employees, and related public safety personnel in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates probation and pay rules for public safety personnel; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing on public safety personnel policies.

Title: Public Health - Youth Camps, Development Organizations, and Programs - Criminal History Records Checks
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to apply to the Criminal Justice Information System Central Repository for criminal history records checks for certain youth camp applicants; requiring that the Department issue a certain written determination to a youth camp within 3 business days; repealing the authority of youth development organizations and programs to request from the Department a determination of whether the results of a criminal history records check would prohibit the hiring of a job applicant; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to conduct criminal history checks for youth camp applicants and to provide a written determination on whether the results would prohibit hiring. It also repeals the authority of youth development organizations to request such determinations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Youth camp applicants, youth camps, and related organizations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a systematic approach to criminal background checks for youth camp staff, integrating federal and state records checks and providing timely written determinations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on safety and employment screening.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Commercial Driver's Licenses and Instructional Permits - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the expiration date for a commercial driver's instructional permit held by certain individuals; and exempting a holder of a commercial driver's license who applies for renewal from the requirement to pass a vision test if the holder has a current certificate of physical examination on file with the Motor Vehicle Administration.
bill_summary: The bill updates regulations for commercial driver’s licenses and instructional permits, including extending the expiration date for certain permits and exempting some license renewals from vision tests if a current physical exam certificate is on file.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Commercial drivers and applicants for commercial driver’s licenses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a regulatory exemption for commercial drivers renewing their licenses, reducing the need for vision tests if a recent physical exam is on file, which streamlines the renewal process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on licensing regulations for commercial drivers.

Title: State Board of Architects - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Architects in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2028, the termination provisions relating to certain statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Architects in Maryland from 2023 to 2028, continuing its authority and functions.
responsible_party: State Board of Architects in the Department of Maryland
stakeholders: Architects and the public seeking architectural services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing regulatory body without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Board of Certified Interior Designers - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Certified Interior Designers in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2034, the termination provisions relating to certain statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Certified Interior Designers in Maryland from 2024 to 2034, continuing its regulatory authority.
responsible_party: State Board of Certified Interior Designers in the Department of Business and Occupations and Professions
stakeholders: Interior designers and consumers of interior design services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing regulatory body without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Board of Foresters - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Foresters in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2035, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Foresters, allowing it to continue operating until July 1, 2035.
responsible_party: State Board of Foresters
stakeholders: Foresters and related professionals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing regulatory body without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Board of Examiners of Landscape Architects - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Examiners of Landscape Architects in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2034, the termination provisions relating to certain statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Examiners of Landscape Architects from 2024 to 2034, continuing its regulatory authority.
responsible_party: State Board of Examiners of Landscape Architects
stakeholders: Landscape architects and related professionals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing regulatory body's sunset date; it does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Board of Stationary Engineers - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Stationary Engineers in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2034, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill extends the termination date of the State Board of Stationary Engineers from July 1, 2024, to July 1, 2034, thereby continuing its existence and authority.
responsible_party: State Board of Stationary Engineers
stakeholders: Stationary engineers and related industries in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing regulatory body and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Voluntary Cleanup Program - Determination and Recordation Deadlines
Synopsis: Altering determination and recordation deadlines for the Voluntary Cleanup Program.
bill_summary: This bill amends the deadlines for determination and recordation in the Maryland Voluntary Cleanup Program, extending the time for notification and recordation from 45 days to 60 days, and clarifies procedures for recording determinations and certificates of completion.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Property owners, environmental cleanup participants, local governments
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates procedural deadlines and recordation requirements, without introducing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it focuses on procedural updates for environmental cleanup programs.

Title: Public Safety - State Fuel Security Program
Synopsis: Establishing the State Fuel Security Program to be administered and enforced by the Maryland Energy Administration; applying the Program to motor gasoline, middle distillate, propane, certain residential fuel oil, and aviation gasoline; authorizing the Administration, in coordination with the Department of Emergency Management and the Department of Information Technology, to collect, store, and disseminate certain energy-related data for a certain purpose and subject to certain requirements; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland State Fuel Security Program to manage and allocate fuel resources during energy emergencies, including setting fuel percentage requirements and creating an assignment system for essential activities.
responsible_party: Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Fuel suppliers, emergency services, essential service providers, and the general public during energy emergencies
innovative_summary: The program employs a structured fuel assignment and priority system during emergencies, with data collection and coordination among agencies, representing a new approach to energy security management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a moderate impact on child poverty by ensuring fuel and energy availability during emergencies, supporting essential services and vulnerable populations.

Title: Horse Racing - Extension of Maryland Horse Racing Act and Establishment of Maryland Thoroughbred Racetrack Operating Authority
Synopsis: Extending the termination date of the Maryland Horse Racing Act from July 1, 2024, to July 1, 2034; establishing the Maryland Thoroughbred Racetrack Operating Authority; establishing the Maryland Racing Operations Fund to assist the Authority in financing the acquisition, construction, rehabilitation, or other expenses for thoroughbred racetracks in the State; authorizing the Maryland Stadium Authority to transfer money from the Racing and Community Development Facilities Fund to the Maryland Racing Operations Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill extends the Maryland Horse Racing Act's termination date to 2034, establishes the Maryland Thoroughbred Racetrack Operating Authority, creates the Maryland Racing Operations Fund, and allocates funds for racetrack improvements and development, including the redevelopment of Pimlico and Laurel Park racecourses.
responsible_party: Maryland Thoroughbred Racetrack Operating Authority
stakeholders: Thoroughbred horse racing industry, racetrack operators, local communities near racetracks, and state government
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new state authority dedicated to managing and supporting thoroughbred racetrack operations, along with establishing a dedicated fund for racetrack development and maintenance, employing a structured governance and funding approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to impact child poverty indirectly through economic development and job creation related to racetrack improvements and operations.

Title: Income Tax - Credit for Federal Security Clearance Costs - Alterations
Synopsis: Reestablishing a time period of taxable years from December 21, 2022, to January 1, 2028, for a credit against the Maryland income tax for certain costs incurred by employers to obtain federal security clearances for employees, rent certain spaces, and construct or renovate certain sensitive compartmented information facilities in the State; limiting eligibility for the income tax credit to individuals or corporations that employ not more than 500 employees; and applying the Act to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022.
bill_summary: The bill extends and modifies the existing income tax credit for costs incurred by employers to obtain federal security clearances for employees, rent certain spaces, and construct or renovate sensitive compartmented information facilities (SCIFs). It limits eligibility to employers with no more than 500 employees and sets specific limits on the amount of credit available for various costs.
responsible_party: Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Employers involved in security clearance, space rental, and SCIF construction in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program provides targeted tax credits to support security-related infrastructure and administrative costs for small to medium-sized businesses, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it mainly provides tax credits to businesses for security-related expenses.

Title: State Department of Assessments and Taxation – Mandatory Retirement Age – Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the mandatory retirement age for the Director of the State Department of Assessments and Taxation and the supervisor of assessments for a county.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the mandatory retirement age of 70 for the Director of the Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation and county supervisors of assessments, allowing them to serve beyond age 70.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Directors and supervisors of assessments in Maryland, government agencies, taxpayers
innovative_summary: The bill removes a mandatory retirement age, which is a change in employment policy rather than an innovative program or service.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Corporations and Associations - Electronic Copies Fee - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing a $1-per-page fee for electronic copies of certain documents recorded or filed with the State Department of Assessments and Taxation.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the $1 per page fee for electronic copies of documents filed with the Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Businesses and individuals requesting electronic copies of documents from the Department
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies fee collection by removing a per-page fee for electronic copies, streamlining access to documents.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly affects document fee policies.

Title: Health Insurance Carriers - Requirements for Internal Grievance Process - Modification
Synopsis: Altering the process by which a health insurance carrier is required to provide notice of an adverse decision in nonemergency cases under the internal grievance process established by the carrier for its members.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the internal grievance process for health insurance carriers in Maryland, requiring them to inform members of adverse decisions via oral or expedited means and to send detailed written notices within five days.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Health insurance members and providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces more immediate and detailed communication requirements for adverse decisions, including oral notifications and expedited means of communication.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on administrative procedures.

Title: Insurance - Product and Service Offerings
Synopsis: Authorizing certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations to offer and provide certain products or services in conjunction with a policy at no charge or at a discounted price under certain circumstances; and prohibiting certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations from increasing a premium or denying a claim of a policyholder if the policyholder accepts, rejects, uses, or fails to use a certain product or service.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes insurers, nonprofit health plans, and health maintenance organizations to offer products or services at no charge or discounted prices in conjunction with insurance policies, provided they meet certain criteria. It also prohibits these entities from increasing premiums or denying claims based on the use or rejection of such products or services.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Policyholders and insured individuals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach to health and insurance services by allowing the offering of additional products or services at no charge or discounted prices to improve health and risk management, integrating health promotion into insurance offerings.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving health outcomes and access to preventive services, which can lead to reduced healthcare costs and improved well-being for children.

Title: State Board of Examiners of Psychologists - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Examiners of Psychologists in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2025, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Examiners of Psychologists in Maryland from July 1, 2023, to July 1, 2026, ensuring the continuation of the Board's authority and functions.
responsible_party: State Board of Examiners of Psychologists in the Department of Health
stakeholders: Psychologists practicing in Maryland and the public they serve
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing regulatory body without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2025, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners from 2024 to 2027, allowing it to continue its regulatory functions until then.
responsible_party: State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners in the Department of Health
stakeholders: Physical therapists and the public seeking physical therapy services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing regulatory body and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Board of Examiners in Optometry - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Examiners in Optometry in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2025, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Examiners in Optometry in Maryland from July 1, 2023, to July 1, 2026, ensuring the board continues to operate and its authority remains in effect.
responsible_party: State Board of Examiners in Optometry, Department of Health
stakeholders: Optometrists and consumers of optometry services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a standard sunset extension process without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Board for Certification of Residential Child Care Program Professionals - Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board for Certification of Residential Child Care Program Professionals in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2025, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board for Certification of Residential Child Care Program Professionals from 2024 to 2027, continuing its authority and functions.
responsible_party: Department of Health or relevant state agency overseeing the Board
stakeholders: Residential child care professionals, children in residential care, child welfare agencies
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends an existing certification board without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but supports quality standards in residential care, which can indirectly benefit children in poverty.

Title: Department of Disabilities - State Coordinator for Autism Strategy and Maryland Commission on Disabilities - Alterations
Synopsis: Transferring the State Coordinator for Autism Strategy to the Department of Disabilities; requiring the Department to provide staff for the Advisory Stakeholder Group on Autism-Related Needs; and altering the membership of the Maryland Commission on Disabilities to add one individual with a traumatic brain injury.
bill_summary: The bill transfers the State Coordinator for Autism Strategy from the Governor's Office to the Department of Disabilities, updates staffing and membership details for the Advisory Stakeholder Group on Autism–Related Needs and the Maryland Commission on Disabilities, and makes related organizational changes.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities, autism community, advocacy organizations, and related service providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily reorganizes existing disability and autism services and committees, with no new technological or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on organizational and staffing changes for disability and autism services.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Manufacturers and Dealers - Allocation of Vehicles
Synopsis: Requiring that any system operated by a vehicle manufacturer, distributor, or factory branch or its affiliate for allocating new vehicles to dealers be reasonable and fair.
bill_summary: The bill requires vehicle manufacturers, distributors, and their affiliates to operate fair and reasonable systems for allocating new vehicles to dealers. It also mandates disclosure of the allocation method upon request and places the burden of proof on the manufacturer in disputes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or relevant vehicle regulatory agency
stakeholders: Vehicle dealers and manufacturers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces transparency and fairness requirements in vehicle allocation, which is a standard practice, but emphasizes disclosure and dispute resolution.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly addresses vehicle allocation fairness.

Title: Access to Counsel in Evictions - Funding
Synopsis: Extending through fiscal year 2027 a requirement that the Comptroller distribute $14,000,000 of certain abandoned property funds to the Access to Counsel in Evictions Special Fund; and extending through fiscal year 2027 a requirement that the Governor include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $14,000,000 from the Fund to the Maryland Legal Services Corporation.
bill_summary: The bill extends the funding requirements for the Access to Counsel in Evictions Special Fund, including the distribution of funds from abandoned property and appropriations to support legal representation in eviction proceedings, through fiscal year 2027.
responsible_party: Maryland Legal Services Corporation (MLSC)
stakeholders: Tenants facing eviction and legal service providers
innovative_summary: The bill employs a dedicated fund and consistent funding allocations to ensure access to legal counsel in eviction cases, which is a structured approach but not highly innovative in terms of technology or new methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by preventing evictions and stabilizing housing for families.

Title: Security Guard Agencies, Security Guard Employers, and Security Guards – Standards and Certifications
Synopsis: Requiring an individual who provides security guard services to the individual's employer to be certified as a security guard, subject to a certain exception; regulating certain security guard employers; altering the certification and renewal standards for security guards; requiring the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission to identify or establish certain training programs for the certification and renewal of certification of security guards; requiring security guards to complete certain security training programs; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new certification, training, and reporting standards for security guards, security guard agencies, and security guard employers in Maryland. It requires security guards to be certified, mandates specific training programs, and introduces reporting requirements for use of force incidents.
responsible_party: Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission
stakeholders: Security guards, security guard agencies, security guard employers, and the general public receiving security services
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to security guard regulation, including certification, training, and incident reporting, with a focus on de-escalation and appropriate interactions, but does not introduce new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving security standards and interactions, especially in vulnerable populations.

Title: State Procurement - Liquidated Damages - Policies and Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the Board of Public Works, in consultation with the Procurement Improvement Council, to publish a model policy on or before January 1, 2024, concerning the inclusion and use of liquidated damages provisions in procurement contracts; requiring a unit of State government to adopt a written policy that is substantially similar to the Board's policy; requiring a unit that decides not to include a liquidated damages clause under certain circumstances to obtain the approval of the head of unit; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Board of Public Works to publish a model policy on liquidated damages in procurement contracts and mandates state agencies to adopt policies similar to this model. It establishes procedures for including, excluding, and reporting on liquidated damages in large procurement contracts, and sets deadlines for policy adoption and reporting.
responsible_party: Board of Public Works and state procurement units
stakeholders: State government agencies, contractors, and vendors involved in large procurement contracts
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured, standardized approach to the use of liquidated damages in government procurement, including the creation of a model policy and reporting requirements, which employs a new, systematic approach to managing contract performance and penalties.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily focuses on procurement policies and contract management.

Title: Offshore Wind Energy - State Goals and Procurement (Promoting Offshore Wind Energy Resources Act)
Synopsis: Requiring an application for any new qualified offshore wind project and a certain proposal for an offshore wind transmission facility to be subject to a certain community benefit agreement; requiring the Public Service Commission to request that PJM Interconnection conduct a certain analysis of transmission system upgrade and expansion options; altering the requirements for a certain report on offshore wind projects; requiring the Commission, by a certain date each year starting in 2024, to report on its Supplier Diversity Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes Maryland's offshore wind energy goals, sets procedures for approving offshore wind projects and transmission facilities, mandates community benefit agreements, promotes workforce diversity, and creates programs for procurement and development of offshore wind energy, including a power purchase agreement and transmission system upgrades.
responsible_party: Public Service Commission and Department of General Services
stakeholders: Offshore wind energy developers, local businesses, minority and women-owned businesses, workers in the offshore wind industry, Maryland residents, and ratepayers.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining offshore wind development, community benefit agreements, workforce diversity initiatives, and regional transmission planning, integrating federal funding mechanisms and advanced transmission solutions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a high potential to impact child poverty by promoting local economic development, job creation, and workforce diversity in the offshore wind industry.

Title: Preservation and Reuse of Historic Complexes Study and Alterations to the Income Tax Credit for Catalytic Revitalization Projects
Synopsis: Allowing multiple final tax certificates to be issued for a catalytic revitalization project in certain circumstances; and requiring the Smart Growth Subcabinet to study Maryland's historic complexes and make recommendations about an implementation plan to address the preservation and reuse of historic complexes in the State on or before December 31, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new Historic Properties Disposition and Preservation Team within the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development, extends the income tax credit for catalytic revitalization projects until 2035, and mandates a study on the preservation and reuse of historic complexes in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Historic property owners, state government, private developers, and communities involved in historic preservation and revitalization
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach by creating a dedicated team for historic property management, extending tax credits, and conducting a statewide study on historic complex preservation, integrating policy, financial incentives, and strategic planning.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has moderate potential to impact child poverty by promoting community revitalization and affordable housing through historic preservation.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Registered Domestic Partnerships
Synopsis: Establishing requirements for the registration and termination of domestic partnerships with the register of wills; repealing provisions on legitimacy and illegitimacy of children and providing for the parentage of a child born or conceived by registered domestic partners; requiring the register of wills to recognize as domestic partnerships relationships established under the laws of other jurisdictions if the laws are substantially similar to the provisions of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes legal recognition for registered domestic partnerships in Maryland, including rules for registration, termination, and inheritance rights, and extends certain benefits and legal considerations to partners in such relationships.
responsible_party: Maryland Register of Wills and relevant state courts
stakeholders: Individuals in or considering entering into registered domestic partnerships, their families, and estate administrators
innovative_summary: The program formalizes and recognizes domestic partnerships legally, providing a structured framework for rights and benefits, which is a significant step in legal recognition of non-marital relationships.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily focusing on legal recognition and inheritance rights for domestic partners.

Title: Economic Development - Cybersecurity - Cyber Maryland Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Cyber Maryland Program in the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to create and execute a talent pipeline that materially reduces workforce vacancies by July 1, 2026, build an advanced cybersecurity workforce, and carry out other purposes related to the cybersecurity workforce in the State; establishing the Cyber Maryland Fund; authorizing the Governor to include an appropriation of $250,000 for the Fund in the annual budget bill for fiscal year 2025 and each fiscal year thereafter; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Cyber Maryland Program to increase and diversify the cybersecurity workforce in Maryland, create a talent pipeline, and support cybersecurity education and research. It also creates the Cyber Maryland Fund and Board to oversee these efforts, and expands existing cybersecurity education programs at Maryland higher education institutions.
responsible_party: Maryland Technology Development Corporation and Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Cybersecurity students, educational institutions, employers seeking cybersecurity talent, and underserved communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive, data-driven approach to workforce development, including research, partnerships, and diversity initiatives, with a focus on innovation and inclusivity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by increasing access to high-demand cybersecurity careers and promoting diversity in the workforce.

Title: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange and Maryland Department of Health - Health Care and Dental Care Coverage for Undocumented Immigrants - Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange and the Maryland Department of Health to develop a report comparing options for offering affordable health care and dental care coverage to State residents who are ineligible for the Maryland Medical Assistance Program, the Maryland Children's Health Program, qualified health plans, or stand-alone dental plans due to the individuals' immigration status; and requiring the Exchange and the Department to report to certain committees of the General Assembly by October 31, 2023.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange and the Maryland Department of Health to develop a report comparing options for providing affordable health and dental coverage to residents ineligible for existing programs due to immigration status, including different groups such as all eligible individuals, minors, seniors, and low-income individuals.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Undocumented immigrants and other residents ineligible for current health programs due to immigration status
innovative_summary: The bill explores new options for providing health coverage to undocumented immigrants, which is a relatively innovative approach in public health policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to impact child poverty by improving access to health coverage for undocumented children and families.

Title: Natural Resources - Annual State Park Pass - Discounts for Law Enforcement Officers and First Responders
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources to provide a discount of at least $40 on annual State park passes for all first responders and law enforcement officers who are Maryland residents.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to provide a minimum $40 discount on annual State park passes for Maryland resident first responders and law enforcement officers.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: First responders and law enforcement officers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a targeted discount program for first responders and law enforcement officers, which is a common approach but tailored to this specific group.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Environmental Health Specialists and Well and Septic Systems Permitting - Studies (Environmental Health Systems Support Act of 2023)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment and the Maryland Department of Health, in conjunction with the Board of Environmental Health Specialists, to conduct a study on staffing needs for environmental health specialists in local health departments; requiring the Department of the Environment, in consultation with the Department of Legislative Services and the University of Maryland Agriculture and Food Systems Extension Program, to study the delegation of well and septic systems permitting authority; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a standardized permit system for on-site sewage disposal systems, promotes consistent standards for environmental health specialists, creates a student loan forgiveness program for environmental health specialists, and mandates studies on staffing needs and the delegation of permitting authority.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Environmental health specialists, local health departments, applicants for sewage disposal permits, students pursuing careers in environmental health
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive approach including a standardized permit system, a loan forgiveness program, and studies on staffing and delegation, employing new approaches to improve environmental health services and workforce development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving environmental health services and workforce, which can lead to healthier communities.

Title: Public Safety - Protecting Against Hate Crimes Grant Fund - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Protecting Against Hate Crimes Grant Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund to make grants to nonprofit organizations, including faith-based organizations, to provide security enhancements to protect against hate crimes; requiring the Executive Director of the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services to administer the Fund; and authorizing, for fiscal year 2025 and each fiscal year thereafter, the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $5,000,000 to the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Protecting Against Hate Crimes Grant Fund to provide grants to nonprofit and faith-based organizations for security enhancements to protect against hate crimes. It authorizes annual funding, sets aside a minimum amount for faith-based organizations, and requires reporting on fund distribution.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention, Youth, and Victim Services
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations, faith-based organizations, and communities targeted by hate crimes in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a dedicated grant fund specifically for security enhancements against hate crimes, with a focus on faith-based organizations, and includes annual reporting and set-aside funds.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it focuses on hate crime prevention and security enhancements.

Title: Local School Systems - Student Field Trips - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include an appropriation in the annual budget bill of $500,000 for the State Department of Education to provide grants to local school systems for expenses related to student field trips to museums of cultural import.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Governor to allocate $500,000 annually in the state budget for grants to local school systems to fund student field trips to specific museums of cultural importance, including the Holocaust Memorial Museum, the National Museum of African American History and Culture, the Jewish Museum of Maryland, and the Reginald F. Lewis Museum of Maryland African American History and Culture.
responsible_party: State Department of Education
stakeholders: Students and local school systems in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted funding and reporting to support educational field trips to culturally significant museums, enhancing cultural understanding and history education.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve educational experiences for students from underserved communities, which could help reduce child poverty impacts.

Title: Libraries - Circulation Records - Inspection, Use, or Disclosure Requirement Revision
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which public, school, college, or university libraries must permit the inspection, use, or disclosure of the circulation record of an individual.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to specify when libraries can inspect, use, or disclose an individual's circulation records, limiting access to cases such as library operations, written consent, or court orders.
responsible_party: Libraries and the Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Library users and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill clarifies privacy protections for library circulation records, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on privacy rules.

Title: Statewide Rental Assistance Voucher Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing a Statewide Rental Assistance Voucher Program in the Department of Housing and Community Development to provide vouchers and housing assistance payments for low-income families that are currently on a waiting list under the federal Housing Choice Voucher Program for housing in units approved by the Department or a public housing agency, in accordance with guidelines under the federal program; and requiring the Department and public housing agencies to administer the State Program.
