bill_summary: The bill establishes a statewide rental assistance voucher program in Maryland to provide housing vouchers and payments for low-income families on federal housing waitlists, managed by the Department of Housing and Community Development and public housing agencies.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Low-income families, elderly, disabled, foster children, military veterans, and homeless individuals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a federal voucher system with a new statewide coordination, prioritization, and reporting structure, but uses existing technology and frameworks.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to reduce child poverty by providing housing stability to low-income families, especially those with children.

Title: Baltimore City - Property Tax - In Rem Foreclosure of Vacant or Nuisance Property
Synopsis: Authorizing certain vacant property or nuisance property located in Baltimore City to be subject to a certain in rem foreclosure process; requiring certain procedures for an in rem foreclosure; requiring Baltimore City to take certain actions to compensate the interested parties in property that has value and is acquired through an in rem foreclosure; specifying the title acquired in an in rem foreclosure; specifying the circumstances under which an in rem foreclosure judgment may be reopened; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Baltimore City to use an in rem foreclosure process to address vacant or nuisance properties, allowing the city to foreclose, sell, or compensate interested parties for such properties.
responsible_party: Baltimore City government
stakeholders: Property owners, interested parties, and residents of Baltimore City affected by vacant or nuisance properties
innovative_summary: The bill employs a specialized in rem foreclosure process tailored for vacant and nuisance properties, including provisions for sale, compensation, and title transfer, which is a relatively innovative approach to property management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by addressing blighted properties that can impact community stability and housing quality.

Title: Firearm Safety - Storage Requirements and Youth Suicide Prevention (Jaelynn's Law)
Synopsis: Altering a certain provision relating to the storage of firearms and ammunition in a location that can be accessed by an unsupervised child; and requiring the Deputy Secretary for Public Health Services to develop a youth suicide prevention and firearm safe storage guide, with recommendations from a stakeholder committee.
bill_summary: The bill enhances firearm storage laws to prevent access by minors and prohibited persons, develops a youth suicide prevention and firearm safe storage guide, and establishes related grants and educational programs.
responsible_party: Department of Health and Public Safety agencies
stakeholders: Minors, families, health and social service providers, law enforcement, firearm owners, and schools in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining legal regulations, educational guides, stakeholder engagement, and grants to improve firearm safety and youth suicide prevention.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by promoting safe firearm storage and preventing youth suicides, which can reduce associated health and safety costs.

Title: State Administrator of Elections - Removal From Office
Synopsis: Altering requirements for the removal from office of the State Administrator of Elections; and repealing the authority of the State Administrator to continue to serve in office until a successor is appointed and confirmed following a certain vote for removal of the State Administrator.
bill_summary: The bill changes the rules for removing the State Administrator of Elections in Maryland, including removing the provision that allows the Administrator to serve until a successor is confirmed after removal.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Electoral officials and the public involved in elections in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies legal procedures for removal, not introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Social Workers - Sunset Extension, Notification of Complete Application, and Workgroup on Social Worker Requirements for Licensure
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Social Work Examiners in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2025, the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board; establishing the Workgroup on Social Worker Requirements for Licensure to make certain findings and recommendations regarding examination and licensure of social workers in the State; requiring the Workgroup to submit its final report to certain committees of the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2024; etc.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the Maryland State Board of Social Work Examiners' authority to July 1, 2025, and establishes a workgroup to explore alternatives to examination requirements for social worker licensure, including developing assessment methods to replace traditional exams.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Social workers, social work applicants, and populations served by social workers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach to social worker licensure by exploring alternative assessment methods to traditional examinations, including bias analysis and development of State-based competency exams.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by increasing access to qualified social workers through more equitable licensure processes.

Title: Annual Curative Bill
Synopsis: Generally curing previous Acts of the General Assembly with possible title defects; and generally repealing and reenacting without amendments certain Acts of the General Assembly that may be subject to possible title defects in order to validate those Acts.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Access to Counsel in Evictions Special Fund to provide funding for legal representation in eviction proceedings and related activities in Maryland. It also corrects references to previous laws regarding legal and transportation processes.
responsible_party: Maryland Legal Services Corporation (MLSC)
stakeholders: Tenants facing eviction, legal service providers, local jurisdictions implementing access to counsel programs
innovative_summary: The bill creates a dedicated fund specifically for providing legal representation in eviction cases, which is a targeted approach to addressing housing insecurity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by stabilizing housing for families with children through legal support.

Title: Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program – Definitions – Therapy Horse
Synopsis: Altering the definition of a "therapy horse" under the Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program by updating the definition of a 'therapy horse' to include horses from licensed stables that are either PATH, Intl. member centers or have EAGALA-certified professionals, and establishes the program's purposes, including veteran outreach, funding, and reducing veteran suicide.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans Affairs
stakeholders: Veterans in Maryland, therapy horse providers, nonprofit organizations supporting veterans
innovative_summary: The program incorporates certified equine therapy providers and aims to enhance veteran mental health through innovative equine-assisted therapy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program primarily targets veteran mental health and does not directly address child poverty.

Title: Natural Resources - Fishing Licenses and Stamps - Exemptions
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Natural Resources to issue an annual fishing license and stamp exemption to governmental entities and nonprofit organizations to provide fishing clinics and instructional opportunities to certain individuals; and altering certain reporting requirements for governmental entities and nonprofit organizations that are issued certain fishing license and stamp exemptions.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to issue exemptions from fishing license requirements to certain organizations and entities. These exemptions allow for fishing clinics, instructional opportunities, and activities for specific populations such as individuals with disabilities, veterans, and underserved residents, including the primary caregivers or representatives of these groups.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities, veterans, underserved residents, organizations providing fishing clinics and activities, caregivers, and representatives involved in fishing activities or instruction.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a targeted exemption program for fishing licenses to facilitate inclusive outdoor recreational activities and educational programs, leveraging regulatory flexibility to promote community engagement and access.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by increasing access to outdoor activities and educational opportunities for underserved populations, which can contribute to social and economic benefits.

Title: Maryland Construction Education and Innovation Fund - Funding - Alteration
Synopsis: Increasing the mandated appropriation that the Governor is required to include for the Maryland Construction Education and Innovation Fund in the annual budget bill from $250,000 to $625,000 for fiscal years 2025 through 2029.
bill_summary: The bill alters the funding appropriations for the Maryland Construction Education and Innovation Fund, increasing the annual budget allocations for fiscal years 2025 through 2029.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the Center supported by the Construction Education and Innovation Fund
stakeholders: Construction industry professionals, students, and educational institutions involved in construction education and innovation in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily focuses on increasing and maintaining funding levels for the existing Construction Education and Innovation Fund; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is minimal as it mainly concerns funding for construction education and innovation programs.

Title: Insurance – Credit for Reinsurance Model Law – Reciprocal Jurisdictions
Synopsis: Prohibiting the Maryland Insurance Commissioner from removing from a certain list of reciprocal jurisdictions created and published by the Commissioner certain jurisdictions located outside the United States and certain jurisdictions in the United States that meet certain accreditation requirements.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the Maryland Insurance Commissioner from removing certain jurisdictions from the list of reciprocal jurisdictions for reinsurance, specifically those outside the U.S. that meet international agreements or accreditation standards, and U.S. jurisdictions that meet accreditation standards.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Insurance companies, reinsurers, and policyholders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill maintains existing international and national accreditation standards for reciprocal jurisdictions, with no new technological or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland Historical Trust - Warner Manor in the Town of Kensington - Extinguishment or Termination of Easement
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Historical Trust, on or before July 1, 2023, to extinguish or terminate a certain easement the Trust holds in the parcel of land known as Warner Manor (also known as Brainard Warner House and/or Circle Manor) in the Town of Kensington, Montgomery County; and requiring the Trust to complete certain necessary recordings and filings to complete the extinguishment or termination of the easement.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Historical Trust to extinguish or terminate a specific easement on Warner Manor in Kensington by July 1, 2023, and to complete all necessary legal filings to finalize this process.
responsible_party: Maryland Historical Trust
stakeholders: Property owners and historical preservation entities involved with Warner Manor in Kensington
innovative_summary: The bill involves a legal process to extinguish an easement, which is a standard legal procedure, not an innovative program or approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Higher Education - Maryland 529 Program - Reform
Synopsis: Abolishing and repealing the Maryland 529 Board; specifying that the State Treasurer is the successor to the Maryland 529 Board; transferring to the Office of the State Treasurer the responsibility for administering the Maryland 529 Program, including the Maryland Prepaid College Trust, the Maryland College Investment Plan, the Maryland Broker-Dealer College Investment Plan, and the Maryland ABLE Program; authorizing and requiring the State Treasurer to take certain actions in administering the Maryland 529 Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reforms the Maryland 529 college savings programs by abolishing the Maryland 529 Board, transferring its responsibilities to the State Treasurer, and establishing new programs and oversight mechanisms, including a workgroup to address issues with the prepaid college trust.
responsible_party: Office of the State Treasurer of Maryland
stakeholders: Maryland residents, families saving for college, students, and individuals with disabilities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive overhaul of college savings programs, including new investment options, state contributions, and a workgroup to improve access and transparency, employing modern program management and oversight approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has high potential to impact child poverty by increasing access to affordable higher education savings options and providing targeted contributions for low-income families.

Title: Anne Arundel County – Alcoholic Beverages Licenses – Residency Requirement
Synopsis: Requiring a certain applicant for an alcoholic beverages license in Anne Arundel County to be a resident of the State, rather than the county, when an application for a license is filed; and providing that a certain license is valid only for as long as the resident applicant remains a resident of the State.
bill_summary: The bill requires that applicants for alcoholic beverage licenses in Anne Arundel County must be residents of Maryland, and the license is only valid as long as the applicant remains a Maryland resident.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Alcoholic Beverages Licensing Board
stakeholders: Applicants for alcohol licenses, residents of Anne Arundel County and Maryland, local businesses
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a residency requirement for alcohol license applicants, linking license validity to continued residency, which is a new regulatory approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily changes licensing residency requirements.

Title: Income Tax - Captive Real Estate Investment Trusts - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "captive REIT" for purposes of a certain addition modification under the Maryland income tax in the amount of the federal dividends paid deduction for captive real estate investment trusts to exclude, under certain circumstances, corporations, trusts, or associations owned or controlled by certain qualified foreign entities and certain trusts owned or controlled by a listed Australian property trust.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland income tax rules for captive real estate investment trusts (REITs), specifically excluding certain foreign-controlled entities from the definition of a captive REIT and clarifying tax treatment.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Real estate investment trusts, foreign entities involved in real estate investments, and Maryland taxpayers with interests in REITs
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific definitions and exclusions for foreign-controlled entities within the Maryland tax code for REITs, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly changes tax definitions and rules for certain investment trusts.

Title: State-Owned Nursing Homes - Deficiencies, Citations, and Fines - Contractor Reporting Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring contractors operating State-owned nursing homes to promptly provide notice of certain deficiencies, enforcement actions, citations, and fines to the Governor, the State agency overseeing the nursing home, certain committees of the General Assembly, and members of the General Assembly who represent the district in which the nursing home is located; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires contractors operating State-owned nursing homes in Maryland to promptly notify the state government and relevant committees about deficiencies, citations, and enforcement actions. It also mandates annual reporting by the Maryland Department of Health on survey activities and enforcement actions at these nursing homes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Residents of State-owned nursing homes, contractors operating these nursing homes, Maryland state government, and oversight committees.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured reporting and notification system for deficiencies and enforcement actions in State-owned nursing homes, enhancing transparency and accountability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily focuses on oversight of nursing homes.
